loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia J. C. belongs to the communal bank Working Women of Campo Ferial. She sells breakfasts in the market of Yungay province (in Ancash department).

The previous loan she received was used as an investment in her business to improve her earnings.

Mrs.J. wants to purchase the food necessary to prepare enough breakfasts to make her business profitable. She is planning on returning the loan in four months.

Virginia is 36 years old, married with children and she works hard to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase food to prepare and sell

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
My name is Asma V.. I have been married for five years and have two children, a boy and a girl. We live in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore, where I run a beauty saloon within my house. My husband works at a local factory, and we also have a rickshaw that we rent out to supplement our income. We bought this rickshaw by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Currently, we need a loan to repair it.

My sub group members are: Alice and Zahida, both of whom run separate beauty salons, and Voliet B., who is borrowing for her daughter, a dentist. I request your help for all of us so that our simple dream of a nice and comfortable life can become a simple reality.

loans.use: To repair our rickshaw

loans.name: Yao

texts.en: Yao is married and the father of four children. Two of his children are in school. He has been selling and fixing electrical wires, repairing radios and cassette players and other electronic gadgets in his town for some years now. He wants a loan to buy more lead and cooper cables and wires to enable him expand his operations and also to increase his income to support his wife and take care of their children’s education. He plans to start saving with this new loan. Yao is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning It Is God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Yao’s photo was taken during the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy electrical cables and wires

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Tabia M.. She is married and has three children, ages 1, 5, and 8.

In 2007, Tabia established her auto repair business. Tabia needs a loan to buy a mechanical metal grinder for her garage. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a mechanical metal grinder for her auto repair business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor A. lives in Yavan city. She is divorced, without children, and lives with her parents. She has a secondary school education and works as a teacher in a secondary school. In addition, she helps her parents on their farm. She sows vegetables and other grain crops. She has been farming for 10 years. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Her harvest is partially used for her family’s subsistence, and they sell the rest to turn a profit. She expects to pay back her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизова Гульбахор проживает в городе Яван. Разведена. Живет с родителями. Детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того , чтобы помогать родителям занимается земледелием. Сеет овощи и различные злаковые культуры. Занимается земледелием уже 10 лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того , чтобы закупить удобрения и семена. Получаемый урожай частично используют в хозяйстве для своей семьи, а часть продают и получают прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nji Jacob

texts.en:
Nji Jacob was born on the 3rd of January 1971; he is married and the father of three children. Things have not been going well for him since childhood. His parents were poor and were unable to educate him; things became more difficult for him when his mother died, and as if that was not enough, his wife died mysteriously. He had to struggle as a man until  he became a member of GHAPE; he was trained on how to start with life without money. Thereafter he took his first loan and invested it in pig farming; he learned how to ride okada (motorbike) in the year 2004. Since then he has been managing well. 
If given a loan he will buy his personal motorbike, get a driving license, and pay all necessary documents. He is quite sure his business is going to be successful because he started it from the day he became a member of GHAPE which implies he has a lot of experience in the business, moreover, he will be the owner of the bike which is going to give him more benefit.
He has 18 months to repay the loan. The first installment of the repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of a two-wheel motorbike

loans.name: 1º De Abril Group

texts.es:
This community bank is located in a poor neighborhood and is dedicated to the sale of beauty products and the sale of food. The president is Ms. Rosee Mary, unmarried with a 9 year-old son. She is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics and clothing in bulk. These women are very hardworking and entrepreneurial. Fernanda, Andrea, Valeria and Iris sell cosmetics, Lidia sells hamburgers, Karina and Verónica sell food, Guadalupe rents movies, Patzi has lodging, Natalia promotes books, Celsa and Mary have a family pension, Luz serves a neighbourhood store and Janneth has a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Este banco comunal esta ubicado en un barrio marginal, se dedican a la venta D. productos D. belleza y venta D. alimentos. La presidenta es la señora Rosse Mary, es soltera y tiene un hijo D. 9 años; se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y ropa por mayor. Estas señoras son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Fernanda, Andrea, Valeria e Iris venden cosméticos, Lidia venD. hamburguesas, Karina y verónica venden comida, Guadalupe alquila películas, Patzi tiene un hospedaje, Natalia es promotora D. libros, Celsa y Mary tienen una pensión familiar, Luz atienD. una tienda D. barrio y Janneth tiene una panadería.

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria decidió emprender un negocio propio, para poder satisfacer todos los gastos económicos del hogar, y con la ayuda de su esposo lo ha logrado satisfactoriamente. Hoy en día ya son 5 años de dedicarle todo lo mejor a este negocio, para poder obtener buenas ganancias, tener buenos clientes y así poder solventar todos los gastos económicos y la escuela de sus hijos. Gracias a que le ha puesto empeño a su negocio hasta hoy en día le ha dejado buenas ganancias, y tiene muy buenos clientes, gracias al delicioso sazón que ella le pone a todas sus comidas.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancía, compra de vaporeras y compra de tanque de gas, para el negocio, ella confía en el apoyo de Kiva podrá seguir con su negocio
texts.en:
Victoria decided to open her own busines to satisfy the economic needs of her household and with the help of her husband she has succeeded. Today she has dedicated five years to improving her business to get good income, good customers, and to pay for all of the economic costs and school for her children. From her efforts in this business, she has had good earnings and very good customers, thanks to the delicious flavor that she gives to all of her meals. She is applying for a loan of US $475 that will be repaid in 6 months for the purchase of merchandise, steamers and a tank of gas for her business. She relies on the support of Kiva to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Reshma Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Resham Kumari M. is a single lady who is a tailor in the town of Tikhidewal in Lalitpur. She lives with her father and one brother. Her father is a farmer, and her brother is studying at a secondary school.

Before starting her own business, Mrs. M. took a 6 month training course in tailoring. She opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses, like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, long ladies dresses, Makhshi, and others.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for Rs 10,000 ($150.00). She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: Buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael I. has a business selling plastics. The sales of plastic items such as buckets, laundry baskets, plates, bowls and containers for carrying things is a lucrative business for Rachael. She is 29 years old and single.

She is happy with her business because she has been able to attract customers. She is requesting a loan N120,000 so she can purchase more plastics to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira A. is 52 years old. She is married with three adult children. For almost for 10 years, Nazira has had a beauty salon. Every day, she services many brides. She offers bridal dresses, manicures, pedicures, make-up and hair styles. Her salon is always full of clients, because she does her job professionally. 

She wants to take a loan to expand her business. She wants to buy additional equipment and hire an employee. Nazira likes her job very much, because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides every day.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia.  While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has 8 branch offices throughout Tajikistan and their entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of  October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549.  Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods for her beauty shop

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta C. F., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the villagers and passing tourists 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1500 Tala (~625 USD).

SPBD loans are Loretta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a freezer and goods for the shop.

loans.use: Purchase freezer, herring, milk, twisties, spaghetti, coils, and oil

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy T. lives in Prey May Lang Choreng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She and her farm face a problem because her field is infertile. In order to grow a good crop, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. T. Sokhum, owns a plow which her rents out to other villages. Mrs. Dy T. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom attends the local school. Her second child repairs cars and her third is a laborer. Her husband is shown here with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло Сафарова проживает в городе Куляб в Восейском районе. Возраст 45 лет , замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей одежды. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahlo S. lives in the town of Kulyab in the Vosei region. She is 45 years old and is married with five children. For the past four years she has worked in clothing sales. Her vending point is located at the central market. She brings clothes from Dushanbe. She plans to get a loan in order to increase cash flow. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Doña Petronila tiene 63 años de edad, con cuatro hijos mayores de edad reside en el barrio laureles norte, su oficio es lavar y planchar ropa ajena lo cual hace desde hace diez años para poder cubrir sus necesidades, sus hijos le ayudan con sus gasto. Sus planes es poder mejorar su vivienda ya que su piso es de tierra y no tiene división de cuarto y también hay que repellar las paredes, su casa es muy sencilla pero se siente contenta de tener donde vivir ya que muchos nicaragüenses no tiene un techo. Doy gracias a Afodenic por poder ayudarme a hacer las mejoras a mi casa y poder gozar de un techo digno.
texts.en:
Petronila is 63 years old, has four grown children, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. Her business involves laundering and ironing people’s clothes, an activity she has carried out for ten years in order to cover her needs; her children help with her expenses. Her plan is to be able to make some improvements to her home, as she currently has a dirt floor and no wall to separate the bedroom. She also needs to plaster the walls. Her home is very simple, but she is grateful to have a roof over her head as many Nicaraguans do not. I give thanks to Afodenic for helping me to make some improvements to my home and be able to enjoy a dignified dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a wall to separate a bedroom and also to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Sadjida

texts.en:
Sadjida E. is a married woman with three children. With the knowledge she acquired from her parents and grandparents, she has been successful in raising cattle in a special space in her home. Sadjida's work in animal sales generates a nice amount of income for her family. Currently she has four cows in her house, but she would like to increase the variety of her animals over time, which is why she is now seeking a loan in the amount of $700. Sadjida’s dream is to see her children complete their studies.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en: Simativa A. is 43 years old and married with six children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business, and sells to the public seven days per week. Simativa has no previous loans with Kiva partner, SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 WST. SPBD loans are Simativa’s only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, a cooler, and fishing equipment such as goggles, a spear and a torch

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei is divorced and has two two sons, who are 20 and 24 years old. He sells food in a small grocery store in the city of Vasilyevka. He has owned this business for 10 years. At first, he rented the store. Because the business was good, he decided to buy the store. The store is open 24 hours per day and offers its customers a wide variety of food. Sergei spends his income on his children’s education. He is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking person, constantly looking for new business opportunities. Sergei would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of goods offered in his store. He hopes to increase the sales and generate more profit for his business and family needs.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods in his store

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela L. is 38 years old and a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She is very industrious and takes care of raising their hogs with the help of her husband. She personally manages their hog-raising business, which is doing well. She is a savvy business woman, and the ups and downs of the business are normal to her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return.

Now she sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 30,000 from Paglaum MPC to buy hog feed and vitamins. She hopes deeply to own a bigger concrete piggery someday and become successful hog supplier to the market.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for the hogs

loans.name: Chibogu

texts.en:
E. sells medicine and has been in business since 1998. She is a trained nurse and retired from a private practice to run her own pharmacy. She needs to borrow 140,000 nairas to increase her inventory so that she can meet her customer’s needs. 
E. is 44 years old, married and has five children. She says thank you for the help she has been receiving from LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 31 años, es una mujer muy cariñosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 46 años y sus 4 hijos: Jorge de 10, Rosa de 8, Vanesa de 6 y Marco de 4 años y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. A dos cuadras de la plaza principal de Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar departamento de Puno) se encuentra la tienda de abarrotes de Nelly, la cual es muy concurrida por los vecinos de su barrio, puesto que es una vendedora muy agradable, amable y siempre recibe a su compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace con mucha habilidad y paciencia, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para un futuro cercano, Nelly espera que su negocio crezca y pueda incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, para lo que tendrá que ahorrar poco a poco de sus ganancias. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus demás compañeras. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para su tienda, así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Nelly, 31 years old, is a warm and cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Jorge, 46 years old, and their four children: Jorge, Rosa, Vanesa, and Marco, who are 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old, respectively. Nelly's greatest desire is to give a good life to her children. Two blocks from the main plaza of Nuñoa (district of the province of Melgar and the department of Puno) is Nelly's grocery store. It is very popular with people of her neighborhood because she is a saleswoman very pleasant and kind and always greets her customers with a smile. She enjoys selling very much and has the ability and the patience to do so. She has done this work for seven years and feels that the most difficult part of her work is being confined inside the store all day. In the near future, Nelly hopes that her business grows and that the number of products she offers increases, so she can increase her income. This is her second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she feels a responsibility to make her payments on time. To make timely payments, she must save a little every day from her earnings. She is a very active and supportive member of her village bank, which has earned her the respect of her peers. With the requested $600, she will buy more products for her store and therefore offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel sells drinks and groceries. She has been in the business for 20 years. Mabel has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and the loans have been a source of capital to her business. She has 2 children and she is 61 years old. Mabel lives in Lagos State. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase of more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay S. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and their one lovely young child, in their small family home. Lay S. is currently a local farmer, growing rice and some vegetables. Her husband, Doeun Choeun, age 27, is a marble seller. Lay S. is looking for a loan to purchase a pair of water buffalo which she will use to supply her farming operations and to transport marble to sell. Note: Lay S. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of water buffalo

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 53 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Felicia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Felicia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es: El señor Mauricio José P. Martínez, tiene la edad de 32 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como docente para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo a su cargo de dos años de edad, don Mauricio labora como Ebanista desde hace once años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la alza de la madera, lo cual no le permite obtener muchas ganancias, durante cuatro ciclo de financiamiento a logrado mejorar parte de la vivienda y esta contento con el apoyo que siempre le hemos brindado . Los planes futuros hacia su vivienda es poder ver construida su casa. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y seguir haciendo las mejoras que necesita su vivienda todo esto gracia al financiamiento lo cual se siente sastifecho.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion y poder terminar de hacer mejora a su vivienda

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. V. is a resident of an island village in the beautiful town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 42 years old and married to Severino who is her partner in business. She is a mother to eight: seven sons and an only daughter. She is a woman with clear foresight of the future of her family.

It is more than a decade already that Marites has been running the fishing business but, due to insufficient capital, sometimes she encounters problems regarding her business needs. In 2009, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hopes of getting access to capital for her dying business. When she received her first loan, she invested it in her fishing business. It was successful and the business now brings her a good income to sustain the needs of her family.

Marites has a fish cage where she cultures small fish until they are ready to harvest and sell in the market. She has regular customers already and sometimes she roams around the village and even in the market to sell fish.

Now on her 2nd loan, she proposes a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her fishing business. The amount will be used to pay for a bundle of fishnet, fifty pieces of bamboo and payment for the labor of making the fish cage. She hopes to expand her business and be able to save for the future of her children, especially their school needs.

loans.use: To buy items needed go make a fish cage

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 07 hijos, vive en el Barrio Central, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años ella es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ropa.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar D. ropa casacas, pabnatlones, camisas, etc, la señora Hilaria también se dedica a la compra venta D. ají y a la crianza D. ganado mayor.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank, located in Villa Queñuani, in the Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 60 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in the Barrio Central neighborhood, and did not have the opportunity to study.

She has been working the the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian women's rights organization) for several years. She is one of the founding members of her communal bank. She had her first loan of PEN 300, which let allowed her to increase her capital for her clothing sales business.

Now she needs a new loan of PEN 2500, which will allow her to buy jackets, pants, shirts, etc. Hilaria also sells chili peppers and raises livestock.

Her greatest wish is to continue working.

She likes the ease of savings and loans with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets, pants, shirts, etc. in different sizes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth S. is from the village of Manticao in Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Janeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth buys and sells coconut for "copras," the dried coconut meat from which coconut oil is extracted. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP each month.

In 2008, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to buy new items to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Janeth's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana N. dedica su tiempo a la actividad de venta de ropa la que es comercializada por ella misma con mucho entusiasmo para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de ella.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería a sus proveedores la que adquiere ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Es de importancia destacar que por ser viuda, sus esfuerzos son dobles en el negocio y por esta razón requiere a lo inmediato del crédito para continuar la venta de ropa en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandenga, Juana N. sells clothes as a means of sustaining her household. She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more merchandise from her suppliers. Juana will buy clothing for men, women, and children. It is important to note that she is a widow, so she invests twice as much as effort into her business. She needs immediate access to this loan so that she can continue selling clothes from her vending post.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de cuatro hijos(uno menor de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca.
Domitila se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde su casa y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace ochos meses. El primer crédito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en gaseosas y golosinas para vender.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà golosinas y a la vez nylon para arreglar la red que utilizan para pescar. 
La meta de Domitila es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Domitila is a dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old, is the mother of four children (one of which is under 18), she has the support of her husband who works in fishing.

Domitila sells candy and soft drinks, which she does from her home. She has been a member of the “Madres Corajes” communal bank for the past eight months. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in soft drinks and candy to sell.

She currently needs a loan of 700 PEN, with which she will purchase candy, as well as nylon to fix the net that they use for fishing.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, as well as nylon to fix the net that her husband uses to fish

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer trabajadora de 36 años, vive con su esposo Manuel, de también 36 años, y con sus 3 hijos; Guillermo de 14, Ángela de 10 y Ariana de 9 años, en su acogedora vivienda que es propia.

Cada mañana, desde muy temprano, prepara el desayuno para mandar a sus hijos al colegio; así comienza su agitado día, luego se dirige presurosa hacia el cafetín de un centro educativo de su ciudad, donde vende panes con pollo, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros productos comestibles, ya que con su carisma es capaz de convencer hasta el más reacio de sus clientes. Celia trabaja con una socia que está a punto de dejarle todo el negocio, y ella espera ansiosa que esto suceda.
Adicionalmente, vende diferentes productos por campaña, como en el mes de octubre, que le fue muy bien con la venta de turrones (dulces hechos a base de galleta y miel), tradicionales en esta época. 
En la actualidad, con motivo de las fiestas navideñas vende panetones (queque con pasas y frutas), pues desde que lo comentó entre sus conocidos, ya tiene pedidos y está segura que las ventas serán todo un éxito.
Además, ya tiene pensado ahorrar dinero para que en el futuro pueda implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Esta es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, además dentro de su banco comunal es muy respetada porque le gusta participar activamente en las reuniones. Con el dinero que solicita comprará panetones al por mayor, los cuales prácticamente ya los tiene vendidos entre sus familiares y amigos, así busca seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking, 36-year old woman. She lives in a cozy house with her husband Manuel, also age 36, and her 3 children Guillermo, age 14, Ángela, age 10, and Ariana, age 9. Early each morning, she begins her busy day by preparing breakfast for her children before they go to school. Later, she quickly makes her way to the food court in the city's educational center, where she sells chicken sandwiches, sweets, and sodas, among other food items. With her charisma, she is able to convince even the most reluctant of customers to buy from her stand. Celia works with another member of her community bank, who is ready to leave her with the business, and Celia is waiting eagerly for this to happen. In addition, she sells different seasonal products. For example, the month of October went very well due to sales of turrones (a nougat candy made with a base of cookies and honey), which are traditionally eaten during this season. Currently, she anticipates selling panetones (cake with raisins and fruit) during the Christmas season. She has mentioned this to her customers and already has orders, so she is sure her sales will be strong. She plans to save money to open a grocery store in her house, as well. This is the tenth loan she will receive from MFP and she is sure to be punctual in paying each one of her loan payments. In addition, she is well respected within her community bank because she likes to actively participate in the meetings. With the money she is requesting she will buy panetones at wholesale prices to fill the orders her relatives and friends have already placed. In this way, she will continue to make progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchases of panetones to sell.

loans.name: Alberto Ronaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Alberto Ronaldo T. López, Labora como Vigilante en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 El tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para embaldosar el porche de su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberto Ronaldo T. López works as a security guard at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He has two school-age children and is married. He has worked with CEPRODEL [a Kiva field partner] for two years. During this time he has used two loans to invest in home improvements, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent borrower. The current loan is for the purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement, and to pay workers, to place tile on the porch of his house. His goal is to offer better security and quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Don José M. es casado, padre de 4 hijos menores de edad estudiando educación primaria, habita en la comarca La tigra del Jicaro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, es pequeño productor cuya actividad principal es la ganaderia y agricultura, con mas de 30 años de experiencia en esta actividad, está solicitando su primer crédito a AFODENIC y espera contar con el apoyo del fondo kiva para comprar terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para venderlos cuando tengan un mejor peso y obtener ganancias al momento de la comercialización, y de esta manera garantizar la alimentación del nucleo familiar y tener mayores condiciones econòmicas, también espera aumentar su inventario ganadero. Cuenta con lo necesario para realizar esta actividad, ya que su finca presenta buenas condiciones tècnica para el desarrollo del hato, tiene infraestructura de corral, galera, manga, para el desarrollo del ordeño, cuenta con pastos mejorados y de corte, es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad con gran liderazgo, en su futuro espera mejorar la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
José M. is married and has four minor children who attend elementary school. He lives in the La Tigra del Jicaro region in the New Guinea jurisdiction. He is a small producer, and his main activities are ranching and farming. He has over 30 years of experience in these activities. He is asking Afodenic for his first loan, and he hopes to get the support of Kiva funds in order to buy calves. He plans to fatten them in order to sell them when they weigh more. He will get income the moment he sells them. That way he can guarantee feeding his family and having better economic conditions. He also plans to increase his inventory of cattle. He has what he needs to do this. His farm has good technical conditions for the herd’s growth. The infrastructure has a corral, a shed, and a hose for milking. He has meadows that have been cut and improved. He is a well known person in his community, and he is a great leader. In the future he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Cristina Julio

texts.pt:
Cristina Júlio B. nasceu em Maputo tem 33 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos a primeira de 13 e o segundo de 4 anos todos vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo enviando lhe 500.00mt mensalmente, não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque vive numa casa alugada.

Cristina muda se para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia quando é abandonada pelo marido, no mesmo ano ela inicia com os estudos vivendo na casa do avo pois a mãe não tinha condições. Quando frequentava a 8ª classe fica grávida da sua primeira filha e é expulsa de casa, mas como ela entendia de trabalhos de beleza sua tia convida lhe para trabalharem juntas, anos depois ela opta em abrir seu próprio salão de beleza com o fundo que havia colectado e de seguida aproxima se ao Banco novo (uma outra instituição Bancária) solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt para reforçar o seu salão pagou cem problema mas o seu negócio não rendia o suficiente porque tinha que alugar o estabelecimento. Anos depois consegue arranjar um emprego como servente no laboratório da botânica trabalhando das 7;30h as 15:30h auferindo 1.825.00mt e fica sem tempo de cuidar dos seus negócios então emprega alguém que lhe deixou na falência. Hoje ela tem feito trabalhos de beleza em sua casa nos (sábados e domingos) devido a aderência que tem tido, e vende roupas diversas adquiridas na Africa do Sul no mercado informal Shoprite.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Cristina na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Os dois primeiros de (4.500.00mt e 8.000.00mt) foram usados para aumentar os produtos de beleza, o terceiro de 12.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade, estes 15.000.00mt serão usados para comprar roupas diversas vendidas por encomenda. Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para construção de seu próprio salão de Beleza.
texts.en:
Cristina Júlio B. was born in Maputo. She is a 33-year-old single mother of two children. The first is 13, and the second is 4 years old. Both go to school. She takes care of her mother, who lives in Maputo, by sending her 500 meticales monthly. She can't save anything because she lives in a rented house. Cristina moved to the village of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland when her husband abandoned her. That same year she began her studies while living in her grandparents' house because her mother could not support her. When she was in eighth grade, she became pregnant with her first daughter and was kicked out of the house, but since she understood salon work, her aunt invited Cristina to work together with her. Some years later she chose to open her own beauty salon with the money she had saved, and she approached Banco Novo (another banking institution) asking for a loan of 20,000 meticales to strengthen her business. She paid it off with no problems, but her business didn't earn enough because she had to rent the shop. Some years later she managed to get a job as an assistant in a botany lab, working from 7:30 am until 3:30 pm and earning 1,825 meticales. She had no time to take care of her business, so she employed someone, which left her bankrupt. These days she does beauty work in her house on Saturdays and Sundays because of the demand she has had, and she sells a variety of clothing acquired in South Africa at the Shoprite informal market. This is Cristina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans (for 4,500 meticales and 8,000 meticales) were used to increase her stock of beauty products, and the third for 12,000 meticales was used for the same purpose. These 15,000 meticales will be used to buy a variety of clothing sold by pre-order. She is confident that she will pay it back ahead of time and ask for another loan to build her own beauty salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Hidir

texts.ru: Хидиров Хидир проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хидир более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где зажает пшеницу и кортофель. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Hidir H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Hidir has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows wheat and potatoes. Hidir is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de oro. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. Meraluna makes a living raising livestock. The main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Meraluna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Meraluna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her lifestyle and her ability to engage in business activities. Meraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Meraluna is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Meraluna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Butaale Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
She has three well-rounded years of experience in plying a fuel-selling business in Kawomya. Success has not been easy to come by on the grounds of some clientele refusing to pay her after taking her fuel products. She hastens to add, however, that such setbacks are part of any business and it’s only an individual’s resilience that can help them bear the pain in such situations.

Such is the notion of a young 23-year-old mother of four school-going children. Her name is N. Hadijjah. For this young businesswoman, a paltry monthly profit of 25,000 shillings has helped her a great deal, despite the fact that it’s little money vis-à-vis what her friends are earning.

Hadijjah’s plan for the future is to expand her fuel-selling business. She is looking at being in a position to sell six jerry cans a week. With the aid of this loan, she is optimistic everything is on the cards.

loans.use: To purchase more jerry cans of fuel to sell

loans.name: Sodikchon

texts.ru: Эргашев Содикчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Имеет средне - специальное образование. По профессии шафер. В этой области проработал три года. Сейчас Содикчон занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает бытовую технику. Этим бизнесом занимается более 16 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sodikchon E. lives in the region of Vahdat. He is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Sodikchon has a specialized secondary education. He is a driver by profession and has worked in this field for three years. At this time Sodichkon is in retail. He has a store where he sells household appliances. He has been in this business for more than sixteen years. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with three adult children. He runs a small business selling and fitting new windows in new houses as well as old. Many people change windows in old houses to save heat in winter, which is why there is still high demand. Mykola started this business 14 years ago.
Mykola is a very responsible and honest person. People enjoy doing business with him and recommend him to others. He has many customers and his business is going well. Mykola would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to purchase inventory. His goal is to develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Peng S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband buys silk products for resale, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more silk products for resale.  She plans to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more silk products for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old and is married with three children aged between 4 and 9. Her husband does not work and, for that reason, Alice needs to work hard in order to provide all the necessities for her family.

Alice has an experience of nine years in her laundry business. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except Sunday.

So far, Alice is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying modern equipment to be used in her business. Once her vision is reached, she will be able to serve more customers which will be one of her ways of earning more profit.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment for her laundry business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children, all attending school. She has been operating her boutique for the last five years. She rents a house with electricity and piped water.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to open another boutique branch. She sells her products at wholesale, at retail, at the market, from door to door and from home. Her major customers are tourists visiting the country and the neighboring communities. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. Mary hopes to supply her clothes internationally in future. She joined Yehu to get a loan to modify her boutique. Her greatest monthly expenses are high transport costs and rental bill.

loans.use: To open another boutique branch, purchase a bale of clothes and pay rental bills .

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 29 years old, married, and blessed with three children who go to school. He joined Tushikane Pamoja group as a businessman who runs a garage. He also has a video library which he runs so as to earn extra income. He previously took out a loan worth 20,000 KES, which he used to boost the business and successfully repaid it. He has requested for 40,000 KES to buy machines and tools for repairing vehicles. He hopes to buy a plot in the future.

loans.use: To buy machines and tools for repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen N. is from the village of Lumad, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Elen is single. To make a living, Elen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Elen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrosh M. is 46 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. The members will each use their portions of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chrosh M. and her husband have four children. Two help out in their parents’ coffee shop, and two are fishermen. Crosh and her husband sell coffee out of their home; they also own a small general store. Since the grocery business is going well, Chrosh decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to expand their business. With both of these businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Wandegeya neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of her aunt. Christine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Christine has a restaurant business and has been in this business for eight years, working six days a week. She works from her home and on a retail basis only. Her main business challenge is seasonality.

Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy maize flour, rice, bunches of bananas, and beans.

Christine’s goal and aspiration for her business is to construct permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize flour, rice, bunches of bananas and beans

loans.name: Haneefan Muhammad Aslam's Group

texts.en:
Haneefan lives in Arifwala, a small city of the Punjab. Arifwala is famous in Pakistan for its dairy industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family for many years. She is 53 years old and married to M. A. who is a property dealer by profession. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Both her sons left their education due to financial constraints and started working to contribute to their family financially. Her elder son works in a factory and the younger one works as a laborer. Her daughters are continuing their education and are reading at 9th and 10th standards respectively. 

Haneefan supports her family by sewing and has regular orders from her neighboring clients. She also has a dairy business which she prefers. The reason for liking this business is because her parents are also in the same business and she used to take care of their cattle. Currently, she has a buffalo at her home which produces almost 8 kg of milk per day. She sells the milk to community members and uses this income to pay for the utilities expenses for her house. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her dairy business. With the loan amount, she will buy another buffalo and increase her dairy business's productivity. Haneefan is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. With her previous loans, she has shown that she is a responsible person, having paid her installments on time and never missing a meeting.
   
Note: In this photo, Haneefan is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to increase her dairy business's profitability

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. Nai C. (pictured here) is 42 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sokhun Teng, is 47 yeas old. They live in suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for twenty years and have two children, one son and one daughter. both of them are in school.   

Mrs. Nai C. sells groceries at home. Her husband is a soldier. Besides this, the couple also grows rice when they are free.  Nai is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Mété est un homme marié de 42 ans, monogame avec deux  enfants et résidant  au quartier Est, qui est un des quartiers de la ville  de Kolondièba, dans la  troisième région (Sikasso)  République Mali.  
Monsieur Mété a abandonné l’école dès le second cycle de l’enseignement fondamental (Système éducatif Malien). Pour s’insérer dans la vie économique, il fît le gardien à Save the Children pendant treize ans. Après son licenciement pour motif économique par Save, Monsieur Mété se lance dans le commerce en ouvrant une boutique de vente d’articles divers au marché de Kolondièba. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier  prêt. 
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 500 kg de sucre, un carton de cigarettes, deux cartons de thé, quelques sacs de céréales etc.   
Il compte faire prospérer son commerce en faisant varier ses articles pour réaliser un chiffre d’affaire plus élevé dans les moments à venir. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000 FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice   sera investi dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Mété is a 42-year-old married man who is monogamous.  He has two children and resides in East District, one of the districts of the city of Kolondièba, in the 3rd region (Sikasso), the Republic of Mali.  He dropped out of school in the second cycle of primary school (educational system of Mali).  To earn a living, he was a security guard at Save the Children for thirteen years.  After he was laid off there for economic reasons, he got started in commerce by opening a shop selling various goods at the Kolondièba market.

To increase his capital, Mr. Mété joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is now on his first loan.  With this loan, he plans to buy 500 kg of sugar, a box of cigarette, two boxes of tea, some sacks of grain, etc.  He plans on his business prospering by varying his goods and making more sales in the days ahead. He expects to make a profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month.  The profits will be invested in his enterprise.

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe II” ubicado en el distrito de Cojata, provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 03 hijos, la señora estudió hasta 4to de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 meses, con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de comidas y crianza de cuy.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar alimentos para su negocio de venta de comidas y crianza de cuy.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una empresa de crianza de cuy y producción de artesanías en Capachica.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la ayuda mutua y el intercambio de ideas.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe II", located in the Cojata district in the province of Huancané in the department of Puno.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She studied through her fourth year of secondary school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos four months ago when she received a loan for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her business that sells food and breeds guinea pigs.

She is asking for a new loan of 800 nuevos soles to purchase ingredients for her business that sells food and food for her guinea pigs.

Her dream for the future is to have a guinea pig breeding business and to make handicrafts in Capachica.

The things she likes best about her community bank are the meetings, the mutual assistance, and the exchange of ideas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business selling food, and food for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia D. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nemia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack food. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elba Marina

texts.es: Elba Marina A. M. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus dos hijos de 18 y 11 años de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Elba trabaja muy duro comercializando diferentes tipos de cosméticos, esmaltes, accesorios para el cabello, pulseras y aritos, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Ciudad Delgado, en donde tiene 5 años de trabajar de esta forma. Elba debe esforzarse mucho debido a que no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda para sostener a sus hijos y su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su venta con todo lo necesario para mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elba Marina A. M., 42, lives in San Salvador department with her two children who are 18 and 11 years of age and are completely dependent on her.  She works hard selling different kinds of cosmetics, nail polish, hair accessories, bracelets and earrings.  The business is located in Ciudad Delgado’s market.  She has been working like this for five years.

Elba must put in quite an effort because she does not get any type of help to support her children or her home.  

She is asking for a loan to stock her store with everything she needs to improve her profits thus providing the best for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sawuda

texts.en: Sawuda  is 27 years old, married and has one child who is six months old. Her husband works as a farmer. Sawusa owns a business that sells various items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs, onions and more.   She has been in this business for two years.  Her loan will be used to buy more items for sale. Sawuda hopes to use the new profits from her business to renovate her house. She would like to have full contained boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe S. was born in 1954 and has four children, two of them under 15. She works hard for herself and her children, having been abandoned by her husband. With the death of her first son, she was obliged to work very hard to support the rest of the children, only possible with more income, which motivated her to join GHAPE. With this loan, she plans to carry out mixed farming and increase her business selling bananas, fire wood, and palm oil. With the profit from this business she plans to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Phebe will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: yam seeds, bananas, palm oil and fire wood

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando B.  Alcalá es el propietario de una papelería  e internet en la ciudad de Cartagena, él es casado y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 25 y 30 años. Armando está solicitando un CrediKiva, porque provechando la temporada escolar, con el surtiria con papelería y útiles escolares su negocio, inversión potencialmente exitosa por la demanda que tienen los cuadernos, agendas, lápices, bolígrafos, marcadores, libros y demás cuando los estudiantes regresan a clases. Desde que Armando inició su negocio,  ha ido creciendo gradualmente porque comenzó con un computador prestando el servicio  de internet a jóvenes entre amigos de sus hijos  y vecinos del sector ;  luego compró una vitrina y poco a poco fue surtiéndola , para después adquirir  la fotocopiadora, con la cual ha complementado su servicio, que ha sido de mucha aceptación por la utilidad que presta en esta comunidad a jóvenes, niños y padres de familia, población que forma parte del mercado objetivo de Armando.
Su meta más adelante es ampliar la papelería convirtiéndola en un almacén escolar, donde los estudiantes encuentren todo lo que buscan, en la actualidad su mayor desafío es  conseguir capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor volumen,  de contado  y lograr ofrecer los mejores precios del mercado a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Armando B. Alcalá owns a stationery shop and Internet access business in the city of Cartagena.  He’s married and has two children who are 25 and 30 years of age.  He is asking for a Kiva loan because, taking advantage of the school term, he will stock his store with paper goods and school supplies which is particularly profitable because of the high demand for notebooks, appointment books, pencils, ball point pens, markers, books and other items when students return to classes.

Since Armando started his business he has been growing gradually because he started with a computer providing Internet access services to youngsters among his children’s friends and from the neighborhood.  Then he bought a display case and gradually stocked it.  Later he bought a photocopier which has added to his service because it’s been highly welcomed because of its usefulness to the community’s youngsters, children and parents, the population that makes up Armando’s main market.

His goal for later on is to expand the stationery shop into a school store where students will find everything they are looking for.  His greatest current challenge is acquiring working capital to buy in greater volume in cash in order to offer the best market prices to his customers.

loans.use: To stock his store with paper goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 41 years old and lives with her three daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her older daughter studies at a medical university, her second daughter works as a salesperson at a department store, and the youngest daughter goes to kindergarten.

 In 1997 Bayarmaa began selling meat at a rented stall at a local food market. She has been operating her business constantly and has gained a lot of experience. She sells also dairy products in the summer in addition to meat. Her current working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. Bayarmaa is a hard-working person who says, "It was not easy to raise three children as a single mother until my daughters got old enough to help me. I would like to expand my business and help my daughters to start their own life without any difficulty." She is requesting a loan of 440,000 MNT to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with nine children:  three girls and six boys. One still attends school, and the others have all graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She sells dumplings at the market to her neighbors.  She also sells palm leaves, providing another source of income. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of expensive transportation, especially during rainy season. She hopes to educate her children and diversify her business. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and palm leaves. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and palm leaves.

loans.name: Mrs. Nat Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of twelve people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. Mrs. Nat is the village bank president selected by the members. Born in 1955, she is a widow with two children who attend a local public school. Mrs. Nat is a rice and Khmer cake seller in the local village, where she earns some money to supP. her family. She now wants to start a new business, but does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, Mrs. Nat is asking for a loan to buy a sugar cane juice machine to sell sugar cane juice.

loans.use: to buy a sugar cane juice machine

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia de 32 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de artesanía, vive con sus hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, también su esposo le acompaña, ella está dedicada al comercio realizando ventas en los centros escolares de San Francisco Gotera y San Miguel.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y vender por las escuelas, ya que los jóvenes estudiantes demandan cada vez más artículos de moda, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener la clientela y a generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor sueño es comprar vivienda para su familia e instalar el negocio en un lugar propio.
texts.en:
Claudia, 32, lives in San Miguel.  She sells crafts.  She lives with her children, who are 4 and 6 years of age, and her husband.  She is a merchant who sells her wares at schools in San Miguel Gotera and San Miguel.

She currently needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell at the schools because the young students demand more and more up-to-date items every day.  This investment will help her keep her clientele and generate higher family income.

Her great dream is to buy a house for her family and to set up a business in a space of its own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at schools.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old married man, living in Tyre with his wife and four kids. Mouhamad works in whole sale trade. He has been selling candies, biscuits and chocolate for 15 years. He works out of his small van, which he uses to travel among villages in order to promote and sell his goods. 

Mouhamad is an Al Majmoua borrower for the third time and all of his previous loans were used to increase his business capital. This time Mouhamad states that he's happy and satisfied with his present capital, but would like to exchange his van for a bigger one that can fit all his goods. He is intending to sell his present van and add to its price the requested loan amount to pay for the new one he chose. 

Mouhamad is a person who's always grateful for what he gets and who, at the same time, works hard on improving himself. He hopes to expand his business through reaching more targeted clients.

loans.use: To buy  a new van to expand his business.

loans.name: Yeoun's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. YeO., a married woman who was born in 1971, was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. YeO. is a farmer who owns a plot of land T. she uses to grow rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Ky, was born in 1980 and is a laborer who also helps his wife in farming. This couple has six children. Two are laborers, two are attending the local school, and the others two are too young to work.

In order to support her farming, Mrs. YeO. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her husband works at the Kenya ferry services earning to contribute towards the family's basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.         

She has operated a cosmetic shop for the past 7 seven years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a business of selling clothes which adds up to her other source of income. Riziki faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a supplier of beauty products in the future.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to purchase stock of beauty products for her cosmetic shop and bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of beauty products for her cosmetic shop and bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tommy

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Tommy.  He is married and has 2 children, ages 11 and 2 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is his nephew. 

In 2000, Tommy established his drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to have more income to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Tommy requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Tommy plans to get a house, educate his children and extend his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more beverages for his business

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
Liliam es una mujer emprendedora que vive en la comunidad de Cimarrón en Cartago. 
Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida  a la agricultura, pero hace dos años decidió emprender su propio negocio. Fue asi como abrió su “Pulperia”, la cual ha sido de  mucho beneficio para las personas que de la comunidad. 
Hoy Liliam necesita un préstamo de ₡400 000 mil colones para la compra de mayor mercadería, ya que necesita aumentar las cantidades y la variedad de sus productos porque la demanda es cada vez mayor.  Ella está muy feliz por el apoyo recibido hasta el momento y desea crecer  más.
Ella es socia de la empresa de crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas de Cimarrón, una de las 110 empresas de Credito Comunal socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Liliam is an enterprising woman who lives in Cimarrón in Cartago.
She has worked all her life in agriculture, but two years ago she decided to start her own business. That is how she came to open her general store, which has been very beneficial for the people in the community.
Today Liliam needs a loan of 400,000 colones to purchase more merchandise, since she needs to increase the amount and variety of her products because demand is increasing. She is very happy for the support she has received up to now, and she hopes to grow more.
She is a member of the Nuevas Esperanzas de Cimarrón communal bank, one of the 110 communal banks that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: Alexander José tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de lotería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Siempre ha sido una persona luchadora pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad por los que tiene que luchar, el les brinda los ingresos necesarios. Inicio este negocio por un hermano que le enseño poco a poco como ganarse la vida diariamente. Alexander sale todos los días a ofrecer la lotería a muchos clientes, a pesar de tener muchas dificultades. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de lotería.
texts.en: Alexander José is 26 years old. His activity is selling lottery tickets. For more than ten years, he has been dedicated to this way of life. He has always been a fighting person since he has two young children for whom he has to fight. He provides them necessary income. He began this business through a brother who taught him gradually how to earn a daily living. Alexander leaves every day to offer lottery tickets to many customers, despite having many difficulties. The reason for the loan is to buy lottery tickets.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Gildas Regis

texts.fr:
Client de 28 ans, marie avec 1 enfant a sa charge, a l'arret de ses etudes par faute de soutien en classe de 5e, il se lance dans le commerce des habits hommes et enfants, ses ventes sont de 30000 frs a 40000frs par jour .
