A l'octroi de son pret , il veut acheter des polos , chemises et marinieres pour homme et des habits pour enfants.

Tres entreprenant, il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une boutique d'habits pour homme et enfant, il epargne beaucoup et il soutien sa famille avec les benefices de son activite.
texts.en:
This borrower is 28 years old and married with one dependent child. He quit school in the fifth grade for lack of financial support, and started to sell clothing for men and children. His sales average 30,000 to 40,000F per day.

With this loan, he plans to buy polo shirts, dress shirts and middy blouses for men, and children’s clothes.

He is a very enterprising man whose goal is to open a clothing store for men and children. He saves a lot, and he supports his family with the revenue from his activity.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and other shirts for men, and children’s clothes

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives together with his wife and son, who has recently returned from the army. 

Ararat keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to plant trees, but he doesn't have a water-supply system to water the orchard. 

With the requested loan, Ararat plans to purchase a water pump and pipes. After developing the orchard, Ararat will not only sell fresh fruits, but he will also dry fruits and make jams to sell and increase his income. 

Additional income will help Ararat to insure a brighter future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump and pipes.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru:
Муаззам честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и отец одного ребенка.  Муаззам всегда старается, обеспечит свою семью, и жить в хороших условиях жизни, и поэтому он начал занимается купля продажей промтоварами. 14 лет тому назад после развала СССР он торговал на улицах и привозил товары с других районов. А потом постепенно он взял маленькую торговую точку в аренду. Муаззам хочет, расширит свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Он хотел бы получит  займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки промтоваров. Муаззам заранее благодарит вас за вашу поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muazzan is honest, hardworking and driven. He's married and has one child. In order to provide for his family and live in a healthy environment, he began a small business dealing in household goods and appliances. Fourteen years ago, after the collapse of the Soviet Union, he was a salesperson on the streets and imported goods from nearby regions. Gradually, he was able to build up his business and started renting a sales point. Muazzan wants to expand the business and maximize his profits. He's requesting a loan of 2000$ in order to purchase household goods and appliances. He thanks all of his lenders in advance for their support and charity.

loans.use: to buy household goods and appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase energy efficient construction equipment.

loans.name: Ana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ana de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la pesca, agricultura y turismo.

Ana tiene su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace unos años aproximadamente, la misma que maneja su esposo, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Ana junto con su esposo padres responsables y trabajadores  que lo único que desean es que su hijo tengan un mejor nivel de vida al igual que estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives with her husband and son in her own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located n the urban area of the province of Chiclayo.  The locals here are involved in fishing, agriculture and tourism.

Ana has a motor-taxi business (transportation of a maximum of three people over short distances), which she has been running for a couple of years.  Her husband also works in the business which they have in the area where they live despite all the competition.  From very early in the morning he tries to attract as many passengers as possible to increase income to cover household expenses.

The loan of 1,000 PEN requested through Edpyme Alternativa will be used for maintenance of the motor-taxi for continued good service to customers.  This will improve the family's lifestyle as well.  Ana and her husband are responsible parents and hard workers who only want to provide a good lifestyle and higher education for their son.

loans.use: To pay for motor-taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel, a married 23-year-old father of one, lives in the village of Camanga in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines, where he is a farmer growing palay to earn a living.

Over the past three years, he has spent much time planting, weeding and irrigating the area under the heat of the sun and on rainy days. The family's income is derived primarily from rice production, and Junel earns a total revenue of PHP 13,000 a month. He is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs.

Junel became a member of GDMPC this year, and this will be his first loan. He hopes to earn large returns from this investment in his rice production. He plans to work on additional farm fields to increase family income, and hopes for another loan from the cooperative after a full repayment of the current one.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Ajala

texts.en:
Ajala is a widowed woman with five children, three of whom attend school while the other two have finished high school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Ajala has operated a vegetable grocery business for the past fifteen years; her potential clients are neighbors, friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the main market to her place of business. She dreams of increasing sales and diversifying to chicken rearing in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu because of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit for her grocery.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie est mariée à un boucher du nom de Paul. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Marie n'a jamais été à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marie prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte, accompagné de la sauce) qu'elle vend depuis deux ans. Marie s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
GBEDOKPO Group is made up of three women who are friends. They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Marie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 31 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to a butcher named Paul.

The couple has two school-attending children they have to support. Marie never attended school. In order to provide for herself and her children, she's been preparing and selling food (rice and pasta served with sauces) for two years.

Marie gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking a second loan, together with the other members of the group. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, rice, and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 200 meters of cloth at $2 per m

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de refrescos y ropa usada. Uno de los desafíos que María atraviesa es el tiempo ya que tiene que atender a sus dos hijos menores de edad y atender su negocio. Inicio con capital propio pues necesitaba obtener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es variado pues comprara de un poco de todo como pajillas, bolsas, azúcar, frutas, pantalones, camisas, faldas entre otros.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora works selling drinks and used clothing. One of the challenges she faces is that at the same time has to care for her two young children and attend her store. She began with her own funds as she needed a way to pay her household expenses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a little of everything such as drinking straws, bags, sugar, fruit, pants, shirts, skirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy drinking straws, bags, sugar, fruit, pants, shirts, skirts and other items.

loans.name: Umidchon

texts.ru: Умидчон проживает в городе Худжанд. У него имеется собственная пекарня, где он печет лепешки. В этой области он 12 лет. Умидчон женат. Ему 35 лет. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для приобретения дров и угля.
texts.en: Umidchon lives in the town of Khujand.  He owns a bakery, where he makes flatbread.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  Umidchon is 35 years old, married and has four children.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of firewood and coal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and coal

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna, age 31, earns a living by planting and harvesting rice to offer for sale. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PhP 4,000 from her work. 

She has requested a loan of PhP 13,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for use on her farmland. Johna has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Johna wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children complete their educations. Johna and her husband have two children and live in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for use on her farmland

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: Romel, un joven de 18 años quien desea sobresalir en la vida; vive en casa de su mamá Yolanda de 42 años, a quien apoya darle lo mejor. Romel, es un joven animoso de salir y triunfar en la vida. Se dedica a la construcción donde su principal actividad es ayudar a sus compañeros de trabajo a cargar elementos que necesiten como fierros, tierra, entre otros. En esta actividad viene trabajando 01mes; desde que su padre falleció, como hijo mayor ayuda a su madre con los gastos de su casa. Con el tiempo desea abrir una tienda para su madre, para que pueda estar tranquila y tener una forma de poder apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, mientras que Romel trabaja en las construcciones. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo; al igual agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de poder trabajar con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará productos como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, golosina, bebidas, entre otros, así podrá abrir la tienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Romel is an 18 year old young man who wants excel in life.  He lives at home with his mother Yolanda, 42, who he supports the best he can.  Romel is excited to get out and succeed in life.  He works in construction where his main task is to help his fellow workers load the things they need such as iron, dirt, etc.  He has been working this job for a month. Since he is the eldest son, he has been helping his mother with the household expenses since his father died.  In time he wants to open a store for his mother so that she can have a way to support herself and have peace of mind while Romel works in construction.  

This will be his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support as this will give him security advancing in his job.  He is also grateful to his communal bank for giving him the opportunity to work with them.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency], he will buy products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, sweets, beverages, etc., so he can open the store for his mother.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, canned goods, sweets, beverages, etc

loans.name: El Girasol Group

texts.es:
Maximina cuenta con 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran estudiando el mayor se llama miguel y esta cursando 6° de primaria, Yulissa esta en 4°, Jacqueline en 2°, Jazmín en 3° de preescolar y José Antonio tiene 3 años de edad, 	su esposo se llama pablo es albañil.

Ella es comerciante muy trabajadora ya tiene 3 años vendiendo frutas y verduras sale a vender a los pueblos cercanos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: jitomate, chile, cebolla, plátanos, manzana, mandarina, jícama, etc.


Maximina pertenece al grupo el girasol el cual esta integrado por 11 personas 10  mujeres y un hombre las cuales serán mencionadas a continuación: mercedes, Roselia, Noelia, Gisela, Demetrio, Sandivel, Maria, Brenda Liz, Maximina, Ivan, Maria, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de calzado, pollos, productos de abarrotes, comida, venta de cosméticos, ropa, etc.
texts.en:
Maximina, 30, lives with her partner and they have 5 children, most of whom are in school: Miguel, 6th grade; Yulissa, 4th grade; Jacqueline, 2nd grade; Jazmin, preschool; and Jose Antonio who is 3 years old. Her husband, Pablo, is a mason.

She is a hardworking merchant and has been selling fruits and vegetables for 3 years. She goes out to sell in nearby towns. She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, plantains, apples, mandarin oranges, jicama, etc.

Maximina belongs to the lending group El Girasol, which is made up of 11 members - 10 women and 1 man. They are: Mercedes, Roselia, Noelia, Gisela, Demetrio, Sandivel, Maria, Brenda Liz, Maximina, Ivan and Maria. They all work in commercial activities like selling shoes, chickens, groceries, food cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, plantains, apples, mandarin oranges, jicama, etc.

loans.name: Alaxpacha Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALAXPACHA II” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gladys. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de edredones, comercio de abarrotes, venta de producto YAMBAL, costura de chamarras, trenzado de mantas, venta de queso, compra y venta de productos.

La señora Gladys,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de edredones usados que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que comprará de La Paz  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias y otros departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “ALAXPACHA II” loan group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the central focus of Germán Busch. The group is made up of eight members and is led by Mrs. Gladys. The group members work in a variety of businesses including: sewing comforters, selling groceries, selling Yanbal products (jewelry and cosmetics), sewing jackets, weaving blankets, selling cheese, and buying products for resale.

Mrs. Gladys shares that she joined Pro Mujer two loan cycles ago, and that she joined the institution after a friend invited her. She currently has a business sewing and also selling used comforters. She has done this work for many years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (buy fabric) from La Paz and later sell in markets and fairs. This job allows her to earn money to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes sharing with her group members.

loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Karina Marisela

texts.es: Karina Marisela de 25 años de edad es una joven  madre que se esfuerza día con día por salir adelante, su esposo trabaja como jornalero que es lo que les permite contar con dinero extra. La actividad principal a la que se dedica Karina y su esposo es a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles, oficio al cual se han dedicado siembre junto a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de diferentes insumos y equipo para este trabajo tales como: rociadores y bomba para pesticidas, abono y semillas para sembrar. Con esto Karina espera mejorar la calidad de su semilla y así contar con mayor cantidad de clientes lo cual es muy conveniente para ella y su familia porque de este modo podrán  salir adelante.

loans.use: Compra rociadores para pesticidas, abono y semillas para sembrar.

loans.name: Malekia

texts.en: Melekia is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Iringa District, Tanzania. Malekia is a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills for two and half hours per week. She is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business of cooking and selling morning bites (called maandazi) by improving her kitchen. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide household goods.

loans.use: to expand her business of cooking and selling morning bites (maandazi)

loans.name: Santos Irma

texts.en:
My activity involves selling products of popular consumption such as juices, milk, eggs, bread, and others, at the store I have in my city. Besides, I sell gas, water, oil for cars, filters, and brakes fluid. I’ve had this business for five years, and the income is pretty good since it’s located at the taxicab and bus terminal of my community. I give credit to the motorists, who pay me weekly. I think I’ve done alright because I’ve had enough income to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase refreshments, juices, dairies, churros, bread, milk, eggs, and others.

Mi actividad es la venta de productos de consumo popular como jugos, leche, huevos pan y otros, ya que tengo una pulperia en mi ciudad, aparte vendo gas, agua, aceite para vehiculos, filtros, liquido para frenos. Este negocio lo tengo desde hace cinco años el que me genera buenos ingresos ya que esta ubicada en la terminal de taxis y buses de mi colonia. Les doy credito a los motoristas quienes me pagan semanalmente y considero que me ha ido bien ya que he tenido buenos ingresos para sostener a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, jugos, lacteos, churros, pan, leche, huevos, y otros

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna tiene ya una experiencia de 6 años en el comercio. Ella trabajaba en un almacén de venta de electrodomésticos del cual salió ya que sus hijas quedaban al cuidado de otra persona. Todo esto lo hizo una vez separada del papá de las bebés el cual la dejó y ella con el dinero que había ahorrado y un préstamo que hizo logró ponerse un local de venta de comidas rápidas. Lo tiene funcionando desde hace 6 meses en el horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m. y le ayuda su hermana.

Johanna desea el crédito para adecuar su hogar para el negocio ya que ahora ella se encuentra alquilando el local lo que le genera un egreso. También quiere ponerse un negocio de venta de colas en su domicilio. Su familia ya la está ayudando en la construcción del local y en un mes estará ya en su casa. También desea poner a disposición de sus clientes otra clase de platos para servirse.

Johanna tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas, las cuales son el motivo para que ella haya salido adelante. Espera que con la inversión todo le vaya mejor y pueda comprarse un carrito de segunda para salir a comprar sus productos.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Johanna has 6 years of experience as a merchant. She used to work at store that sold electrical appliances, but she had to quit because her daughters were being left at the care of another person. She quit once she separated from the father of her daughters because he left her, and with the money she had saved and a loan, Johanna was able to set up a business to sell fast food. She has been running this business for 6 months now, and opens it from 5:00 pm to to 12:00 am. Her sister helps her.

Johanna wishes to get the loan so that she can adapt her home for the business since she is renting the place where it is located now, and that generates an extra expense. She also wants to set up a store to sell refreshments in her house. Her family is helping her build the new store and it will ready in a month. She also wishes to offer her clients other dishes.

Johanna is 27, she’s a single mom and has two girls. They are her driving force to continue in the struggle to get ahead. She hopes that with the investment, everything will be better and she’ll be able to buy a second-hand cart so she can go out and buy her products.

loans.use: Adecuar su hogar pare el negocio

loans.name: Shah Gul

texts.en:
Shah Gul is 44 years old. She lives in a household of six in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Her son has a retail-food shop for which Shah Gul took a loan. The shop is doing a good business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials, like rice, milk, potatoes, onions, etc., to do better business. She wants to develop close relationships with people and make good clients to be a great shopkeeper. She also wants to find a good income each month. Now she is very happy and her son is also very happy with this loan.

Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more extra materials for shop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
CARMEN A. C.

Doña Carmen is a member of the group "Fountain of Running Water" or "Fuente de Agua Viva." She was born in 1970 and is 37 years old. She had wanted to go to school as a child, but her parents believed that women are not meant to study. The only thing she was allowed to do was to cook, because the only thing her parents believed a woman should do is marry, have children and take care of her family.

However, thanks to the help of her older sister, she was able to graduate with a degree in Secretary and Office work when she was 19. She then met her husband, Roman Diaz who was 38. She has 3 children with him, the oldest who is 12, the second 9 and the youngest 7. They live with her in the neighborhood "Colonia El Rosario." She and her husband bought some land and built a small home there, where they run their own business. Currently, she needs a small loan in order to support her business of selling chicken and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

CARMEN A. C. Doña Carmen pertenece al grupo fuente de agua viva, nació en el año 1970 actualmente cuenta con 37 años de edad, quiso estudiar en su infancia pero los papás le decían que las mujeres no son para estudiar, sino que solo para la cocina, porque se casan y tienen que mantener a sus hijos y su esposo. Pero gracias a una hermana mayor que ella la ayudó y le apoyó con sus estudios hasta graduarse de Secretaria y Oficinista a los 19 años. Luego conoció a su esposo Román Díaz de 38 años, con él tuvieron 3 hijos el primero de 12 años, el segundo de 9 años y el tercero de 7 años, vivían en la Colonia El Rosario con la mamá. y luego compraron un terrenito y construyeron una casita donde tienen su pequeño negocio, Ahora cuenta con un pequeño negocio adicional a la venta de pollo y refresquería.

loans.use: Sales of Chicken (meat).

loans.name: Bernard

texts.fr:
Mr. Bernard G., 32, left school at an early age to devote himself to learning carpentry. Hard working and courageous, he decided to open his own workshop after he had finished his three years’ apprenticeship. He is married and has one child. He makes upholstered sofas and arm-chairs for living-rooms, chests and buffets, beds and other such necessary furniture.

Unfortunately, Bernard is always short of capital for his business, which makes it hard for him to fill his customers’ orders appropriately. He is asking for a loan of US$ 900 to buy teak wood, drawer pulls, etc., so that he can keep up with orders in a timely manner.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 32 ans, Monsieur G. Bernard a vite abandonné ses études pour apprendre la menuiserie. Brave et courageux, il décide d’ouvrir son propre atelier de menuiserie après 3 ans d’apprentissage, et s’est installé à son propre compte. Marié, il est père d’un (1) enfant. La confection et la fabrication des meubles, des fauteuils (salon complet), des armoires et buffets, des lits et autres sont sa spécialité.

Malheureusement les moyens financiers font toujours cruellement défaut à Monsieur G. Bernard qui a du mal a satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour l’achat des planches en Iroko et Teck, des chevrons et autres afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans le délai les commandes de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchasing wood to build furniture  Achat de planches pour confection des meubles

loans.name: Helena Maria

texts.pt:
Helena Maria Z. is 43 years old. She is a single mother of 6 children. She runs a convenience store that sells assorted basic goods, capulanas skirts and charcoal from her home in the Mavalene area in Maputo. She joined the program this year in May and she will now request a loan in the amount of 10.000 Mt, which will be paid back in 8 months. The loan amount will be spent on the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Helena Maria Z. tem 43 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos. Tem o seu negócio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade, capulanas e carvão na sua residência no bairro de Mavalane em Maputo.entrou para o programa em Maio do presente ano e vai tomar agora 10.000Mt pagáveis em 8 meses para aplicar no mesmo negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
António U. was born in Marrumbe, in the province of Inhambe. He is 43 years old. He studied until high school. He moved from his family’s home when he was 14. In 1985 he met his wife and they have a son. He started working as a technical school in Moamba. Two years later he was transferred to the Institute of Umbeluzi where he continues to work today as a teacher. António first contacted Tchuma program in search of credit but he did like the program because the loans amount were smaller and he had less time to repay them. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and he requests a loan of 25.000mt to buy construction material to build his home. In the future, he plans on finishing his home and to buy furniture to live comfortably with his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizacao : Boane - Bairro 7 IPU Cliente :Antonio U. Actividade : Habitacao Valor de empréstimo: 25.000,00 MT(1.000,00 USS) Aplicação de montante : Compra de material de construcao Inicio : 01-10-07 Fim: 24-03-09 António U. ,natural de Morrumbene, Província de Inhambane tem 43 anos de idade, pai de 1 filho estudou ate nível superior, deixou de viver com a família com os seus 14 anos. Em 1985 conheceu a sua esposa e passou a viver com ela Teve o seu 1º emprego numa Escola Técnica de artes e ofícios na Moamba. Dois anos depois transferiu-se para o Instituto pedagógico de Umbeluzi, onde se encontra a trabalhar ate hoje, como professor. Teve o seu 1º contacto com o credito junto a cooperativa de créditos Tchuma que oferecia créditos individuais, não tendo sido boa experiência porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores, o prazo de pagamento era curto e determinado pela Instituiçao. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema, através dos amigos e dai aproximou –se e solicita o seu 1º empréstimo para compra de um terreno, com este credito de 25.000,00 MT pretende comprar material de construcao. Futuramente a perspectiva é de terminar a obra e começar o apetrecho da sua casa, para viver condignamente com a sua familia.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel M. A. is a married man, but his children no longer depend on him. He has his business located in the municipal market. He has sold cheese for 30 years and has worked with CEPRODEL for 7 months. He tells us that he started his business when he had to retire from his job, and he used this business to take care of his children.

Leonel tells us that he feels very satisfied with the credits that have been offered to him, and they have been timely and offered in an agile manner. They have let him buy more merchandise that he didn't used to have. Currently his business is located in the municipal market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Leonel M. A. es un señor casado pero sin hijos a su cargo, este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio en el mercado municipal, el negocio de el es venta de queso lo comienza hace 30 años, tiene de trabajar con ceprodel 7 meses, dice que este negocio lo emprendió cuando lo jubilan de su trabajo, y de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos.

Este señor, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 7 meses, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, ya que en su momento le han servido para compra de mercadería que no la tenía en existencia. Actualmente este negocio siempre esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nalukolongo 1(C) Group

texts.en: Majorine is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells raw foods in the market. Majorine wants to use the extra business profits to re-invest and expand her food business. Rose wants to use the loan to purchase more charcoal for sale. Goretti has a retail shop and wants to increase stock with the loan. Aisha works in a hotel while Annet has a cosmetic shop.

loans.use: To purchase more foods for sale

loans.name: Elza

texts.es:
Elza belongs to Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito.” She is dedicated to the sale of food in the Río quarry where they extract construction materials. This is in the city of Huaraz in Ancash region. With a previous loan of S. 1,200.00, she invested in the business to improve her earnings. With this new loan of S. 1,500.00, which will be repaid in eight months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, noodles, oil and other products for cooking meals. She is 26 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a worker and has temporary work. The wage that he earns is not enough to pay for their living expenses. Her earnings allow Elza to feed and clothe her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito”, se dedica a la venta de alimentos en la cantera del Río donde extraen materiales de construcción. Esto en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el crédito anterior de S/1,200.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en negocio para mejorar sus ingresos, Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses lo invertirá en la compra de: arroz, fideos, aceite, y otros productos para la elaboración de alimentos. Ella tiene 26 años es casada con dos hijos, su esposo es obrero y tiene trabajos eventuales y el sueldo que gana no alcanza para solventar su hogar, sus ingreso le permite vestir y alimentar a su familia.

loans.use: With this loan, she will buy basic necessities for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David A. has a mini factory for processing palm kernel. He has been in business since1986. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan amount of $600 to buy palm kernel for processing. David is 53 years old, is married, and has 6 children.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel for processing

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
The group “Women in Action” was formed one year ago and the majority of the original members still work in the group. The members of this group have a variety of productive businesses such as the sale of handicrafts, groceries, charcoal, newspapers, jewelry, linen goods and clothing among others.

The loan which they will get as a group is a great help for these women’s businesses. They will use it as operating capital to buy necessary merchandise for sale as they are always looking to expand the variety of the products they offer in order to increase their clientele.

In addition to being microentrepreneurs, these women support their families as mothers and wives. This is something that is common in their country because women play a very important role in the family as they are the moral and emotional support for the rest of the family. The greatest wish that these women have is the wellbeing of their children. They hope that their children will succeed by getting an education and getting better jobs so that they don’t have to suffer all day to support their families as these women do.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El comité “Mujeres en Acción” tiene 1 año de formación mantiene a la mayoría de las primeras integrantes aun trabajando con el grupo, las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, como venta de manualidades, despensa, venta de carbón, kioscos, venta de bijouterie, venta de lencerías y ropas, entre otros.

El crédito que retiran de forma solidaria es una gran ayuda para el negocio de estas mujeres ya que ellas lo utilizan como capital operativo, comprando mercaderías necesarias para la venta pues buscan ampliar siempre la variedad de lo que ofrecen y además aumentar la cantidad de clientes.

Estas mujeres además de ser microempresarias, llevan adelante a sus familias como madres y esposas, esto es algo típico en nuestro país ya que las mujeres cumplen un rol muy importante en la familia, pues son el apoyo moral y sentimental para los demás integrantes de la familia. El deseo mas anhelado del corazón de estas mujeres es la de bienestar de sus hijos, ellas desean que ellos puedan salir adelante, estudiando y obteniendo mejores trabajos para no tener que sacrificarse de sol a sol para mantener a sus familias de la forma en que ellas lo hacen.

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise for sale such as cosmetics, jewelry, drinks, fabric, wine, rice, sugar, oil, flour, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 35 years old and married with three children. He owns a phone accessories shop in Makeni town and has been in this business for three years. With his previous loans he diversified his business and acquired more training on business planning and management. He developed a business plan that needs capital of Le.3,480,000 ($US1,200) to increase his stock of cell phones.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones, SIM cards, phone cards and other accessories.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 68 years old. She is divorced with four children. Currently three of them have completed school and are working. She prepares and sells pastries to the working community and bus stops at Obuasi, a busy mining town in Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock to avoid price hikes. This, she believes, will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her raise good income to support her last child in school.

She is a member of the trust group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is Not Asleep). In this group, members guarantee one another's loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan. Hannah is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Madame Koura B. is a 61-year-old widow who lives with her three children (one boy, two girls) in the home of her late husband in Médine, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. Having been unable to attend school for social reasons, and wishing to be economically active, she explored without success various occupations as ways to earn income. Being very enterprising and courageous in commercial matters, she decided to specialize in the production and sale of biscuits. She began this occupation twenty years ago; today, she enjoys a good reputation and a loyal and growing client base. To meet this growing demand, she approached the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to obtain additional financial resources. With this loan, she intends to purchase five sacks of wheat flour, four drums of oil and three sacks of sugar. The flour is mixed with water and sugar in a cup; this dough is then rolled into balls and cooked in oil. She purchases her raw materials from shopkeepers at the central market in Sikasso, and sells her wares retail in the same market, for cash and occasionally on credit. Her clientele is made up mainly of women, of stallkeepers and of other people working in the market. Madame Koura B. foresees a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs. Since circumstances have made her the head of her family, she intends to use a large portion of this profit to provide for her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Koura B. est une veuve de 61 ans qui vit avec ses 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles) dans la maison de son feu époux à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). N’ayant pas eu à fréquenter l’école pour des raisons sociales, et dans le souci de s’intégrer dans la vie économique elle ména plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans réussite.Très entreprenante et courageuse dans les activités commerciales, elle décida de se spécialisesr dans la fabrication et vente de galettes à base de farine de blé depuis maintenant 20 ans. Madame Koura B. Jouit d’une grande réputation et d’une clientèle fidèle et en nette croissance. Pour faire face à cette demande, elle s’adressa à l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour obtenir des ressources financières additionnelles. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5 sacs de farine de blé, 4 bidons d’huile et 3 sacs de sucre. La poudre de farine est mélangée avec de l’eau et du sucre dans une tasse pour ensuite être cuite par boulette dans de l’huile de cuisson. Pour les matières prémières, elle se ravitaille exclusivement à Skasso auprès des boutiquiers du grand marché et effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au même marché. Sa clientèle est composée essntiellement de femmes, de forains et des employers travaillant au niveau du marché. Madame Koura B. envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA. Etant chef de famille par la force des choses, elle compte utiliser une grande partie du bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. is 44 years old and works selling vegetables in the market, earning approximately 15,000 Riel (US $3.75) a day. Her husband, Mr. Vann Loeng, operates a business selling oxen. He buys cows from a local villager and resells them for a profit. He earns about 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day. They live in Chi Kreng Commune, Siem Reap Province, and have three children, all of whom are in school.

Heng would like to request a loan of 2,000,000 Riel (US $500.00) to help her husband expand his business by purchasing more oxen for resale. The loan will allow them to increase their income and help them support their family.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business by purchasing more oxen to resell

loans.name: Nora Hilaria

texts.es:
Nora es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa comenzó con este negocio hace 5 años vendiendo enfrente de su casa y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa.

Blanca inicio su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo a darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y que no les faltara nada. Inicio hace poco mas de 1 años comenzó como snack vendiendo refrescos, frituras y dulces, actualmente surtió su negocio con más cosas de abarrotes, ya que desea tener su tienda mejor establecida en un futuro.

Nely inicio con su negocio ya que necesitaba una actividad que le permitiera atender a sus hijos y a la vez poder obtener un ingreso extra. Comenzó con este negocio hace 2 años vendiendo para otra persona, pero poco a poco hizo sus clientes por lo que decidió vender independientemente y asi obtener mejores ganancias.

Ellas forman el grupo Kilimanjaro y necesitan $1125 que pagaran en 5 meses para poder comprar mercancía para sus negocios y poder así mantenerlos. Ellas confían que con tu apoyo esto será posible.
texts.en:
Nora is the coordinator of this group. She began her clothing sales business in order to help her husband with the household costs. She started the business 5 years ago by selling in front of her house; she now sells in the markets near her house. Blanca began her business in order to help her husband give their daughters a better quality of life and make sure that they did not lack anything. A little more than 1 year ago, she began selling snack foods such as soft drinks and fried and sweet foods. She currently has her business stocked with more grocery items because she wants to have her store better established in the future. Nely began her business because she needed a job that would allow her to take care of her children and at the same time earn her an extra income. She began this business 2 years ago by selling for another person. However, little by little she got her own clients, which caused her to decide to sell independently, thereby earning her a better income. They constitute the group “Kilimanjaro” and they need $1125.00, which they will pay back in 5 months, to buy merchandise for their businesses and therefore to be able to maintain them. They trust that with your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a married mom of two grown kids and a successful entrepreneur, too. She sells women's underwear and night gowns in one of the local markets called "Sigma-sport." Olga has assorted merchandise and always tries to introduce unique items to her selection of products to keep a stable position in an atmosphere of fierce competition in the market.

Olga has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has over $4,000 invested in inventory. Her gross income is about $2,000. Olga is very energetic. She finds time for family, business, personal growth and floral design, which is one of her numerous hobbies. This time she is requesting a 2,500 Grivna loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jonesia M.

texts.en:
Jonesia N. is married with two children aged 2 and 8 and lives in Mbeya, Tanzania. Jonesia sells vitenges and kangas, pieces of colorful cloth similar to a sarong. The business has been operating since 2003. Josenia buys the vitenges wholesale and then sells them in her retail outlet. She works 6 days a week for 9-12 hours per day with her husband. Jonesia currently earns about 80USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD to buy larger volumes to obtain bulk volume discounts. In the future, Jonesia hopes to start another business in order to diversify. Jonesia thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase vitenge and kanga in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret O. is 30 years old. She is married with two children who attend school. She owns and operates a soft drink shop and sells items like canned foods. Margaret buys bulk supplies of canned foods and bottled drinks like Coke, Fanta, Pepsi, malt etc. in the local market. She would like to use the loan to buy increased supplies of canned foods and drinks to expand her business. Margaret hopes to earn additional income from the increased business which will enable her revive business growth and provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to a community organization called ‘Boldness Trust Group’. The group members provide loan guarantees through a repayment pledge and assist one another in repaying loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies of canned foods and bottled drinks like Coke, Fanta, Pepsi, malt etc.

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa S., 35, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers, public, and families 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Seleisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to buy cement, iron roofing, and timbers for home improvement. She also produces Samoan cocoa which is one of the Samoans' favorite drinks and sells popcorn just to back up her vegetable garden.

loans.use: buying fertilizer, vegetables seeds, chemicals, and plastic bags for selling her items

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 68-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Youssef has owned a grocery store for five years. He also sells vegetables. He requested a loan of $800 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store and repair his car. 

This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise and improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Youssef first started his business, he lacked cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Youssef will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store and repair his car.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi B. est un jeune homme de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une cafétéria depuis 3 ans à Avetonou. Il désire avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité en achetant une nouvelle cuisinière et aussi réaménager sa baraque.
texts.en:
Koffi B. is a young man, 42 years of age, married, and the father of two. He has been running a cafeteria for three years in Avetonou. He would like to use this loan to expand his business by buying a new stove and also to fix up his stall.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cooker and to fix up his stall

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Ricardo de Jesús R. Hernández tiene la edad de 47 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja en el hospital México nicaragüense del Municipio  , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están casado y uno de 17 años tiene a su cargo , el joven estudia y le apoya con la agricultura , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo y sea un hombre de buenas costumbres , don Ricardo desde hace treinta años se dedica a la actividad agrícola , el mayor problema que ha surgido durante este tiempo es la falta de financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, con este crédito es para comprar los fertilizantes necesario que requiera el cultivo para obtener una buena producción, que será de mucho beneficios para su vida personal como en el comercio.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo de Jesus H. is 47 years old and a resident of the Reparto Juan Padilla located in the town of Ticuantepe. His wife, with whom he has three sons -- two of them are married and a 17-year-old that lives with them, works at the city's Mexico-Nicaraguan Hospital to help cover living expenses. Their youngest son goes to school and works with agriculture as well. His plans for his family include improving their living standards in order to provide a better future for his son and to help him grow to be a respectable man. Mr. Ricardo has worked with agriculture for thirty years and the biggest obstacles that have risen throughout the years have been the absence of financial support to purchase supplies and fertilizers. This credit line would be used to purchase the fertilizers needed to promote agriculture growth and a satisfactory production which will be beneficial to his personal life and the industry altogether.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to increase production.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин  1966 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Окончил 10 классов, высшего образования не имеет. Дома разводит скот. Семья помогает ухаживать за скотом. В свободное время сажает в огороде зелень и овощи. От этого урожая есть и доход. С наступлением весны скот отправляют в горы на пастбище.  Увеличив вес скот возвращается откормленным и готовый для продажи. Остаются те, которые идут на продажу и которые должны скоро родить. Кредит получает в первые, планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Shamsidin was born in 1966, he is married and has five children. He has completed 10 grades of schooling and does not have higher education. He is raising cattle at home. His family helps him to keep after the cattle. In his spare time he sows vegetables and greens in the garden. He receives income form the harvest. With the arrival of spring the cattle is sent to the pastures in the mountains. After gaining weight the cattle returns well fed and ready to be sold. Those ones that are not ready or pregnant will stay. Shamsidin is applying for a loan for the first time and plans to increase the head count of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juana C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como chiltomas, tomates y repollos ofrecidas en su pequeño establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante y para ello una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Juana C. has a business selling vegetables like sweet peppers, tomatoes, and cabbage from her small establishment in the central market in town.

Recently she has been able to advance in her business and she has come to Ceprodel (a Kiva partner) one more time to benefit from a loan for the purchase of vegetables. In this way she will be able to continue her business that requires her support.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Monica Musanabera ‘S Group

texts.en:
Monica is the leader of a loan group with five members. She is 36-years-old and married with four children ages 4 to 16 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a two-room house where she lives with six people. Monica takes care of additional family members (parents). There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. Monica resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

For the past four years, Monica has been in the business of selling second hand clothes door to door in Mengo MacKay and surrounding areas. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and she works seven days a week. Monica buys clothes from Owino market and takes public transport to and from the purchase place so she doesn't incur shipping charges. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity, and school fees. Her main challenges are the increasing prices of clothes and rental charges. Monica has been with MCDT for over two years and continues to work with her original loan group mates. She is servicing her fifth loan which she will use to buy more inventory with an eye towards own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Elmast

texts.en:
Elmast is a 46-year-old divorcee who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her child. She sells accessories from her car and is successful in her work because she does it well. Her customers are friends, neighbors and shops. Elmast embarked on her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. When she first started out, she had difficulty networking.

Elmast has requested a loan of $1200 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her fourth loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her diversify her range of stock. In the future, Elmast plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her accessories business

loans.name: Ihbol

texts.ru: Бегматова Ихбол проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Муж вместе с сыном находятся на заработках в России. Ихбол более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает, откармливает и продает крупно рогатыый скот. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить скота.
texts.en:
Ihbol B. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband and son work in Russia to support the family back home. Ihbol has over five years of experience in animal husbandry. She buys, sells, and raises large cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of large cattle

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 41 year-old, local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with eleven children. Currently all of her children are in school.

In her restaurant, Theresa prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Theresa has been in business for the past 8 years. She says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 47 years old and she is married with four children. She sells ice cream and hopes for the loan of N120,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Caridad Rosario Mart

texts.en:
Caridad Rosario Mart is happily married to Marvin Scharff, a driver in their community in Mabini Street, Tuguegarao City. They are blessed with two children: Kieren Zen - 4 years old and Kaifer Giovannie - 2 years old. Caridad has been a meat dealer in their village for 3 years already. Aside from that, she also manages to sell cooked foods and some street foods for additional income. She is earning approximately PHP 250 daily that is being used to meet the daily needs of their family. She wants to save money for the future education of her two children thus strives to improve her business.

In this regard, Caridad wants to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 7,000 as additional capital. According to Caridad, “Time is Gold” so she spends every minute of her life fruitfully.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-one years old. She is married and currently has no child. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Margaret is a trader, trading in all kinds of jewels. She procures her goods from Accra and hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to sell in other communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy jewels in bulk

loans.name: Denis David

texts.es: Denis David R. L. tiene la edad de 36 años. Es un hombre my bueno y le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi ya que tiene que alimentar a sus 3 hijos y su familia. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano en busca del alimento diario. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. El ha luchado mucho para proporcionarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo. Su deseo es obtener otro vehículo para que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Denis David R. L. is 36 years old. He is a good man who enjoys his work. Denis provides taxi services so that he can feed his family of 3 children. Every day he wakes up early to begin searching for customers. For 5 years, he has been in this business. He has fought hard to provide his family with the necessary amenities.

The loan he requested will be used as working capital to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. Denis hopes to obtain another vehicle so that his children can have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Rose is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a bar to generate more profit.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. is from the village of P-7, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Celestina owns and operates a fruit stall, selling a variety of fruits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In October 2009, Celestina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: P-7, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira S., vive en un barrio marginal de la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, los cuales estudian para tener un futuro mejor, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, cansado por que abecés las carreras están malas debido a la crisis económica que el país esta pasando, pues el pueblo prefiere dar 2.50 córdobas que vale la ruta en la capital y no pagar una carrera de 40 córdobas ya que seria el alimento del día. El  negocio de la señora Yadira es la venta de ropa, zapatos el cual lleva cinco años en las ventas, muchas veces  ventas bajas, los días de pago vende y se recupera en las ventas, inicio con préstamos en banco comunales y así pudo invertir en su negocio, con este préstamo comprara ropa variada para dama, niños y caballeros para sastifacer la demanda de sus cliente ya que para estos meses de Noviembre y la navidad es la mejor época en las ventas. Espera poder obtener buenas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira S. lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children who are 12 and 13 years old and are currently studying in pursuit of a better future. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and finds the work tiring because sometimes his routes don't pay well due to the economic crisis the country is currently facing. People prefer to pay 2.50 córdobas - what a ride costs in the city of Managua - and don't want to pay taxi rides that cost 40 córdobas, since that is the money they need to buy food each day. Yadira has been selling clothing and shoes for the past 5 years, and she often has low sales. She makes most of her sales on payday, and this way she makes up for the rest of the month. She started taking out loans through a village bank, and thus was able to invest in her business. With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothing for men, women and children to satisfy her clients' demand, since November and the Christmas season are her best times for sales. She hopes to earn good profits so that she can continue to invest in her business. She is grateful to Afodenic for giving her this opportunity to take out a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda E. runs a poultry business in her village. She has been in business for four years. She has already sold some of the grown chicks and is now raising another batch of chicks.

Merlinda is hoping to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to purchase food and medicine needed for the chicks' growth. She hopes that her loan will be granted so she can pursue her business plans.

Merlinda is 36 years old and a diligent business woman. She is married and gifted with one child. Her husband operates a passenger tricycle in their village as another source of income for their family. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting, her business will continue to grow and her family will have a more comfortable way of life.

loans.use: To purchase food and medicine for her poultry business.

loans.name: Jhony Heriberto

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector El Capote, ubicado en el distrito de Picsi, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años trabaja como maestro de ceremonias de una orquesta de la ciudad de Ferreñafe los fines de semana, pero como los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad no son suficientes para mantener a su familia, se dedica durante la semana a trabajar como obreroh en los fundos de la zona, donde ejecuta labores agrícolas y de albañilería.

Jhony se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de calaminas para techar su casa, ya que las contínuas lluvias que se presentaron el año pasado dejaron debilitado su actual techo y este no resisitiría las lluvias de este verano.

Jhony es un padre de familia responsable, es muy alegre y servicial. Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos las oportunidad de estudiar una carrera con la que se ganen la vida en el futuro. En la fotografía aparece junto a un pozo que está excavando en un fundo de la zona.
texts.en:
Jhony, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the El Capote sector, Picsi district, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 20 years he has worked weekends as the master of ceremonies for an orchestra in the city of Ferreñafe. But, since income from this activity is not sufficient to support his family, during the week he works as a hired hand at local estates doing general farming and masonry chores. Jhony is requesting help from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He needs 1000 new soles to buy metal sheeting to build a roof for his house because the continuous rains of last year greatly weakened his present roof and it will not stand up to the rains this Summer. Jhony is a responsible, very cheerful and helpful father. His greatest wish is to be able to see that his children can go to school and study a career with which they can support themselves in the future. In the photo he appears next to a well he's digging on a local estate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting to build a roof.

loans.name: G.s.  Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Esperanza. Tiene 2 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza las mismas actividades económicas. En el caso de Ivon es casada tiene 26 años. Su actividad económica es la venta artesanía. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener el negocio es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otro socia Flor Dely tiene 29 años. Su actividad económica es venta de artesanía. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de que han tenidos muchos desafíos son muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de las 2 socias es ayudar a sus familias y además que sus hijos aprendan de sus negocios para que esto les ayude a salir adelante para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
The supportive group Esperanza (Hope) has two members who perform the same activity. 26-years Ivon, is married. She sells handicrafts. Even though it is very hard to keep her business running, she's one of the most hard working and dynamic people in her group. Her partner Flor Dely is 29. She also sells handicrafts. She started her business with a great deal of effort and thanks to her good administration she was able to succeed, as she’s a very responsible woman. They came together in order to succeed, and in spite of several challenges, they are strong fighters and hard workers. They are questing for funding to increase they work capital and to buy raw material. Their dream is to help their families and to transfer their business to their children, to they can use it to support themselves in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is a native of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is a 50-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. At her age, Jessie is seen as strong and determined to uplift her standard of living.

Jessie is engaged in a computer shop business and tends a variety store at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. These businesses are a big help for her family in enabling them to cover their expenses and to set aside savings for the future. Jessie is requesting a loan of PhP 15,000 as additional capital for her variety store.

Jessie dreams that someday her variety store will become a grocery store. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find stable jobs.

Jessie wants to thank ASHI for giving her initial capital for her business and for micro-insurance, training and compulsory savings that ASHI has innovated for its members.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her general store

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of Galas. She is 39 years old. Lorena is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of farm products in the local community. Lorena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lorena joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos from PMPC. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Lorena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Jaime Fernando

texts.es:
Jaime Márquez de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos en su casa, su esposa le ayuda en la zapatería, con ella tiene 3 hijos de 17, 14, 5 años estudiando.

Jaime trabajaba como empleado en una zapatería poco a poco reunió dinero para comparase las maquinas, suelas, goma y fibra.

Ahora Jaime tiene una zapatería en la que trabaja con dos empleados y su esposa desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días, arregla y hace zapatos. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tacos, fibra, goma para tener más implementos en su trabajo. En el futuro quiere expandir su taller con una sucursal.
texts.en:
Jaime Márquez, 42, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway. His house has all the basic utilities. His wife helps him in his shoe shop. They have three children, 17, 14, and 5 years old; all three are students. Jaime used to work as an employee in a shoe shop. Gradually, he saved enough money to buy the machinery, soles, adhesive and threads. Now, Jaime has a shoe shop where he works with two employees and his wife from 8am until 7pm every day; he repairs and manufactures shoes. One of the difficulties he faces is the high crime rate in the area where he lives. He wants to use the funds to buy heels, thread and adhesive in order to have more work tools. In the future, he would like to expand and open a branch of his shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Heels, threads, adhesive.

loans.name: G.s. Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario compuesto por dos personas, tienen 20 créditos y es uno de los más antiguos de la institución, son excelentes clientes. Aurora tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años con la cual ha apoyado el sustento familiar, vive con su familia. Su cónyuge es obrero y  da su aporte para el  bienestar familiar. Su amiga que es la persona con la que trabaja para salir adelante. Amparo tiene la su actividad es el destace de cerdo, elaborar comida y  dulces, vive con su familia, por lo que está a cargo de sus tres hijos donde tienen  uno de los servicios básicos primarios como es la energía y su cónyuge labora como obrero en el campo y con su salario ayuda al sustento también de la familia.
texts.en:
This supportive group made up of two people. They have twenty loans and it is one of the institution's oldest; they are excellent clients. Aurora has had a local store for more than 20 years with which she has supported her family. She lives with her family. Her spouse is a laborer and he does his part for the family's wellbeing. Her friend is the person she works with to get ahead. Amparo's activity is butchering pigs, and making food and sweets. She lives with her family and takes care of her three children where they have one of the basic services, such as electricity. Her spouse works as a laborer in the fields and with his salary he helps to support the family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mohamad Diaa

texts.en:
Mohamad Diaa is a 30 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife. Mohamad owns a bakery, and makes croissants which are a flaky crescent-shaped bread roll made of a yeast dough similar to puff pastry: they can be either plain or sweet, such as a chocolate croissant. In Lebanon we also eat many salty croissant with zaatar (thyme) and jebneh (cheese). You can eat them anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mohamad Diaa is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty croissant; he does croissant His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that Mohamad Diaa has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. 
Mohamad Diaa decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.



(Dear Kiva lenders, I just want to specify that Mohamad Diaa is the man we see in the foreground).

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden S. is 29 years old and married to a teacher. She has two school-aged children. She is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs such as rice, posho, beans etc. in her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant. With the extra profits from her loan, S. hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mr. Noem M. has been engaged in the animal sale trade since 2006. He buys cows at reasonable cost from the rural citizens and fattens them for a while before selling them to farmers or slaughterers. By doing this, he is able to receive $5 a day to serve his family’s daily food needs.
