Noem M.'s wife  sews clothes in industry, and they help each other to earn money in order to feed their two children who are enrolled in school. Noem M. has a problem with transportation. He travels to buy cows by hiring a taxi. He hopes to eliminate this expense and is requesting a loan of $1200 to be used to purchase a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle..

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 29 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector La Compuerta del distrito de Oyotún, un zona caracterizada por tener la mayor parte de su geografía muy accidentada debido a la cercanía a la sierra norte del país, su principal actividad es la agricultura aunque no cuenta con muchas areas fértiles, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona y durante ese tiempo ahorró el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir su propio terreno agrícola con el que ahora puede obtener ingresos seguros y ya no eventuales como los percibía anteriormente. 

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno y se encuentra dedicado a labores de cuidado y mantenimiento de su sembrío, el pone mucho cuidado en su cultivo por lo que desea asegurarse una buena producción. Luis desea brindarle a su cultivo mantenimiento aplicándole fertilizantes y pesticidas por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Luis es bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empersario y poder adquirir mas hectareas de terreno. En la zona donde vive el es considerado alguien tranquilo y de confianza
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 29 years old and lives with his family in the La Compuerta section of the Oyotún district, an area known for having a rough terrain due to its proximity to the mountains to the north of the country. The principal activity is agriculture even though there are not too many fertile areas. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young, he has been performing agricultural work. He started as a farm hand at various farms in the area. During that time, he saved enough money to be able to buy his own farm land, where he can now make a secure living, rather than what his previously temporary employment afforded him. He has planted corn in his fields and finds himself taking care and maintaining his crop. He puts a lot care into maintaining his crop because he wants to ensure a good production. Luis wants to apply fertilizer and pesticide to his fields and because of this he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 new soles that will help him achieve his objectives. Luis is hard-working and responsible. His main goal is to continue growing as a businessman and be able to purchase more farm land. In the area where he lives he is considered as a quiet and trustworthy man.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Application of fertilizers and pesticides for his crop.

loans.name: Letecia Cartajenas' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia C., 55 years of age and married, is a resident of Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City. Letecia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Letecia C.’ Group. 	

Letecia is married to Eleuterio, the driver of their own passenger truck for hire. They are blessed with 5 children, all now at adult age. The couple decided to engage in business, particularly in the chain saw and passenger truck for hire operating business. For 5 years already, the couple has been able to manage this business and this time they are earning an average income. She joined the cooperative in 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of PHP10,000.00 as her 2nd cycle loan. This loan will be used towards house renovation, including building of toilet and bathroom. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs and savings for future use and for future business expansion. She is hoping that someday their business will become more progressive.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation, toilet and bathroom building

location.town: Ozamis-Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make woven products

loans.name: Un

texts.en: S. is 60 years old and resides with other family members in a wooden house. She got married many years ago to Oan, age 65, on the left in the photo. He currently assists her with the business. The couple is blessed with four children; all are now married and live independently. S. has been a domestic farmer planting crops since she was single. It is the only business she has ever done for a long time. The coming rainfall season allows for farming, but S. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seeds to begin planting.

loans.name: Jacinta Wanjiku Mukundi

texts.en:
Jacinta Wanjiku Mukundi N. is 42 years old. She is married to Wilson and is the mother of four children. 

Jacinta is a farmer on her own piece of land.  She has been farming for the last 10 years.

She learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her fourth loan. She is planning to spend the 30,000 Kenyan shillings on maize farming; maize has proved to be doing very well due to fertile lands in the area and adequate rainfall. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to rent more land for farming to increase maize production. She also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.

Her future dream is that she will be able to practice large-scale maize farming. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: Maize farming

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Vanesa,  ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un tienda de venta de celulares y de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo; desde hace 1 año, La socia trae celulares y repuestos de estos de la ciudad de Puno (Juliaca), y también viaja a la ciudad de Lima para traer novedades, ella es muy emprendedora y le gustaría estudiar en la universidad, ella sabe que todo es posible con mucha dedicación y está a punto de juntar un capital de trabajo para traer más productos y después desea inscribirse a la universidad y estudiar enfermería, La socia  solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de venta de celulares.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Qori Orcco" communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of the Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco. This member is Ms. Vanesa. She is 26 years old and lives with her partner in the Urcos district. She works in retail sales. She has a store where she sells cell phones, as well as beauty products that she sells through a catalog. For a year now, she has brought cell phones and spare parts for them from the city of Puno (Juliaca), and she also travels to Lima to bring back novelties. She is a very enterprising woman and she would like to study at the university. She knows that anything is possible with a lot of dedication, and she is at the point of just getting together enough working capital to be able to bring in more products. After, she would like to enroll herself in the university to study nursing. Vanesa is requesting this loan to improve her business selling cell phones. This member values and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will make it possible for her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to comply with her repayments according to the schedule agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her business selling cell phones

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq A. is a 29-year-old man who breeds and sells cattle and sheep in Bilasuvar city. He has nine years of experience in this field. Natiq is married and has three children. He buys calves and lambs, fattens them, and then sells them for a profit to the local butchers, cafes and in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is about 200-400 AZN.  He applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase one milking cow and fodder. He believes this loan will increase his profit and improve his family life.

loans.use: To purchase one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia compra y vende pasto en el barrio de Berriozábal y el mercado central; La socia es padre y madre para sus menores hijos ella también tiene animales menores y de vez en cuando compra y vende para ayudarse con este negocio también, pero por este mes está dedicada solo a la venta de pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasto al por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Margarita is 50 years old and a single mother with two children. She divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. Margarita buys and sells fodder in the neighborhood of Berriozábal and at the central market. She must play the role of both father and mother to her two young children. Margarita also raises small animals, so buying and selling them helps to maintain her business. However, this month she plans to only sell fodder. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fodder in bulk.

Margarita says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fodder in bulk

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock simsim (sesame paste), onions and tomatoes to sell. Joice is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of simsim, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is a 44-year-old married man. He has one wife and three children. The gentleman got introduced to KADET LTD by another client who is one of the clients of KADET LTD. 

Currently, Robert operates a poultry farm where he is the sole proprietor of the business. The business is two years old and is situated in Furunzi Malindi town and the main customers are mostly nearby hotels.

This is the third time that Robert is being granted a loan from KADET LIMITED, this time in the amount of Kshs.57,000. He plans to use the loan to buy chicks for his business, to buy necessary feed for the chicks, and use the remaining  money to pay school fees for his children.

Robert wishes to use the anticipated profit coming from the business to continue educating his children and dreams that one day he may get to own a bigger and well established poultry farm as well as residential houses.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise, feed for the chicks, and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Shameem Iqbal Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shameem lives in the city of Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and famous for its textile industry. She is 42 years old, married to I. M.. Her husband has a business selling fruit. He puts the fruit on his four-wheeled cart every day and goes from street to street to sell them. He makes about 300-400 PKRs per day from his fruit selling business which is not sufficient to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Shameem is a housewife. She plays the role of a mother and a wife very well. She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Both her daughters work in people’s homes earning a small income. They do different kinds of household work like washing clothes and washing dishes. They work to contribute to their family financially. Her son is 17 years old and doesn’t currently work.
 
Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy some fresh seasonal fruits to re-sell. Shameem is hopeful that by investing the loan amount in her husband’s business, his income will grow through increasing sales. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her third loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved to be a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, Shameem is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is from the village of Bungad. She is 45 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns a business making and selling snacks. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Lina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase needed raw ingredients. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of here family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaïla D.  est un homme marié de 31ans polygame et père d’un  enfant, vivant Socourani,  un des villages de la Sous-préfecture de Fakola dans la grande famille traditionnelle, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur D.  adhéra au programme de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter,  400  kilogrammes de grains fonio, 1000  kilogrammes de maïs et 200 kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre en un moment où le prix sera plus intéressant. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  villages environnants et envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  100. 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaïla D. is a 31-year-old polygamous, married man and father of one who lives in a large traditional family in Socourani, one of the subprefecture villages of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba, in the third region (Sikasso) in the Republic of Mali. 

To better reduce his poverty, Mr. D. joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is his first loan. With this loan, he plans to buy 400 kilograms of fonio grains, 1000 kilograms of corn, and 200 kilograms of millet, which he will stock up for resale when prices are higher. He gets his supplies from neighboring villages and foresees making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María ella tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 10 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella, el marido es agricultor. Ella es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya seis ciclos este es el séptimo y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos y fáciles de pagar.
 
Ella se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5am a preparar los dulces los mismos que realiza con mucha paciencia y cariño nos dice que esa es la clave para que las cosas salgan bien hacer las cosas con mucho amor, una vez preparado sus deliciosos dulces, los entrega a comerciantes que se los llevan a vender a otros cantones y ciudades del país, en esta labor le ayuda uno de sus hijos. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 30 años y dice que su mamá le enseño a preparar los dulces.

Este crédito es para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la fabricación de los dulces. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener una microempresa con maquinarias para producir mayor cantidad de dulces.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Organizadas” [Organized Women] meet every two weeks at the Rocafuerte Canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets made by the locals and recognized throughout the country.

Maria is 57 years old, married, and has 10 adult children. Two of them live with her and her husband who is a farmer. She has been part of the communal bank for six loan cycles, this will be her seventh. She likes the bank because the interests are low and easy to pay.

She makes and sells sweets. She gets up every morning at 5:00am to make them which she does with patience and love. She says that these are the key to obtaining wonderful results. Once the sweets are ready she gives them to other vendors who take them to various cantons and cities around the country. She has done this work for 30 years and she says her mother taught her how to do it. One of her children helps her with her work

This loan will be used to buy the necessary ingredients to make the sweets. Her dream has been to have a small company with the appropriate machinery to make the sweets in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients to prepare sweets

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is 44 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a variety store, buying and selling (charcoal) and a livestock business. She lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Talacdan, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her variety store, buying and selling (charcoal) and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Annabelle is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Annabelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: 06-  Kiều Đại 2- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Hương Lê Thị L. (15) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hương is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06- Kiều Đại 2 - Đông Vệ (08.03.06 - Đông Vệ).


Hương is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Hương owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community.  Hương has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hương is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Hưng (16) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  T. Thị Vậy (17) is a 70 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  B. Thị Hà (18) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hương Lê Thị L. (15) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06 - Kiều Đại 2- Đông Vệ (08.03.06 - Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Hưng (16) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  T. Thị Vậy (17) là 70 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  B. Thị Hà (18) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the specialized retail business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a enseñar danzas típicas a grupos de niños escolares, que estudian dentro de su zona. Asimismo su esposo, quien también es profesor de danza, elabora las vestimentas y mascaras con diseños típicos de su ciudad, logrando venderlas a sus alumnos, de esa manera se genera más ingresos. Considera su trabajo muy rentable, es por esta razón que esta dispuesta a tener mas adelante una tienda de venta de vestuario y disfraces típicos. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita a que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de telas para elaborar nuevos disfraces.
texts.en: Consuelo is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and her 2 children in a rented home. Since more than 3 years ago, she has taught traditional dances to schoolchildren groups that study in her area. Also her husband, who is also a dance teacher, makes costumes and masks with traditional designs of their city, selling them to their students to generate more income. She considers her business very successful, which is why she has decided to move forward starting a shop to sell traditional clothing and costumes. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, and she is thankful to be part of her community bank because all its members are people that she knows are responsible and supportive. She thanks all the people who are part of the loan that she requests as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she receives, she will invest in the purchase of fabrics to make new costumes.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan nacido el 31 de Enero en  Cordillera Santa  Cruz, casado con la Sra.  Rosalin nacida en Sombrerito a 5 km de la Guardia, ambos se dedican a la agricultura  en Sombrerito tienen su parcela para trabajar, pero el trabaja en tierras de su suegra ayudándola porque no tiene quien trabaje agricultura, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de semillas y para los gastos que ocasiona el preparado de la tierra ellos siembran maíz, papa, arroz pero mas se dedican al achachairu, el sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan was born January 31st in Cordillera Santa Cruz. He is married to Sra. Rosalin who was born in Sombrerito at Km5 of La Guardia. Both of them are farmers in Sombrerito where they have a parcel of land in which they work, but they also work the land of his mother-in-law since she does not have anyone to maintain it.

The money from this loan will be used to buy seeds and pay for the expenses associated with preparing the land for growing corn, potatoes, and rice. However, what they grow most is “achachairú”. Sr. Juan is a hard worker who is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase seeds & pay to prepare the land

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj, 60, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a winter house on land that they own. In 2007, he began to make wood products in his backyard. He has an electric saw and mostly makes structure parts for the Mongolian nomadic housing tents called ger. He also makes furniture when he receives orders from his customers. He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I would like to have my own workshop for my carpentry business." Byambadorj is requesting a loan of 600,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and materials

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Z. Bakhtiyor is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer for the past 8 years. He began with the goal of supporting his household and, above all, to satisfy the needs of his children. For Bakhtiyor, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within farming, vegetable production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. 

Now Bakhtiyor wishes to borrow money to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He is sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Nhoem was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Nhoem was born in 1965. She and her husband are farmers who own 2-hectare plot of land on which they grow both rice and lotus to make a living. In order to support this activity, Mrs. Nhoem would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing crops. Aside from farming, they also breed pigs and sell groceries at home. With both of these businesses, they are able to earn a small amount of income to support their family. The couple has two children: one works as a shoe garment worker and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing crops

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: Jonny, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 35 años de edad, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, convive con Francisca de 30 años y fruto de su relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y  juntos viven en su propia casa, situados en la comunidad de Carmen Pampa, caserío del distrito de San Francisco. Jonny es el pilar de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra y hoy es todo un conocedor del arduo labor en el agro; es campesino y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, cacao y plátano; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 12 años en su propia parcela, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los tendales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Kimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad radica en no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en las cosechas y sacar la maleza; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su primer crédito de Jonny con MFP, esta dispuesto cumplir con sus respectivos pagos ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. A la vez se siente muy agradecido con la institución por  concederle el crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas y sacar la maleza.
texts.en:
Jonny is from the town of San Francisco.  He is 35 years old and a very happy and hard-working young man.  He lives with his partner, 30 year-old Francisca, and they have 3 children together.  They live in their own home which is located in Carmen Pampa, a small village in San Francisco district.

Jonny is the pillar of his family.  His parents taught him to grow crops from a very early age and today he is an expert in the hard slog that is farming.  Jonny is a farmer and he owns 3 hectares of land where he grows coffee, cacao and bananas.  These are all plants which are native to the rainforest area of the Apurimac Valley where he lives.  Jonny has been farming his own plot of land for 12 years.  At harvest times he is helped by laborers who harvest his crops and transport them to drying areas.

What Jonny most enjoys about his work is harvesting his crops since this is when he feels that all his hard work is being rewarded through the quality of his fruit.  He considers that the most difficult part of his work is transporting his products from his community to the warehouses in Kimbiri and San Francisco districts.  This is where they offer him the best prices for his products.  Jonny's problem is that he doesn't have enough money to pay his laborers, who support him in his harvests and in weeding his crops, in advance.  For this reason, he takes loans from MFP.  However, right now his priority is growing more coffee plants since he has 1 hectare of land that is not cultivated.

This is Jonny's first loan from MFP.  He is prepared to make his repayments on time since he would like to access further loans in the future.  He is very grateful to the institution for granting him this loan.  Jonny will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvests and in weeding his land.

loans.use: to hire laborers to support him in his harvests and in weeding his land

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 26 years old married man, living with his wife in Bint Jbeil. Ibrahim has owned a gym since 2010.  He has 10 years of experience in this field and it's very important when running this type of a business to have a minimum of this range of experience. 

Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to add walking machines (treadmills), since his customers are increasing and because this is the only gym in the region and most of his residents are requesting such a services. 
Ibrahim is taking this step to satisfy his customers needs and in order to open a new branch in the future. 

In the beginning Ibrahim had financial problems and some obstacles during the start up of his business and so he had few machines. But, through his strong will and hard work, Ibrahim expanded his gym and is willing to do more in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional new walking machines (treadmills)

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng S. O. is a 23-year-old married woman and mother who lives with other family members in her own small family home in Prey Chor commune of Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land such as cabbage and cucumbers which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband helps her to grow these vegetable crops. 

The couple is married and have two schoO.-aged children. The rains have fallen and the land is suitable for production, so Sieng S. O. has taken out a loan to buy vegetable seeds to sow on her existing farmland. She hopes to use the rest of the money to purchase a used motorbike for traveling needs as her old motorbike often breaks down during riding. Sieng S. O. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds to sow on her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Emma

texts.es:
María de 52 años,es soltera, vive sola, cuenta con casa propia de material rústico (adobe – son bloques hecho a base de barro, paja y agua) con el servicio de agua solamente, ubicada en el caserío Las Pampas a 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a unos 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y festividades religiosas muy bonitas .
María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales  (gallinas, pavos, pollos y chanchos), el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con maíz molido, polvillo de  arroz y purina.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo en los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque y Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y obtener cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado María es de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, el cual será destinado  para la compra de animales y sus alimentos para que engorden de una manera sana y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
María es una mujer que con su trabajo y empeño quiere mejorar en la vida y poder tenerlo que quiere.
texts.en:
Maria, 52 years old, is single and lives alone. She has her own home made out of rustic material called adobe - blocks made from mud, straw and water. Her home only receives water service. It is located in the village of Las Pampas, 10 minutes from the district of Morrope and 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. The principal economic activities in this district are farming, ranching and beautiful religious ceremonies.

Maria raises and sells animals (chickens, turkeys, hens and pigs). The corral where her animals live is outside of her house. She feeds them ground-up corn, rice powder and purina. Later, once her animals have reached optimal development, she sells them in the different markets of Lambayeque and Chiclayo to be able to increase her income and get things that she lacks at home.

Maria has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will be used to buy animals and their feed so that they will fatten up in a healthy way. This way she will be able to sell them at a good price and pay back her loan, while at the same time earning income that will help to improve her quality of live.

Maria is a woman who, through hard work, wants to improve her life and have what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house with electricity, but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For the past three years, Kwekwe has operated a food stall from home, selling food to her neighbours and passersby.  Seasonality is her major business challenge.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Kwekwe wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar with the Kshs 20,000 loan from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust.  She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon and her husband have made a living as rice cultivators in Siem Reap province since 1990. They grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They generate an income of around US $5 per day. This humble couple has five children; three are single and two are married. One of their children works as a domestic construction worker. The family recently encountered an issue with their living conditions as their old house was damaged during rain storms. Mrs. Phon is requesting a loan since the family doesn’t have the immediate cash to repair their house.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Dreysi

texts.es:
Dreysi, de 19 años, es una joven muy sencilla y amable, vive en casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Son 16 horas las que Dreysi pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, su bodega es una de las más concurridas de barrio, ya que sus vecinos saben que ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y pueda brindarles mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra.
Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Dreysi, aged 19, is a very simple, kind young woman who lives with her parents and is inclined to work very hard to get ahead in life. Dreysi daily spends some 16 hours inside her shop, opening at 6:00 am and attending all day until approximately 10:00 at night. Her general store is one of the most visited in the barrio, because its residents know that here they will always find what they need.

What Dreysi likes most about her work is to converse with her neighbors. She has been involved in this activity for a year now and she hopes that her business will grow and offer her a better economic return.  

This will be Dreysi's 3rd loan with MFP, and she is disposed to work very hard to be able to make her payments punctually. In her communal bank, Dreysi is very respected for the punctuality she has demonstrated.

With the 1,200 new sols solicited, Dreysi will buy more products to better stock her store.

loans.use: buy various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Marquesa

texts.es:
Marquesa es una mujer  dedicada a todo lo que hace, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 24 y 289 años, que son su motor para continuar esforzándose cada día más con alergia y tenacidad.  Desde el año 1983 vive en el sur de la ciudad y hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos, productos de catálogos de los cuales ofrece a sus clientes las mejores ofertas.  
Adquirió toda su experiencia  de su fallecido esposo, quien fue un excelente comerciante y muy dedicado a la venta de carros, de bienes raíces y hasta la venta de carne de res, pero hace 6 años murió víctima de un atraco, así fue que  Marquesa debió asumir ella sola toda la responsabilidad de su familia y especialmente la de su carnicería, de la que por su muy poca experiencia debió desprenderse y dedicarse al comercio de ropa, calzad y electrodomésticos, al cual posteriormente agregó cosméticos ofrecidos mediante guías especializadas de productos, todo esto  con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. El credikiva es el primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará electrodomésticos, aprovechando que hay una gran oferta que puede aprovechar y ya hizo la preventa de tal manera que conoce muy bien que va a vender y a quien. Su meta más adelante es lograr acceder a los mercados de los municipios del departamento y construir la segunda planta de su casa. Mientras esto sucede Marquesa continua esforzándose para superar la rentabilidad de su negocio que en la actualidad se encuentra en un 30%.
texts.en:
Marquesa is a woman dedicated to everything that she does. She is a widow and has two children ages 24 and 28 who are her motivation to continue working hard every day more with happiness and tenacity. Since 1983, she has lived in the south of the city and for ten years she has been dedicated to selling clothing, footwear, appliances, catalog products which she offers to her customers at great deals.

She acquired all of her experience from her late husband who was an excellent trader and very dedicated to selling cars, real estate, and meat. But six years ago, her died a victim of a holdup so Marquesa had to assume all of the responsibility of her family and especially of their butchershop that, due to her little experience, she had to detach from and dedicate herself to selling clothing, shoes and appliances, to which she later added cosmetics offered through special product guides. All of this with the goal of getting her family ahead. The crediKiva is the first loan made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase appliances taking advantage of the fact that there is a great offer that she can take advantage of and that she has already made and she already knows well what and to whom she'll sell. Her goal in the future is to gain access to the local markets and to build the second story of her house. In the meantime, Marquesa continues to work to overcome the profitability of her business which is currently at 30%.

loans.use: to purchase appliances.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estela; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora.
texts.en:
Señora Estela is a member of the communal bank "Mama Simona".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling chicha, a beverage made from corn.  She sells as a street vendor from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Through this business she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand her chicha sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn and jora [a type of corn used to make chicha].  

                      
                                                                                                 .

loans.use: purchase corn and jora.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 31, is single. He is a boda boda operator and has been in this business for the last two years. 

This is his first loan with KADET and he plans to expand his business by purchasing fuel for his mini fueling station. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to expand his business further.

Michael’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing fuel for his mini fueling station.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and is married to Erick. She has a family of seven people. She has been farming poultry for the past four years. Her monthly income is KES.5,000/=. This is her second loan. She will use the KES.40,000 loan to expand her business; she will buy more stock of poultry and poultry feed.

The profit that she will get from her poultry farming will be used in her business and to pay school fees. Her hope and dream for the future is to be able to provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora  Jacqueline, es habitante del municipio de Ninidiri, junto a su esposo e hijos, él labora en una empresa privada, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, doña Jacqueline desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio (pulpería) ya que con mucho esfuerzos  y empeño su pequeño negocio crece gracias al financiamiento obtenido que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva, el cual le permite incrementar su inventario y a la vez mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is an inhabitant of the municipality of Ninidiri with her husband and children.  Her husband works in a private company.  To support him with the household expenses, for several years Jacqueline has worked in business (grocery store).   

With much effort and commitment, her small business is growing thanks to funding obtained from Afodenic through Kiva.  This funding allows Jacqueline to increase her inventory while improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí de 25 años, es una joven soltera y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Noemí, con su puesto de trabajo trata de mejorar su condición de vida. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes donde ofrece variedad de víveres de primera necesidad. La bodega de Noemí es muy concurrido por sus compradores, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores. Sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 05 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este es su segundo préstamo que tiene y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, para desarrollar su trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, implementará su bodega con víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite y conservas.
texts.en:
25-year-old Noemí is a single and hard-working young woman who has a desire to succeed in life.  She lives in her own home and what she most wants is to make better income so that she can provide her future family with financial stability.  Through her work, Noemí tries to improve her living conditions.  She is a saleswoman and has a grocery store where she sells a variety of essential household products.  Noemí's store is very popular with her customers.  She opens the doors of her business very early in the morning and is ready to receive her first customers.  Knowing that she has a good range of merchandise in her store, her customers don't hesitate to buy from her since they know that they will find what they need.

What Noemí most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  She has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet nearly all day.  Over time, she plans to increase her profits and expand her store.

This is Noemí's second loan and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in making progress in her work.  She will use the 3,000 soles that she has requested to stock her business with essential household products such as rice, sugar, oil and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, oil and canned goods

loans.name: Lenida

texts.en:
Lenida is a 44-year-old married woman with 5 children. She and her family live in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.

Lenida has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell at her town's market. Lenida is in need of seeds, insecticides and fertilizers. She applied for a loan to buy the farm supplies she needs. Lenida hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. 

To earn a living, Gemma plants and harvests various fruits and vegetables. She grows pineapple, lanzones, mango, root crops, legumes, and many more. She sells them in the local market and to interested neighbors. She has been gardening for five years. Each month, Gemma earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers.

In 2009, Gemma joined GDMPC. This is her fourth loan cycle in the cooperative, and she expects there will be another in the future. Gemma hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to boost production

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y muy responsable, convive con su pareja y es madre de  cinco hijos de los cuales tres ya son mayores e independientes pero dos de elllos aún dependen de ella. Por tanto ella dedica en su educación, y juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida, es así que se se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado a buscar los mejores productos que serán la materia prima para le preparación de los alimentos, entre ellos están las verduras frescas, frutas dulces, carnes tanto de res como de pollo. Luego en su casa realiza la preparación de sus deliciosos platillos, y del que muchos de sus clientes gustan de ello. Tiene cinco años realizando esta actividad, y hasta la fecha ha trabajado sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo disponible para dedicarse a su casa, y a sus hijos, le esta yendo bien ya que tiene doble ingresos, pues además de la venta de comida, hace poco empezó alquilar su mototaxi y eso le genera más ingresos extras. Espera mas adelante mejorar la infraestructura de su local y así seguir brindando lo mejor a sus clientes. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, esta contenta de pertenecer a este grupo ya que es muy unido y todos son muy responsables. Además esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que anteriormente le dieron y que espera una vez más apoyarlos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes, materia prima par la preparación de sus comidas, ya que desea aumentar la variedad de paltillos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Eva, 46, is a very cheerful, dynamic and very responsible woman living with her spouse; she’s the mother of five children three of which are already adults and independent but two of them are still dependent on her.  Because of this she sees to their education and they live together in her house.  

The work she does is selling food.  She rises very early to go to the market to look for the best products which will be the raw ingredients for her meal preparation.  Among them are fresh vegetables, sweet fruit, both chicken and beef.  She then prepares the delicious dishes at home that many of her customers love.  She’s been in business five years and to date has been working by herself.  What she likes about her work is having time available to dedicate to her home and to her children.  She’s doing well because she has two sources of income because besides selling food she recently started to lease her mototaxi and this generates extra income.  She hopes later on to improve the infrastructure of her locale to provide the best for her customers.

This will be her 6th MFP loan.  She’s happy to belong to this group that’s so united and all are very responsible.  Besides, she’s grateful for the support she got previously and hopes once again to support them.  She will use the amount requested to buy ingredients, raw materials, to prepare her meals since she hopes to increase the variety of dishes she offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of snacks, cigarettes, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Actualmente, Ángela solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, porque su padre y hermanos están iniciando el proceso de siembra, comprara abono y herbicidas, el préstamo le ayudara sobre todo a su padre para que cuente con lo necesario para el cultivo.
La aspiración de Ella es, apoyar a su familia mientras permanezca soltera, que sus padres sientan su ayuda, además desea que el negocio con la granja de cerdos cada día sea más prospero.
texts.en:
Currently Angela is asking for a loan in order to buy agriculture supplies because her father and brothers are beginning the process of planting. 

She will buy fertilizer and herbicides. The loan will especially help her father because he will have have what he needs to grow the crops. 

Her dream is to help her family while she is single, as her parents feel the need of her help, and also she hopes that the pig farm is more prosperous every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with five children. For the last 30 years, she has been operating a tailoring business to support her family. Previously, she was employed. 

Since Grace joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more fabric. In the next five years, she wants to become an employer. Grace dreams of buying a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Alcira Isabel

texts.es:
Alcira Isabel vive en el departamento de Masaya y tiene la edad de 27 años. Es casada y actualmente se dedica a laborar con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. 

Hoy en día está necesitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, zinc y pago de la mano de obra para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita con urgencia.

Comenta que su familia necesita la comodidad que se merecen y ella quiere esforzarse para realizar ese proyecto y para ello confía en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo necesario para ver su sueño hecho realidad.
texts.en:
Alcira Isabel lives in the Masaya district and is 27 years old. She is married and currently works in order to support her household. Today she is in need of a loan in order to invest in the purchase of some construction materials such as cement, sand, and zinc, as well as to pay for the labor to bring her urgently needed home improvements to completion. 

She tells us that her family is in need of the comfort that they deserve and that she wants to push herself to complete this project. That's why she's confident that Ceprodel [Kiva field partner] will provide her with the support she needs to see her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Elena de 46 años y fruto de esa relación tiene a su única hija Davita de 19 años, a quien desea brindar una buena educación. Carlos, es un hombre muy laborioso, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La bodega de Carlos es muy concurrido por sus compradores, empieza abrir las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 02 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias para poder hacer crecer aún más su negocio y solventar a su familia. Este sera su crédito número 01 con MFP, esta contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar abarrotes para poder incrementar su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros,
texts.en:
Carlos, 62, is a hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, Elena, 46, and their daughter, Davita, 19, who they want to receive a good education.  Carlos works hard to get ahead.  He is a merchant and has a grocery store in the community and many customers.  He opens very early in the morning to receive the first shoppers who know they will find what they need.  What he enjoys most about his work is being able to talk to customers and using his persuasive conversations to generate more customers.  

He has been in business for two years and believes that the hardest part of his job is having to be on his feet all day long.  He plans to use the loan to buy more groceries for the business and stock the store.  He hopes to be able to make a better profit in the future so he can grow and take good care of his family.  This is his first loan through MFP and he is happy about receiving this financial support.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time and plans to use the 2,000 PEN to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, sweets and other items.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
A rural villager located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Noeun is a 41 year-old mother of two dependent children. She and her husband have been farming on her farmland and planting cassava as a main income source for twenty years. With her current business, Noeun earns US$5 per day and is able to save US$2.5 daily. 

With a lack of money for her business, Noeun is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crops and cassava. This loan will enable her to harvest her crops timely, ready them for consumption, sell them to better support her living and set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jlg-001-Aathanur Group

texts.en:
49-year-old Tamilarasi has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works hard as a daily wage labourer to support her family, and saves diligently.

However, her finances are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like a toilet in her home. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Tamilarasi and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, the group seeks a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Belki Yessenia

texts.en:
My name is Belki Yessenia. I’m a saleswomen. I have a store in the commercial area in my city. I’ve been in this industry for two years. With the income from my business, I can pay for my family’s expenses, and my education. I am single, and am currently in third year of College. My idea is to stock up my store so I can offer more variety to my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase women’s shirts and jeans, men’s jeans, t-shirts, purses, dresses, skirts, and lotions.

Mi Nombre el Belki Yessenia, soy comerciante, tengo un negocio en la zona del comercio de mi ciudad, cuento con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, con este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y de estudio, ya que soy soltera y actualmente curso el tercer añod en la Universidad, mi idea es de surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de Blusas de mujer, Jeans de Mujer, Jeans de Varon, camisetas, cartera, lociones,bestidos, faldas

loans.name: Wajia

texts.en:
Wajia is a client of AFSG. Born in 1982, married with Mobin and with 3 children, she now lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.
 
She took a loan for her husband's general store to support her family's financial situation. AFSG granted her a loan which her husband used for purchasing required materials such as rice, beans, tea, sugar, etc. for his general store.

loans.use: To buy goods like rice, ghee, tea, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock and rent a location for his retail shop

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is 27 years old and lives with her husband (pictured here) and their 2 children in Kampong Chnang.  Mrs. Chea S. works part time selling rice and other basic Khmer dishes at a small roadside stand, and part time with her husband selling the products that he carves.  The couple also supports Mrs. Chea's mother and sister who sometimes stay with them.  This loan will be used to purchase more stone and stone carving tools for their business. In the future, Mrs. Chea S. hopes to stop her food selling business so she can focus entirely on the stone carving business with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more stone and carving tools to operate their business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouvi G., 39, is married and mother of four children; she is responsible for another child as well. She earns her living selling plastic bags which is quite profitable but since she lacks capital, she has not been able to expand at all. In order to do just that, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to expand her little micro-business and better satisfy the demands of her customers. This will allow her to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 39 ans Madame G. Akouvi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un (1) autre enfant. Elle exerce comme activité principale la vente des sachets plastique qui lui réussit très bien mais faute de moyens elle n’arrive pas à plus le rentabiliser. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 agrandir la taille de son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Expanding her plastic bag business
  Achat et vente des sachets plastique

loans.name: Latifa

texts.ru:
Latifa H. was born in 1959 in Agsu. She has a family with 3 children. She has been a pharmacist for over 20 years. After the breakup of the USSR she opened her own business and has been active in this sphere. Latifa needed new inventory and she turned to the Agsu division of Normicro. She borrowed $500 and purchased the necessary inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнова Латифа, родилась 1959 году в городе Аксу. Семейная , имеет троих детей . Уже более двадцати лет она работает аптекарем. После падения союза она открыла свой бизнес. Активно занимаетсья в этой сфере. Латифе нужна было новый инвентарь и она обратилась В Нормикро Аксуниский филиал. Взяла кредит 500$ и купила необходимый инвентарь.

loans.use: For purchase of inventory

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: I am Shahida B. from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I live in a small two room brick house with my husband and seven children. My husband and I both decorate bangles with various beads and traditional ornaments. We buy these bangles from a nearby bangle market and embellish them with various ornamental stuffs and sell them to various shops. We request a loan of $250 to expand our business to increase our household earnings.

loans.use: To expand bangles business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz Marina is 48 years old and a widow. She has two children who are professionals and independent. She sells beer and soft drinks and also rents out five rooms in her home. Her house could, in the future, become a recreation center and on weekends she sells mixed grill, seafood, "juanes" (a mix of rice, chicken, egg and olive, wrapped in banana leaves) and other foods. To consolidate her goal of starting up her business and making improvements to the rooms she rents, she needs a loan which will be invested in the business. She hopes you will help her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Marina, tiene 48 años D. edad y es viuda, cuenta con dos hijos que son profesionales e independientes y se dedica a la venta D. cervezas y bebidas gaseosas; al mismo tiempo cuenta con cinco habitaciones D. alquiler. En casa posee un ambiente que en el futuro podría convertirse en un recreo turístico, por lo que los fines D. semana realiza actividades D. venta D. parrilladas, maruchas, juanes y otros.Para concretar el propósito D. implementar su negocio y mejorar las habitaciones D. alquiler, necesariamente requiere D. un préstamo como capital D. inversión para destinarlo a dicho propósito. Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada D. vuestro noble y bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Start up her own business.

loans.name: Masanda C(Ii) Group

texts.en: Madalena is divorced with five children. She sells charcoal for a living. She intends to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for the children. Jane sells handbags and wants to use the loan to expand profits. Immaculate sells airtime cards and wants to re-invest in the business with the loan. Rebecca has a piggery business while Faith is a poultry farmer.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Eka Sukartini

texts.en: Eka, 34, is a mother of 4 children; 3 boys and 1 girl. Her husband, S., has no fixed job so he could not provide enough income for the family. To help her husband cover the family needs she sells clothings on credit door-to-door. She collects the payment weekly, earning $10 a week. She is a member of MBK and is now asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Bahromjon Holikulov lives in the Khuroson area, in the village of Haeti-nav. He is married with 1 child and has a community college degree. He is a farmer who owns some land and plants wheat and other grains. The harvest goes for his own family use and also for sale. The sales help his family buy food like flour, vegetable oil and other essentials. Right now it is planting season and Bahromjon needs money to buy seeds. He hopes to get a loan that he can use to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. He will repay the loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Холикулов Бахромджон Махмадаллиевич прживает в районе Хуросон в поселке Хаети нав.Женат , и имеет 1 ребенка. Образование среднее , занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеиват пшеницей и другими злаковыми культурами. Полученный урожай использует для семьи и для продажи. Это помогает обеспечить семью мукой , льняным маслом , то есть продуктами первой необходимости. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для засева земли. Найти деньги он решил путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту купить качественные семена и удобрения.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's clothing in bulk to replenish her stock and increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
This committee is formed by 15 hard-working women from the Santa Ana neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 7th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) program, and to date, they all manage a line of credit of approximately 953.000 guaranis per member.

The first meetings for this committee took place in the home of Liliana H., and more than 15 women interested in being a part of this committee of hard-working women were present. Due to the occupation of most of its members, which is selling chipas (a typical dish from Paraguay), the first meetings took place very early in the morning. Liliana says that after the first few gatherings, the 15 women interested in taking part in the program were left, and since that is the minimum amount of members required, they were able to formally begin the committee, which is named Mujeres Emprendedoras de Santa Ana (Entrepreneurial Women of Santa Ana) and today is one of the longest-standing committees.

Currently, they find themselves in the middle of a project for the month of June due to the San Juan festivities, where they hold fairs with typical dishes and traditional games, such as the one with the guaraní name of “Tata ari jehasa,” with the objective of raising funds to strengthen the committee’s internal savings.

The loans they will receive will be invested in the purchase of ingredients used in the making of chipas such as starch, oil and cheese, as well as the purchase of herbs, sugar and sodas. Some of the women, especially the ones in the business of dressmaking, will purchase fabric, thread, a variety of buttons, zippers and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Santa Ana de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 7to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprededoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 953.000 por cada integrante.

Las primeras reuniones del comité se realizó en el domicilio de la señora Liliana H. y estuvieron presentes mas de 15 señoras interesadas en formar parte del comités de mujeres trabajadoras, debido a la actividad que desarrolla la mayoría de las integrantes, que es la de vender chipas (comida típica de Paraguay), las primeras reuniones se realizaron a primeras horas de la mañana. Liliana cuenta que al final de las primeras charlas quedaron las 15 señoras interesadas en integrar el programa y como esa es la cantidad minima exigida, pudieron empezar formalmente el comité que lleva por nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras de Santa Ana y que hoy día es uno de los comités más antiguos.

Actualmente se encuentran en un proyecto de realizar una actividad en este mes de junio por las festividades de San Juan, en donde se realiza una ferias de comidas típicas y juegos tradicionales como el que lleva por nombre en guaraní “ Tata ari jehasa” con el objetivo de recaudar fondos para fortalecer el ahorro interno del comité.

Los préstamos que recibirán lo invertirán en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas como ser almidón, aceite, queso, queso, como así también para la compra de yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, también algunas señoras compraron especialmente las que se dedican al rubro de la confección telas, hilos, variedades de botones, cierres entre otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as starch, vegetable oil, cheese, sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, beef, sodas, beer and all kinds of beverages, as well as fabric, thread and clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Luis Adolfo

texts.es:
Luis Adolfo, a young 29 year old who lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, is single and does not have any children yet. He sells ceramic tiles, a business that he initiated 8 years ago.
