At first, the most difficult part was the acquisition of a location in order to set up shop. The business started with little inventory which he purchases with his own savings. However, it has grown over time and he has been able to increase sales. The use of this loan will be for the purchase of more ceramic tiles in order to reinforce his inventory, since his plans are to grow in order to have more locations where he can offer his products.

Tranlsated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Adolfo, un joven de 29 años que habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es soltero y todavía no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cerámica, negocio que inició hace 8 años, y que al principio lo más difícil fue la adquisición de un local para realizar sus ventas, el negocio lo empezó con poco inventario ya que solamente contaba con ahorros personales, pero a través de este tiempo ha ido creciendo y ha podido aumentar su negocio. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de más cerámica para fortalecer su inventario ya que sus planes son crecer para tener más locales en los que ofrecer su producto.

loans.use: Reinforcement of inventory through the purchase of ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.en:
S. Fakhriddin is 26 years old. He is a loving husband, and the father of two children. For a long time he has been running his own business in a store which he rents. Fakhriddin began his own store with his hard earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He has been selling different kinds of car paints and putties in his store for the past 3 years. Over the years, Fakhriddin has acquired the knowledge and skills required for his business. His brother, who is pictured in the photo, helps Fakhriddin with the business. Their goal for their business is to establish it as a great success.

Fakhriddin is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to provide a quality level of service for his customers. He will use the loan to purchase more merchandise and increase the range of his inventory. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To restock supplies and increase range of sold goods

loans.name: Jero Made Arsa

texts.id: Walaupun usinya sudah  senja , namun Jero Made Arsa harus terus berusaha karena suaminya,  Ketut Luwer, mengalami stroke sejak satu tahun yang lalu. Jero memelihara banyak babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Jero membeli 1 induk babi, setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan, induk babi mempunyai anak sebanyak 6 ekor. Jero memberi makan babinya 2x sehari, pada pagi dan sore hari. Selain dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Jero juga memberi daun-daunan seperti, daun pisang, daun talas, batang pisang dan juga ampas tahu. Sekarang induk babi sudah melahirkan lagi  anak sebanyak 9 ekor. Keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah anak babi terjual perekor seharga Rp. 250.000.- Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membiayai kebutuhan hidupnya karena suaminya sudah tidak mampu lagi bekerja karena sakit. Jero Made Arsa tergabung dalam program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Harapannya dari pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Jero akan menambah 1 induk babi lagi dan juga bibit untuk penggemukan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri, dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen, dan anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama dengan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Even though has been old, Jero Made Warsa should work. Her husband, Ketut Luwer, got heart attacked last year that he can not work anymore. Jero runs a pig breeding business. She raises several pigs behind their house. With Rp 1,000,000 as the initial investment, Jero purchased a pig, and after being taken care for 6 months, the pig produced 6 piglets.Jero feeds her piglets twice a day, early in the morning and in the afternoon. She feeds them with rice and oat hush, and also leaves such as banana leaves, taro leaves, banana stems, and tofu trashes. Now, the pig has produced another 9 piglets. Jero was able to earn Rp 250,000 income for a piglet sold. The income is disbursed to finance their daily needs. Jero Made Warsa has been a member of Dinari for 6 months, and repaid the loan at the end of the period. She hopes that from the loan proposed this time, she will be able to purchase another pig and some piglets to be raised, and the rest will be disbursed to purchase fodder. Jero and his husband live in their own permanent house. Their children have got married and live with their spouses.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pig, piglets and fodder

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene 37 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata II y vive en la Av. Nuevo Trujillo Mz B lote 9-II, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó la educación secundaria y continuó estudiando computación, pero se comprometió con el señor Santos Ambrosio Díaz con el que tiene dos hijos, un varón y una mujer, son gemelos.
La invitaron a vender productos de belleza y le rindió económicamente muy bien. Continua en este negocio y se ha convertido en una excelente vendedora. Cuando la invitaron a participar en el banco comunal tenía un poco de desconfianza, pero le sirvió de mucho. Actualmente está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, el cual canceló en 4 cuotas, compró productos para tenerlo en stock.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará productos para tenerlo en stock.
Marita, como todos la llaman, sueña con tener un mini mercado muy surtido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel is 37 years old and belongs to the community bank Hilos de Plata II and lives at Av. Nuevo Trujillo Mz B lote 9-II, district of Huanchaco, province of Trujillo, department of Liberty in Peru. She finished school and studied computers, but got engaged with Mr. Santos Ambrosio Diaz and they have now twins, a boy and a girl. She was invited to sell beauty products and it worked out very well for her. She continued this business and turned into an excellent saleswoman. When she was invited to participate on a community bank she wasn’t sure about it, but now she is very grateful. With her first loan of 300 soles that she paid in 4 quotes she bought products to increase her stock. With the current loan of 500 soles that will be paid in 4 quotes she will also invest on increasing her inventory. Marita, as everyone calls her, dreams on having a very well stocked mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beauty products.

loans.name: Helen Amen

texts.en:
Helen Amen O. is 42 years old. She is married and she has one child who is in school.

Helen lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a business selling wood. She goes to the sawmill to purchase logs of wood and to pay so she can saw the wood into different sizes. She then supplies the wood directly to builders for building houses. She is happy because she makes a lot of profit from this business.

Helen is now requesting a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more wood to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Our applicant is known as Sweetie Pie and, as her name implies, she is a lovable woman.  She runs a sari-sari store, a community-based business that sells a variety of items in high demand in her area. Her husband is employed as a local agent for a distributing company based in their town. They have three children: Hersal, 18 years old and a third-year college student; Charmaine, 18 years old, a second-year nursing student; and Dennies Kae, 12 years old, a first-year high school student. They live in the village of Magsaysay, which is a few kilometers from the highway and near the local city hall. The village is known for rapid development and for its peaceful and orderly nature.

Her small store is open from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening.  Sweetie Pie decided to open her store because her husband's income is not large enough to support all the educational needs of their children.
  
At present, Sweetie Pie is using her income to pay for the cost of having two children in college. She is seeking a loan to buy additional inventory for her store, including soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, canned foods and other items.  By expanding her business, she will be able to help her husband meeting more of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in  her store

loans.name: Mardelia

texts.es: Mardelia, de 58 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, en la actualidad viven solo con su esposo. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa, Mardelia tiene como principales clientes a sus vecinos, ya que es su tienda la única en su zona, por lo que tiene buena venta y satisfactorias ganancias. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, debido a que en todos estos años ha hecho amistad con sus vecinos, y por su trato amable siempre consigue nuevos clientes. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su tienda, como también comprará más productos para surtirlo.
texts.en:
Mardelia, who is 58 years old and is mother to two sons who are independent and have their own families, currently lives alone with her husband. For ten years, she has sold groceries in the small shop that she established in her home. Mardelia's main customers are her neighbors since her shop is the only one in the area. As a result, she has good sales and satisfactory income. She likes her work a lot since, over all these years, she has made friendships with her neighbors and, through her friendly treatment, she always gains new customers. This is her second loan with MFP. With the money she his requesting, she will expand her shop. In addition, she will buy more products to stock it.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: More merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Delfi Aleman Uno Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "DELFI ALEMÁN UNO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA CARMEN Y COMPUESTO POR 15 MIEMBROS LOS CUALES VAN CURSANDO JUNTOS SU CUARTO CICLO EN LOS CUALES DEMOSTRARON RESPONSABILIDAD Y HONESTIDAD EN SU PAGOS Y UN TRABAJO EN EQUIPO EJEMPLAR POR LO QUE CUENTAN CON MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS Y CON LA CONFIANZA DE LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL. EN SU MAYORÍA ESTE GRUPO SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE PRODUCTOS COMO SER  VERDURA, COMIDA, ROPA, PAN, FRUTA Y A SERVICIO DE COCINA, CONSTRUCCIÓN Y CONFECCIÓN DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR. EN EL COMERCIO EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA, PERO LAS SOCIAS TIENEN BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA PARA SABE COMO MANEJAR CUALQUIER ADVERSIDAD. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS, MATERIALES Y HERRAMIENTAS PARA MEJORAR SUS PRODUCTOS E INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS PARA SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
The Delfi Alemán Uno Group is represented by Ms. Carmen and comprised of fifteen members who have completed their fourth loan term together and demonstrated responsibility and honesty in their payments, and exemplary teamwork that those with a lot of experience in supportive groups can count on. They also have the trust of the Fundación Agrocapital. The majority of this group sells products like vegetables, food, clothing, bread, and fruit, or works in kitchen service, construction, and the sewing of clothing. There is plenty of competition in business, but these associates have plenty of experience to know how to overcome any obstacle. This loan is for buying supplies, materials, and tools to improve their products and to increase their earnings to support their families and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Expenses

loans.name: Oblokul

texts.en:
H. Oblokul has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never went without the daily bread.  He is married and has four children. 

Oblokul has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs.  With a starting capital of $500, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 2 years ago.  Today this business has become domestic and his children and wife are also engaged in the business. 

Today Oblokul needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $800 for the term of 12 months. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.  
     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells hair extensions and foodstuffs. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Oluwafemi Olalekan

texts.en: Oluwafemi Olalekan A. has a shop at the front of his house where he barbs hair for his customers.  He is requesting a loan of N80,000  to purchase more barbing materials, like hair clippers.  He is 28 years old and married with a child.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more barbing materials.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina L., 25, is married with two children.  She has five years of experience in the pig farming business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Antonina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and supplies

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
Amelyn operates a typical school vending business. Her business sits in front of the Isabela State University (ISU) Angadanan campus. In the summer, Amelyn temporarily halted her sales. She will begin again when classes start in June. She is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to continue her school vending business. The amount she is requesting will be a big help for her business operations. She hopes that through her lender’s support, patience, and the improvement of her business, she will improve her family’s living situation.

Amelyn is 37 years old and she is married to Louie V.. Louie is a farm laborer in their village. They have been blessed with two children. Melchor is 11 years old and in grade school. Melod is 9 years old and also in grade school. They peacefully live at Barangay Centro 3 in Angadanan, Isabela.

loans.use: To continue her vending business

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D., 29 ans est célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge   Son activité est la vente d’effets vestimentaires. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de thioub (tissus teintés) pour améliorer ces conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Binta D., age 29, is unmarried and has one child to support. Her work involves selling clothing and accessories. She wants to bolster her business selling thioub (dyed cloth) to improve living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing and accessories

loans.name: Symplicia

texts.fr: K. Symplicia est née le 02/03/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin dans le Département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin. Simplicia est mariée à HODONOU jean Gabin, un commerçant. Symplicia est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Depuis cinq ans Simplicia a comme activité la vente de Charbon de bois en sac et en détail. Symplicia a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé pour son activité et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Symplicia est satisfaite du premier crédit de ALIDé, elle espère toujours bénéficier des prestations de ALIDé pour consolider son activité. En effet, Symplicia sollicite son second crédit de ALIDé pour s'approvisionner davantage en sacs de charbon de bois surtout en cette période de saison de pluie où le charbon de bois est difficile à trouver et coûte plus cher.
texts.en:
Symplicia K. was born March 2nd, 1970 in Cotonou, Economic Capital of the Republic of Benin, in the Atlantic Region of Southern Benin. Symplicia is married to a merchant named Jean Gabin Hodonou. Symplicia is the mother of four children, whom are all enrolled in school. For the past five years, Symplicia's work has primarily been the sale of wood charcoal by the bag and by the piece. Her work has already benefited from a first a loan from Alidé , and Symplicia has paid back that initial loan in full. Symplicia is happy with her first loan from Alidé and hopes to keep benefiting from their services in order to continue expanding her business. Therefore, Symplicia is asking for a second loan from Alidé in order to increase her stock of wood charcoal, which has become difficult to find and more costly during this rainy season.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a supply of Charcoal

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe y su hermano David viven juntos y tiene un negocio que acaban de iniciar de nombre “Estética Biby” donde realizan cortes de cabello, tintes, bases, etc. 
El motivo de esta solicitud de crédito es para la inversión en compra de mercancía y materiales que requieren al momento de realizar un trabajo a sus clientes y así cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Guadalupe and her brother David live together and have a business that they just started, named "Estética Biby", where they cut, color and style hair. This loan is requested in order to invest in merchandise and materials that they need when they are working on their customers, so that they have what they need on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells drinks and wine. she has been in this business for the past 28 years. Deborah is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She is very determine and ambitious about the speedy growth of her business and that of her family. 

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Deborah is requesting a loan of N140, 000 to purchase more drinks and wine to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and drinks to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 27 years old. She is divorced with a child who is currently in school. She assumed full responsibility for financing her child’s education when she was divorced by her husband. She owns and operates a dressmaking shop. She sews all forms of female wear with various kinds of styles that suit the taste of her customers, like "kaba" and slit, funeral clothes, dresses, skirts, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy supplies and material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.  She hopes to raise a good income to provide her daughter with a quality education and be able to support her household adequately.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Tannis

texts.en:
"'Maid by Me' allows me to control my own destiny and make my own success.”

Tannis, known as “Tan,” had her own greeting-card business in Canada before she came to the U.S. in 2003. She had no experience in the cleaning industry, but fell into it when a friend asked her if she wanted to earn some extra money by helping a family member paint his house. The homeowner was so impressed by her work that he asked for her housekeeping help on a regular basis

In the last year, Tan has quickly built a base of 20 clients for her residential janitorial service business, Maid By Me, and has developed a following on Yelp.com. Tan differentiates her business by using only natural cleaning products like baking soda, vinegar, steam, and lemons. She loves a challenge now and then, like carpet stains, candle wax, and hard water deposit removal. She prides herself in not leaving anything unfinished.

Currently, Tan does not have the equipment or staff to service more than three houses a day, and has to turn down clients. Her lack of credit history made her ineligible for a bank loan or a credit card. She is grateful for a $2,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, which she will use to purchase two heavy-duty vacuums, cleaning supplies, and an outdoor storage container. 

Tan has one dedicated full-time employee, and in the future would like the ability to add to her staff so she can take on more of a business management role. 

She says, “One day when I expand, my staff will clean as I do...no exceptions!  I’ve been running the show for about a year and a half now with much success. Success in my definition is keeping my clients happy--not just satisfied.”  

Learn more on the Maid by Me website at http://www.creamofthecrops.toesinthegrass.info/html/maid_by_me.html .

loans.use: Two heavy duty vacuums, outside storage, cleaning supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es casada, tiene 47 años y  dos hijos de 19 y 13 años, el mayor trabaja y el menor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Carmen estudió costura, cuando terminó consiguió trabajo en una empresa de confección, allí estuvo por diez años, pero tuvo que salir de la fabrica porque al fallecer su mamá no tenía quien le cuide a sus hijos mientras ella se iba a trabajar. Con la liquidación que recibió compró un kiosco de madera y una máquina de coser y dentro de un mercado consiguió un sitio el cual alquila, ella se dedica a coser, hace arreglos de ropa de acuerdo a las solicitudes de sus clientes, también hace teñidos.
Desde que Carmen asiste a FINCA ha recibido mucha orientación de cómo mejorar su negocio, a través de las charlas de Gestión Empresarial.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de materiales para coser.     
El sueño de Carmen es  tener una estabilidad laboral, porque nos manifiesta que no siempre tiene trabajo de costura.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, married, is a partner of the Communal Bank of a New Day. She has two children aged 19 and 13, the eldest works while the younger child is studying in a state school. Carmen studied sewing which, when she finished, led to work in a dress-making business where she was for ten years. However, she had to leave the factory because her mother passed away and there was no one to look after the children while she went to work. With the inheritance that she received, Carmen bought a wooden kiosk and a sewing machine and rented a place in a market. She now works sewing, doing clothes repairs at her clients' requests and she also does dyeing. Since working with FINCA, Carmen has received much guidance on improving her business through chats with the Company Management. Carmen needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sewing materials. Carmen's dream is to have stable work because she doesn't always have sewing jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Mohamed I., age 37, is single with one daughter of 17 years. He has had a business selling new bags (shopping and traveling bags) since 2005 and works daily from 10am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $60.

This will be Mohamed’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase stock of his bags.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group, Ngorongoro, which totals 19 members. The members of the group hold each other responsible in paying back the loan. In the picture, Mohamed is the one in front.

loans.use: To buy more bags of different designs

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La señora Genara es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la av panamericana en el distrito de Zepita, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (3er grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de verduras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar verduras, frutas, abarrotes y también insumos para elaboración de pan.

Su mayor deseo es comprar un terreno en Juliaca y Tacna para darles a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras, frutas, abarrotes y también insumos para elaboración de pan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Sod

texts.en:
Sod L., 30, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector, raising pigs, earning an income of US$ 3 per day. The family is assisted mainly by her husband who is a construction builder in the city, earning collectively an income of US$ 7 per day as a primary source of income for the family to help cover the household expenses.

Mrs. L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more pigs and piglets to raise to expand her agricultural business. She hopes that she will be able to generate more income with her proper business plan enabled by her expected loan.

loans.use: buy more pigs and piglets to raise

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
31-year-old Ramona E. is requesting a loan through ASHI to buy cattle to raise and breed. Through this business, she can maximize the wide, verdant land in her backyard and profit from it. She also wants to support her previous and ongoing business, which is manufacturing “nipa” (a leaf of a palm) as a native roofing material through her loan. Proceeds of this business supply Ramona and her family with their daily basic needs. Her husband is a just a laborer and his income is too small for Ramona and her three children to depend on.

With the all of her problems at home brought about by poverty, Ramona’s membership in ASHI had helped her in so many ways aside from having access to loans. The camaraderie she had found from among her co-members in ASHI has diverted her disappointments to happiness. She found herself laughing at problems and later on realized laughter was a very good solution for them. Despite the many adversities she has encountered, Ramona has remained strong and determined to achieve her dreams for her three children, who are aged from eight to 12 years old.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to raise and to finance her nipa manufacturing business

loans.name: Rashidat Tolulope

texts.en:
Tolulope is a single, 25-year-old woman. She notes that she is a focused and hard worker.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a hair-dressing business, which offers hair-styling and cosmetics services. Notably, her business is conveniently located near most of her clients. She has been in this business for four years, and she joined LAPO two years ago. She puts in long hours to ensure her business's success. She explains that one of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers on a daily basis. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN ($675) to purchase more hair-dressing accessories (e.g., hair extensions) to re-sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional hair accessories for resale purposes

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle M. is from the village of Tuburan, Pagadian, ZDS. She is 24 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional animals. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock for breeding. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Michelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, a sus 58 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo, una de sus hijas que es madre soltera y su adorado nieto.
María es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos nutricionales. También vende cosméticos de reconocidas marcas, y con ambos productos está muy satisfecha, aunque termine muy cansada el final del día.
El problema de María es que necesita ser operada de las válvulas cardíacas, y para ello necesita tener donantes de sangre, pero lamentablemente ni su esposo, ni sus hijos tienen el mismo tipo, por lo que uno de sus objetivos diarios es conseguir personas que deseen donarle sangre para que pueda ser operada con prontitud.
Ella está muy segura de afrontar satisfactoriamente su operación, y ya encontró dos donantes, pero además debe trabajar para afrontar los gastos de la cirugía.

Este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y aunque ella es la titular del crédito, su pareja también se compromete con el grupo en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de más productos de los que vende, además de solventar algunos gastos médicos concernientes a su estado de salud.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, lives with her husband and has 5 children. One of their daughters, who is a single mom, lives with them along with their grandson. Maria is very dedicated to her work. For four years she has sold nutritional products, as well as cosmetics from well known brands. Maria is very satisfied with both products, even though she is quite tired at the end of each day. The problem is that she requires a valve operation on her heart, and for this she will need blood donors. Unfortunately, neither her husband, nor her children have the right blood type, so one of her daily objectives is to find people willing to donate blood so that she can have this operation as soon as possible. Maria feels confident she will get through the operation, and she has since found two donors, but she still needs to work to be able to deal with the costs of this surgery. This is the 10th loan with MFP, and even though it is her name on the loan, her husband also participates with the group to make the payments on time. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more products that Maria can sell, as well as cover some of the medical costs she will incur.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more nutritional products and cosmetics to sell, as well as cover some of the medical costs she is incurring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Grace Women Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Grace Women. She is 40 years old, single, and has three children who range in age from 4 to 22 years old.

For fifteen years, Kebbeh has been selling oil, rice, and peppers at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She is very friendly to her customers, which keeps them returning.

Kebbeh plans to use her 7000 LRD portion of this 33,000 LRD group loan to buy more oil, rice, and peppers. Her goal is to grow her business and to have all of her children attend school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign. Weedor J.'s photo is inset at the upper right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and LEAP puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more oil, rice, and peppers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman who sells colorful sarongs to make a living in Nigeria. She is a very busy woman and she is happy because she makes sales daily from her sarong business.

Elizabeth hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Elizabeth lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and is married with four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their home.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy V., is 29 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Toun (they are pictured together), is 27 years old. They live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2004 and have 3 sons. One of them is in school and other two stay at home. 

Chanthy and his wife have been selling vegetables and fruit for four years. They buy the produce under contract from their village and transport it by cart to sell in Derm Kor market located in Phnom Penh City. But, their cart is old and breaks down, so Chanthy is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a new cart to carry vegetables and fruit for sale. He also will use a part of the loan to buy fruit under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a new cart and buy fruit under contract for resale

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa L.
texts.en: Ana Rosa L.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make pupusas and tortillas.

loans.name: Abla Rosaline

texts.fr: Cette  dame s’est lancée depuis 1998 dans le commerce de charbons de bois,  elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays ainsi  elle réalise de plus grands profits sur ses ventes. Elle voudrait rehausser son stock en baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 9 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady launched a charcoal business in 1998. She gets her supplies inland, so that she makes higher profits on her sales. She would like to increase her declining stock and is thus requesting a loan from WAGES to buy nine sacks of charcoal. She is married and mother to three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Adelina Vapor's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina V., 55 years of age, married, is a resident of Pulot, Ozamiz City. Adelina is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Adelina V.’s Group'. 
	
Adelina is married to Alejandro V., her business partner. They are blessed with 4 children;and now they are all in adult-aged. The couple decided to engage in business by operating a charcoal retail.  For 20 years already, the couple has been able to manage these businesses and now they are earning an average net income of not less than P 6,000 a month, which is very helpful as their family income.

Mrs. V. joined the cooperative in the year 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting the amount of P 7,000 as her 2nd loan for the purpose of purchasing additional charcoal to sell. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, as savings for future use, and for children’s education. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nene

texts.fr: Madame Nene D. est une femme mariée de 46 ans, mère de 7 enfants  et qui évolue dans le commerce de produits locaux, biscuits et bonbons. Elle a une expérience de 7 mois dans son activité. Elle est membre de la caisse  de Ouakam  depuis 4 ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce dans le but d’éviter le chômage mais aussi dans le but d’assister sa famille et de subvenir a certains besoins de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de produits en provenance du Mali en vue d’accroitre son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nene D., age 46, is the mother of seven children. For seven months, she's been selling local products, such as biscuits and candies. She's been a member of the Ouakam savings institution for four years and already benefited from one previous loan. She chose her business in order to escape unemployment, but also to assist her family and provide for some of her children's needs. She's seeking a new loan of XOF 300'000 in order to buy products coming from Mali, so as to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital and purchase products

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet Vior, age 28, and her husband, Mr. Sinoeun Kloeng, age 23, have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Savet has been selling fish in her village since 2008. Her husband has been a construction worker since 2002. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use $200 of the loan to build a new staircase and $300 to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To build a new staircase and put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia C. is from the village of Lurugan in Valencia City in the province of Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Amelia is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Amelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Amelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 42 años de edad y La socia es casada y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia tiene 5 hijos todos ellos estudiantes y tres casados, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un pequeño stand de venta de ponches y chicha de quinua, maíz morado, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio ella quiere comprar vasos, jarras y baldes para mejorar su presentación ambulatoria.
 
 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO." She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco. Juana is 42 years old, married, and lives in the Urcos district. She has 5 children, all of whom are students and 3 of whom are married. She works in retail trade. She has a small stand where she sells punch and chichas (beverages) made of quinoa and purple corn. She requests a loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy drinking glasses, pitchers, and buckets to improve the appearance of her business. Juana values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted, because it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life, and she also promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinking glasses, pitchers and buckets to improve the appearance of her business

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab I. is a 40-year-old woman who breeds cattle and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. Zeynab is married and has four children. She has 15 years of experience in breeding cattle. She buys small calves, raises and fattens them and then sells them for a profit. Her monthly income is 150-200 AZN. She would like to increase the number of cattle she has and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old. Evangeline is single and has one infant child. Evangeline makes and sells specialty food products like chicken and pork barbecue in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao L., 38, is a professional tailor, making US$ 3 each day in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US$ 1 every day, growing rice. Mao L. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a hand tractor for her husband to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor

loans.name: Margaret Sofia

texts.en:
Margaret is a tailor and has been making clothes for her clients in Naivasha town for the last two years now.  She is 45 years old and married to Samson Mokua. They have three children.

KADET has financed her growth from a small-scale tailor dealing with repairing clothes only to a big-time tailor in town. She now gets orders from organizations and individuals to make clothes for them. She is on her third loan and she plans to buy more clothing material to use in making more clothes.

She now hopes to grow the clothes business and open a boutique from where she will be selling most of her clothes. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To add more clothing fabric to her shop

loans.name: Bayardo Arsenio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Arsenio B. B., tiene la edad de 61 años vive en Lomas de Guadalupe, es casado y con su esposa tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad, casados y habitan en sus hogares particulares, solo el menor  de 19 años habita con sus padres, apoyando a las tareas del hogar y los trabajos de su familia, ellos se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de pan y cereales, que durante 6 años ha sido el sustento diario de la familia, permitiéndoles recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades de la familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de zinc, bloques, cemento, hierro para mejorar el local donde tuestan los granos, esta inversión les aportará  mejores comodidades un amplio espacio de trabajo y con esto la posibilidad de incrementar la producción del material, puesto que han observado un aumento en la demanda, que a corto plazo les favorecerá con mejores condiciones económicas o recursos para incursionar en nuevos mercados, permitiéndoles solventar los estudios universitarios a su hijo menor y apoyarle en su desarrollo económico social de su vida.
texts.en: Mr. Bayardo Arsenio B. B. is 61 years old and lives in Lomas de Guadalupe. He is married and he and his wife have 8 grown children who are also married and live in their own homes. Only the youngest, who is 19 years old, lives with his family, helping with household chores and the family business. They work making and marketing bread and cereals. During the past 6 years, these have been the day-to-day means of support for the family, providing them with economic resources to meet the needs of the family. It is for this business that he is requesting a loan to buy zinc, bricks, cement, and iron to improve the location where they toast the grains. This investment will contribute to increasing their comforts with a large work space and with this, the possibility of increasing the material production, a place where they have observed a growing demand. Which, in a short time, will favor them with better economic conditions or resources to invest in new markets, permitting them to pay for university for their youngest son and help them in their socio-economic development.

loans.use: Remodeling of business location

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 32 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yeredon sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et résidant toutes dans le quartier N’gola  de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes la restauration excepté Chata Koné, la présidente du groupe qui excelle dans la vente de pâtes d’arachides.  Elles achète les grains d’arachides et la transforme en pâtes.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les  prêts précédents. 
Chata Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150kg  de grains d’arachides auprès des grossistes au marché de Fakola. Chata effectue sa vente  à domicile et au marché de Fakola, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Chata,  à l’instar des autres membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments.
texts.en:
The five women of the Yeredon group are all married into polygamous families, are on average 28 years old with four children, and all reside in the N’gola borough of Fakola, one of the sub-prefectures of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as neighbours and all deal with food preparation excepting Chata Kone the group’s president, who excels in retailing peanut paste. She buys peanuts and processes them to make peanut paste.

Wanting to bolster their stock supply and diversify the items for sale, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where they are beginning their third group loan, having fully reimbursed the preceding ones.

Chata Kone intends to use her loan to buy 150 kilos of peanuts from wholesalers at the Fakola market. Chata sells door-to-door and at the Fakola market, to mostly women customers who pay cash and sometimes on credit.

Like other group members Chata hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA which will serve to reimburse the loan and take care of the family’s food condiments needs.

loans.use: Buy peanuts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil soltera y con tres hijos, tiene grado de instrucción  primaria completa.
Gloria viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,  le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno (toro).
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital  de su negocio.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro que genera ganancia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “22 de Setiembre” (22nd of September) community bank which is located  in Ilave district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 27 years old, single and has three children.  She completed her primary education.

Gloria has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increaes the working capital of her business fattening cattle (bulls).

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to help her business grow.  What she most likes about her community bank is the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mr. Ny C. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Hou Lonh, live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The couple has been married since 1972. 

Ny is a fisherman and wooden-house repairman. His wife sells vegetables in the local market. Part of his house is broken. He wants to fix it but he does not have money.

Therefore, Ny is asking for a loan of $1,200 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en: Tsedenbal J. is 31 years old and lives with his mother in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his mother live together in their ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent.  He supports his mother and himself by operating a taxi service in his town. In addition, he purchases cars and sells them for a profit to supplement his earnings. He needs more funds to repair a car that will be sold for profit.   He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to make the necessary repairs and replace parts for his car trading business.

loans.use: To make repairs and replace parts

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells maize at Abura.  Aba has received a senior high education.  She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif A. is a cattle breeder since 2005. He was born in 1955 in the Saatli region. Vaqif is married and is responder for four people consisting of his wife, two daughters and a son. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He has requested this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three more cows. Vaqif sells dairy in the Saatli bazaar and income helped improve the livelihood of his family. This is the only source of income for family. His elder son actively helps him in it. Vaqif plans to improve his dairy farming in the future by buying more dairy cows that will increase his income. Vaqif is very thankful to Aqroinvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida, es una valiente mujer de 35 años; que en compañía de su esposo Manuel cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Kareli y Arnold. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano Manuel, su esposo; sale a trabajar con su auto en el trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas Tarma-Palca. Mientras que Nerida la apoya en la agricultura, en donde sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, papa, y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, “me siento realizada”, afirma. Pero está pareja de esposos, conjuntamente viajan a la capital del país donde comercializan su producción después de cada cosecha. En adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos, en principal sus sembríos gladiolo; pues según menciona, esta flor tiene mayor demanda durante todo el año. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia solidaria y muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su asociación. Nerida dentro de muy pronto cosechará arvejas, por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico; asimismo desea comprar una bolsa de semillas de gladiolos que le hace falta para sembrar luego de su pronta cosecha.
texts.en: Nerida is a brave 35 year old woman who alongside her husband Manuel have 2 children, Kareli and Arnold.  They live harmoniously in their own home located in the Patay neighborhood.  Every morning Manuel leaves very early for work using his own auto as public transit and covering the Tarma-Palca routes.  Meanwhile, Nerida does her part in agricultre where her main crops consist of: peas, potatoes, and the gladiolus flower.  What she likes most is being able to help her husband with the household expenses, " I feel accomplished", she states.  The couple travels to the capital after every harvest to sell their crops.  In the future she would like to improve her crops, starting with her gladiolus seeds; according to her the flower has great demand all year round.  She is part of the comunal bank, "Los Pioneros de Patay" ( The Patay Pioneers), and this is her 5th credit with MFP.  Nerida is loyal and comitted to the development of her group.  She will soon be harvesting peas, and with the solicited loan she will purchase various sacks of organic fertilizer alongside a sack of galdiolus seed that she is yet to plant until after harvest.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and a sack of gladiolus seed.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda K. is a 35-year-old, single lady who runs a food kiosk in Kagombani area in Malindi in order to take care of her five children. Her kiosk has been operational for the past five years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD for 20,000 KES, which she plans to use to purchase stocks of assorted fruits and vegetables for sale. She paid her previous loans well and in time. 
 

Chenda hopes that this move will help grow her business and in return, get much more income than she is getting right now so that she can continue sustaining her business, while at the same time taking care of her children, by ensuring that they get educated and are fed properly.  

She hopes to use her anticipated profit to reinvest back into the business, and in the future to venture into livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Progrès Plus Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of a community bank named Progrès Plus, which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Rose, 35, is married. She is a beautician and runs a sewing workshop. She has been in business for many years. She has been operating her business in the western part of Kinshasa. With hard work and good management, and thanks to Hope’s loans, her business has prospered. She makes a profit of about $45 per week. 

Rose’s ambition is to open a hair salon. As she wants to develop her business, she then decided to join one of Hope’s groups in 2009. She is planning to purchase fabrics and cosmetics for her workshop with the next loan. Rose has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. She always charges her customers fair prices, she knows them well by their names, and she never runs out of stock. 

Rose has five children whose ages are between 3 and 11years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics and cosmetics for her workshop in order to increase the working capital

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
The group is located at Pangkung Lip Lip Sub-State. The head of the group, Ni Nengah S., is 33 years old. All 10 members of the group are getting their second loans for a total of Rp. 15,000,000.

The loan is expected to increase her business capital so she can buy two pigs. With the first loan, she has managed to obtain an average profit of Rp. 200,000 to Rp. 250,000.  Her profits were used to supplement her daily needs and to increase school fees. On the date when the loan was disbursed, a member named Ni Ketut S. did not attend because of illness. They hope that in the future this cooperation continues to be ongoing. If possible, they would like to have the loan amount increased and the period extended.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old, married and a father of four.  He does welding so as to earn a living.  He has done the business for two years.  He was previously working as a plumber to earn a living. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Samuel has managed to access business loans which he used to boost his business.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy metal bars, plates and rods.

loans.use: To buy metal bars, plates and rods.

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Alieu B..  He is married and has 3 children ages 8, 10 and 12 years old.  In 2004, Alieu B. established his general store business.  He began his business because it is a self employment activity.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 450,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Alieu B. requires a loan in order to buy more business stock.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.  In the future, Alieu B. plans to educate his children and open another shop.  He is very serious and dedicated.  He wants to be a supplier.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy assorted items by the carton such as plastic bags,soap,sugar,sardine etc

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 64 años de edad, vive sola en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural de San Pedro de Sasape a 15 minutos de Illimo y a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeques.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y tiene festividades  religiosas muy bonitas.
Francisca es comerciante desde hace muchos años de aves de corral (gallinas,pavos y patos) y de cerdos, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su casa. Otra actividad que realiza para que obtenga más ingresos es la elaboración de chicha de jora
Ha solicitado Francisca un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y sus respectivos alimentos, con la finalidad de engordarlas para luego venderlos y tener un mejor precio y así mejoraría su calidad de vida.
Francisca es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old and lives alone in her own house which receives services, such as water and electricity. Her home is in the rural section of San Pedro de Sasape, which is 15 minutes away from Illimo and approximately 40 minutes away from the Department of Lambayeque. This area is dedicated to agriculture and livestock breeding, and also has beautiful religious festivals.

Francisca is a merchant who has been selling poultry (chickens, turkeys, and ducks) and pigs for several years. The pens where the animals are kept are located in area outside of her home and she feeds them a balanced diet. When the animals have grown to the optimal size, she offers them for sale to different markets in the area. As a result, she is able to generate a good income in order to cover her household expenses. To earn additional income, Francisca also produces “chicha de jora” (a beverage made from corn).

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1300 PEN so that she can buy more animals and the appropriate feed. Francisca plans to fatten the animals so that she can sell them later for a good price. This will help improve her quality of life.

Francisca is a responsible and hardworking woman who is concerned about making improvements to her business so that her needs can continue to be met.

loans.use: to purchase animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and six young children who are still attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 25 years. In 1990, he started to work on a freelance basis, sticking with multiple construction projects. He is talented at completing wall foliage work. There are two part-time employees helping him from time to time to get the work done. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing scaffolding and new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to increase his productivity. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new tools

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida , es originaria del departamento de León , tiene 49 años de edad , es viuda, tiene 4 hijos todos son mayores, ella es dueña de una pulpería , es comerciante . Inicio en esta actividad por herencia, ya que la dueña de la venta era su abuelita  después paso a manos de su madre y ahora la tiene ella. Antes de  hacerse cargo de la venta doña Cándida  era asistente de odontología, ella tenía 19 años, trabajaba en mecánica dental haciendo calzas de dientes. Pero pasado el tiempo se hizo cargo por completo de la pulpería  así ha venido abriéndose camino en el comercio  sin dejar atrás el trabajo de mecánica dental  combinando estos dos trabajos, les dio una carrera universitaria a casi todos sus hijos pues le faltan dos de sus hijos para que finalicen su carrera. La pulpería la tiene en su casa de habitación su hija menor es la que le ayuda a atender la venta. 
Solicito el crédito para surtir la venta  y comprar material dental. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos. Tiene como meta próxima comprar dos exhibidores nuevos para colocar productos, también vitrinas nuevas ya que las que tiene están muy viejas y en mal estado, desea convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Cándida is from the department of León.  She's forty-nine, a widow, and has four grown children.  She is a storekeeper and owns a general store.  She inherited the store; her grandmother owned it, then it passed to her mother, and now it's hers.  Before taking over the store Cándida was a dental assistant.  At nineteen she was working in a dental practice doing fillings.  After a while she took over the store completely and that's how she got to be a storekeeper, but she hasn't left the dental office, so she's got the two jobs.  She provided college educations to nearly all of her children; two of them are still finishing school.  She has the store in her house and her youngest daughter helps her operate it.

Cándida is seeking a loan to stock up the store and to buy dental supplies.  She hopes the investment will help her improve sales and grow her income.  Her next goal is to buy two new display cases to put her products in, as well as new windows since the ones she has are old and in bad shape. She would like to make her store a distribution center.

loans.use: to stock up her store, and buy dental supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Roger

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene como actividad la venta de materiales y libros de medicina, esta venta la realiza en la feria de la 16 d julio una feria muy concurrida en la ciudad de el alto, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia ya que el vive con su padres y solo mantiene a su familia. El destino del crédito es para el aumento de capital para su trabajo con la compra de mercadería en lotes de libros, logrando de  esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y poder consolidarse en su actividad, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, responsable y dinámico, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Nelson sells medical materials and books at the "16 de Julio" fair which attracts many people in the upper part of the city.  This is the main source of income for him and his family since he lives with his parents and he is the only bread-winner.  He will use the loan to increase his working capital to buy books in bulk, in order to improve his income and stabilize his business.  He is a person who is very dedicated to his work, responsible, dynamic, and grateful to the institution for the support he receives.

loans.use: To buy medical books.

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La señora Irene  es casada y vive en la localidad de la Ribera la granadilla, Municipio de Coapilla Estado de chipas México.

    Ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva dos años y tres meses y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello está apoyando para tener ingresos en su hogar aunque no tiene una familia grande quiere lo mejor para ellos.

    Con esta actividad inicio por su propia creatividad y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y juntos comenzar a horrar para que cuando tengas sus hijos  no les haga falta lo mas impórtate y justo salgan adelante.

    Su más grande deseo es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda seguir trabajando y darle lo mejor a su premier hijo que esta por nacer en unos meses.

      Las personas que integran el en grupo son: la señora Timonea en la compra y venta de pollos para venderlo aliñado, así también está la señora Trinidad en la compra  de palmas para elaborar petates.
texts.en:
Señora Irene is married and lives in the area of Ribera la Granadilla, in the Municipality of Coapilla in Chiapas State, Mexico.

She works baking bread, which she has been doing for two years and three months.  She says it's going well, as with this she is able to support her household by providing income.  While she does not have a large family, she wants the best for them.

She started in this activity with her own creativity and so supports her husband with household income.  Together they are saving for when they have children.  She doesn't want them to lack anything important, and just wants them to be able to get ahead in life.

Her greatest wish is that she can continue working with this small business and provide the best for her first child who is due in a few months.

The people who make up the rest of the group are: Señora Timonea who buys chickens to season and sell, and Señora Trinidad who buys palm fronds to make mats.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; la socia tiene 50 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y artefactos, la socia viaja a la ciudad de Tacna a comprar mercadería como casacas, buzos, ropa para damas y caballeros, también trae artefactos y los vende a pedido de forma ambulatoria, la socia tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años; La socia también se dedica a la artesanía ella elabora ajedrez, lámparas, muñecos músicos hechos en  arcilla, la socia  solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería como ropa al por mayor y artefactos  como televisores, equipos de sonidos, y comprar materiales para la elaboración de cerámica. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arcilla, pigmentos para pintar con pinceles los diversos dibujos paisajísticos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the communal bank “CHOQUEQUIRAO."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Luisa, 50, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She has a business buying and selling clothing and appliances.  She travels to the city of Tacna to buy merchandise such as jackets, sweatshirts and other clothing for men and women. She also purchases appliances and sells them door-to-door based on advance orders.  She has had this business for 15 years.  Luisa also sells handicrafts that she makes such as chessboards, lamps and musical dolls made of clay.  She requests a loan so that she can buy clothing at wholesale, appliances such as tv's and stereos, and materials to make her ceramics.  She requests a loan to buy materials such as clay and pigments that she will use to paint various landscape designs with a brush.

Luisa is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided through these means, and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as clay and paint

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Anik engages in farming. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is barely enough to make ends meet. 

Anik would like to increase her livestock and develop the family's agriculture. Development of agriculture will help Anik to sell more dairy and increase her income. Additional income will provide financial means for Anik to renovate the house and improve the condition of her household. 

Anik lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two little grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a 24-year-old single lady. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines and owns a habal-habal (a two-wheeled motorcycle capable of carrying 2-4 passengers) to make additional income for the family. While not the only means of income, the family earns 10,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Maricris had requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. The loaned amount will be used to purchase spare motor parts to keep it in good running condition. Growing or expanding the service-based livelihood is all she had longed for to give sufficient inflows for the family. Maricris wants to explore business projects to improve and test her capability of running more later.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Tired of ill-fitting, unattractive shoes, Erica D. took matters into her own hands … make that fit. After several years of research on shoe design, Erica launched Phat Pheet to offer stylish, trendy footwear options to fit a wider range of feet.  “All women want to look good,” says Erica, whose “Saints Slippers” are currently the hottest selling item through her website (www.PhatPheet.com).  

Since her business’s launch eight months ago, Phat Pheet has been booking special events and shoe shows left and right and the products have picked up a loyal following in Atlanta and parts of Texas. Phat Pheet emphasizes community involvement, and the company has taken part in philanthropic events such as New Orleans’s Breast Cancer Walk and the New Orleans Aids Walk.  

Erica considers herself lucky to have evacuated before Katrina. Unfortunately, her home was not so lucky: she became a homeowner just one year prior to the storm and her home in the Lower Ninth Ward did not survive the flood waters.  “I was born and raised in New Orleans,” says Erica.  “I love the culture and diversity of this city; I felt obligated to rebuild.” Erica’s dream is to one day launch an entire Phat Pheet line of shoes for store brands to carry and her upbeat attitude carries over to her company’s marketing slogan:  “At Phat Pheet, we have some big shoes to fill!”  

Erica will use her Kiva loan to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to purchase new shoe inventory.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita integra el Banco comunal “Amaican” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la realización de costuras en prendas para el hogar, entre los cuales se encuentran la realización de manteles y cortinas. Realiza cierta cantidad de prendas, posteriormente los guarda en bolsas individuales y recorre el sector donde vive, para luego ofrecerlos y venderlos. A sus clientes más antiguos les brinda facilidades de pago. 
Su taller lo tiene en su propia casa, donde trabaja desde hace 13 años.
