Leonor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para elaborar chicha (maíz y leña) y también con la compra de más cerveza, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Leonor es una mujer responsable y muy estimada por sus vecinos y clientes. Su mayor anhelo es tener su casa donde ella y su futura familia puedan vivir tranquilos y felices.
texts.en:
Leonor is 30 years old and lives with her husband in the home of her in-laws, located in the La Unión district of Piura province, in the Piura region, 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has a business selling chicha (a drink that is typical of the region) and beer from the home where she currently resides. She prepares the chicha herself and offers it to her customers. This business provides helpful income in addition to that earned by her husband, since they are both saving money to build their own house. Chicha is a drink that is often consumed in Peru, it is made with a specific kind of corn, and is widely consumed by the people who live in the rural areas, since they believe that it gives them energy to continue with their work. Leonor wishes to expand her business with the purchase of supplies to make chicha (corn and firewood), and also with the purchase of more beer. For this reason she requests a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Leonor is a very responsible woman who is held in high regard by her neighbors and customers. Her main desire is to have her own house where she and her future family can live tranquilly and happily.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make chicha and to buy beer to expand her business

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Ашурматов Шухрат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шухрат, имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Шухрат хочет получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Shuhrat A. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 31 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Shuhrat has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers. Shuhrat wants to get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a 43 year old married father of four, who are in school. He is a hardworking man who runs a furniture shop. He has been in this business for seven years and has two employees. Previously he sold mobile phone accessories and clothes before he ventured into this business.

He has been a member of Faulu Kenya and he plans to take out his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials for making furniture.

Jonah, a talented musician, hopes to produce his own gospel music in the future. He is also determined to educate his children to higher education levels.

loans.use: To buy materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Reside en el barrio de Pampahuasi, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su negocio inició cuando detectó una oportunidad en su comunidad, ya que existían pocos agricultores que se dedicaran especialmente a la producción de cacao y ahora está logrando buenos resultados económicos. Para ella el factor clave es darle un valor agregado a sus productos, por el cual ofrece su producto a menor precio con respecto a la competencia. 

Generalmente se despierta antes de que el gallo cante, con eso demuestra que le gusta adelantarse ante los hechos; por lo general le gusta tomar acciones preventivas para no tener problemas en su terreno de cultivo, ya que es su fuente principal de trabajo. 
Su familia lo apoya en el sembrío y cosecha y vende su producto en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Para el futuro quiere adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para producir en grandes cantidades y poder cumplir con todos sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y de todas formas promete seguir pagando las cuotas pactadas, además confía en que llegará muy lejos con el apoyo de grupo comunal. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de que su producto sea de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 35 years old, married and has three children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the Pampahuasi neighborhood in the jungle of the Ayacucho region. She started her business when she saw an opportunity in her community, there were only a few farmers dedicated to growing cocoa, and it has paid off financially. She believes that the key factor is to provide an added value to her products, so she sells her products at a lower price than the competition. She usually wakes up before the rooster sings so that she can be ready for anything. She believes in taking preventive action to avoid any problems with her land since it is her main source of income. Her family helps her with the sowing and harvesting of the products. They then sell them at their community’s collection centers. In the future, she wants to buy more land to have larger production and meet the demand from her clients. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments agreed upon. She is confident that she will accomplish a lot with the support of the communal group. She will use this loan to provide the necessary maintenance for her cocoa plantations, aiming to produce a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cocoa plantation maintenance

loans.name: Marriane

texts.en:
Marriane M. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Marriane works in someone else's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises ducks for extra income. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years.

In 2010, Marriane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment and also feeds for her ducks. This loan will be her first loan from CEVI.

Marriane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 


About CEVI: 
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.

CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment as well as feed for her ducks

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: doña Silvia C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene un a pulperia en su casa de habitacion, vive en la aldea San Bernardo,  doña Silvia es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela de su  comunidad, es madre soltera. todos los dias se levantas a las 4 de la mañana para abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener su negocio bien surtido. las ganancias que le genere su negocio las necesita para salir adelante con sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Silvia C. sells general consumption products – she has a general store in her house. She lives in the town of San Bernardo. Miss Silvia is a single mother of 3 children who are in the community school. Every day she gets up at 4 in the morning to open her business and attend to her customers. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and therefore have a better supplied store. She needs earning she makes in her business to help her children get ahead and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beans, butter, rice, tortillas, coffee, margarine, oil, rice, sugar, bread, cookies, soda, matches, candles

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Fifty years old and married. Ann has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 18 years. She also farms to supplement her income. Ann is an active member of Loyal group in Faulu Kenya, attending the group meetings consistently and paying her weekly dues faithfully.

So far, she has been able to service one loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost her business. She is now requesting a new loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. Ann hopes that this loan will help her business to grow, as she is determined to open more outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona G. is from the village of Sugarlan Valencia City. She is 32 years old. Chona is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used clothing, or ukay ukay, in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Chona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yanet; ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es natural de pampa marca, ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  vive en el distrito de Urcos desde hace 3 años,  la socia se dedica al prestar servicio de alimentación, ella tienen un pequeño restaurante en tupac amaru, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y con todo el ingreso de este negocio ella puede sacar adelante a su familia y está comprando un terreno para construir. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar animales y criarlos, también invertirá en mejorar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. Her name is Yanet, and she is 27 years old. She is originally from Pampamarca, and she has a live-in partner and 1 child. She has lived in the Urcos district for 3 years. Her work is providing food services. She has a small restaurant in Tupac Amaru. She is a very hard-working woman, and she has used all of her income from this business to help her family get ahead. She is currently buying a plot of land to build a house. She is requesting the loan to buy animals to raise, and she will also invest in improving her business. Yanet infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her small restaurant and buying animals to raise

loans.name: Yakuthon's Group

texts.en:
Yakuthon A. is the leader of the group.  She is 47 and married.  She has raised two sons and a daughter.  The daughter is married and lives separately with her family; the first son works as a butcher and the second son studies at school. In order to make money Yakuthon works as a cook in a kindergarten, and her husband went to work to Russia. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Yakuthon started to breed livestock and with money received from the loan she wants to purchase four sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to save money to contribute to her son’s wedding expenses.

Galina T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 51 and married. She has two daughters and a son. The daughter works as a cook in a kindergarten, the first son went to work to Russia and the second studies at school. Galina and her husband work in the same kindergarten.  Now she is planning to purchase a pavilion and with money received from the loan she wants to purchase convenience goods in order to resell them in that pavilion. 

Ludmila J., 47, is a widow. She has raised three sons, the first son works as a baker, the second went to work to Russia, and the third son is an auxiliary master. Ludmila applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials to start building their new house. 

Nodirahon H., 26, is married. She has a son who is just two years old.  Seven years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Nodirahon and her husband opened their own bakery. They make 18,000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan Nodirahon wants to purchase 20 bags of flour. In the future she plans to expand her business, purchase some land, and build a house for her older brother.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four sheep

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie I. is from the village of Brgy. Aggub, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Tessie is married and has five adult children. Tessie owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Tessie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou L.  est un jeune électricien  de 37 ans qui vit dans la localité de baye laye. Il est marié et gère une famille. Monsieur L. a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans  le métier d’électricien qu’il exerce. Il fait aussides branchements de canal  dans son quartier et en même  temps  s’adonne au commerce d’huile de palme. 
 Il a choisi l’activité d’électricien  sous la recommandation de ses parents qui  pensaient que c’est  un métier d’avenir. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis  septembre 2005. Il emprunte 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de diverses marchandises (prêts à porter) qu’il va aller revendre au Fouta  durant les périodes de fêtes. Les bénéfices  récoltés de ses opérations  de commerce lui permettent  d’être  autonome et  de répondre à l’attente de ses clients pour qui il pourra préfinancer les chantiers qui lui sont confiés.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou L., 37, is a young electrician who lives in Baye Laye. He is married and responsible for a family. He has 10 years' experience in his trade as an electrician. He also does television hook-ups in his neighborhood and at the same time, he sells palm oil. He chose to be an electrician on the recommendation of his parents who thought that it is an up and coming trade. He has belonged to the Baye Laye branch since September 2005. He is borrowing 500,000 francs to buy various ready-to-wear merchandise that he is going to sell in Fouta during the holiday period. The profit from this business will allow him to be independent and responsive to the needs of his customers for whom he will be able to finance projects in advance.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 35 years old, is married to M. A., and lives in a small city in Pakistan called Chichawatni. She owns a house with four rooms and lives in it with her husband and three children: two boys and a girl. Only her eldest son is able to attend school and he is in 2nd standard. Khalida is a housewife, staying at home to manage her household chores and take care of her family.

Khalida’s husband has a bicycle-repair shop in the market. He repairs bicycles and sells spare parts from the shop as well. His earnings from the business allow him to manage the financial circle of his household and to fulfill the needs of his family. But, as the children are growing, so ultimately their needs will increase and to timely fulfill them he needs to grow his business. This can happen only when he gives better services to his customers and completes their demands on time.

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband in this regard. With the loan, he will buy more bicycle spare parts and the latest tools for repairing bicycles. Khalida is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow by making this investment in it.

Khalida is a new loan applicant and this is the first time she has applied for a loan from any micro-financial institution. She hopes that it will be a good experience for her and she expects to work with Asasah on a longterm basis.

In the photo, Khalida is the lady who holds a book (called her Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy the latest repair tools and more bicycle spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John G. N. M. is a young, married man. His wife is a business lady and they have one child, aged 13 years, whom they hope to give a quality education to the university level. 

His business is located on Moi Avenue in the Central Business District of Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many, many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling mobile phones and phone accessories, including batteries, chargers, etc. He has been in this business for two years now and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenge he has is lack of enough capital. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more mobile-phone accessories to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that his business will grow and enable him to import mobile phones in bulk from China. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy and committed to his business.

loans.use: Mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en: Erdenesuren C. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family have lived together in their own apartment for the past 11 years. Both her two sons attend local high school. Her husband works as a welder and electrician in the mine in the summer months and as a plumber during the winter months. Erdenesuren sells a variety of consumer goods in a pavilion at the outdoor space at a market. She started her business in 2005 by operating a cafe with help of her husband in Uyanga sub province. In 2007, she began selling a variety of socks outside of the local market after moving her current town. She could not create a stable operation and stopped her business for a while when her husband worked in the mine. She restarted her retail trading business in September 2008 and her current working capital has reached 1,500,000 MNT today. Erdenesuren is a hardworking and optimistic woman.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her product line in order to raise her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more consumer products

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta A. is currently in the business of making tea and baking bread such as tamia (patties shaped from chickpeas, onion, bread, garlic and flour), legemat (fried bread balls) etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and bags of sugar for her business.
Aneta is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a small.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour and bags of sugar

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Digna es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para incrementar su negocio. Tiene 59 años, está casada y fruto de  relación tuvo cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía.
 
Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos e invertir mas en los que estén de oferta ya que estos  le dejan mayores ganancias. Su sueño es gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos para seguir en su trabajo ya que le gusta lo que hace.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Digna is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the help which she receives to increase her business.  Digna is 59 years old.  She is married and has four grown-up children.  Her youngest child still lives with her.  Her husband works for a company.

Digna is a housewife but in order to help with the household expenses she also sells Avon products (perfumes, beauty products and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 8.00am to 4.00pm and makes her sales door to door.  She tells us that she takes advantage of offers when products are cheap and when the offers are over she sells the products at their regular price which makes her extra money.

This loan will be used to buy products and invest more in those that are on offer since they make her the most profit.  Her dream is for herself and her family to enjoy good health and for her to continue in her work because she likes what she does.

loans.use: To buy perfume, beauty products and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha S. J. is a 28-year-old woman who runs a hair salon and cosmetics shop in Mwandoni. She is married to Mohamed Abdul, who works at a clearing and forwarding company. They are blessed with one child. She has been in the salon business for the last two years. 

She has now applied for her second loan from KADET after successfully repaying the previous loan. She will purchase a new hair drier and add stock of beauty products in anticipation of a business boom in the coming festive season. She plans to use the anticipated profits to increase her business stock.

Her dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: To purchase a new hair drier and stock beauty products

loans.name: Tomasa De Jesús

texts.es: Tomasa de Jesús A. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante, y así mismo vive junto a dos hijos los cuales estudian. Desde hace 8 años que Tomasa posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas, así mismo comercializa verduras. Este negocio nació con el deseo de poder mejorar la economía familiar, ya que en muchas ocasiones no se contaba con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que Tomasa desea poder seguir creciendo  con el negocio que le ha brindado estabilidad económica a su familia. Tomasa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, de manera que pueda obtenerlo a precios más accesible, así mismo comprar cilindros de gas propano con el fin de contar con una reserva de este último, ya que en muchas ocasiones escasea y de esta manera no se verá afectada como en otros años, así mismo desea comprar diferentes verduras. Esto será de mucho ayuda para ella, ya que podrá mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y así contar con más clientela.
texts.en: Tomasa de Jesus A. is 42 years old. She lives together with her husband who works as a merchant. They have two children together, both of whom are attending school. For the past 8years Tomasa has been selling tortillas that she makes herself. She also sells vegetables. This business was born from the dream of improving their family finances. There were many times when they didn't have enough money to cover the household expenses. For this reason Tomasa wants to keep her business growing. This business has brought financial stability to the family. Tomasa requests a loan to purchase corn in wholesale. She will be able to get better prices. She will also purchase propane tanks in order to have a backup reserve. There are many occasions when there is a shortage and this way she will never be left in need as in previous years. She also needs to purchase a variety of vegetables. This will be a great help to her. She will be able to improve her business and she will gain more clients.

loans.use: To purchase corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 4 años se dedica a preparar comida que son expendidos a los trabajadores de una empresa publica que la acogió a ella y a su familia. La cantidad de comida que elabora va de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que le hacen sus comensales. Desde entonces vende alimentos para el desayuno y almuerzo. Ella manifiesta estar contenta con su trabajo, ya que sus clientes disfrutan de su sazón y nunca dejan de hacer algún pedido, generándole así mas rentas asimismo puede atender a sus hijos con las tareas escolares. En un futuro tiene el anhelo de tener un restaurante. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Karina, 35, lives with her two children and husband in a rented house.  For over four years she has been preparing meals that are sold to employees of a public firm that welcomed her and her family.  The amount of food she prepares depends on the number of orders her diners place.  Since then she has sold breakfasts and lunches.  She states that she is happy with her work because her customers enjoy her tasty preparations and always place orders thus generating more profits for her.  At the same time, she is able to care for her children and help them with their school work.  In the future she’d like to have a restaurant.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.

She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  

She will use the requested loan to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola  is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to buying sugar and crates of beer.  Viola is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a business man. She has four children and three of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: for buying sugar and crates of beer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Don Domingo Chavarría Ramírez es trabajador de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Agente de Seguridad Interna, desde hace 27 años.

Es Soltero de 57 años de edad, con una persona que depende de él mayor de edad, vive en la ciudad de Managua desde hace 30 años.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, el que utilizará para reparar su vivienda, está muy agradecido ya que con este crédito le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Domingo Chavarría Ramírez has worked at an aqueduct and sewage company as an internal security guard for 27 years.

He is 57 years old and single with one adult under his care.  He has lived in the city of Managua for 30 years.

This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He plans to use the loan to repair his home.  He is very grateful for the loan which will help him improve his and his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: For home repair

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun Sang (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Nem Preum, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Seun is a silk weaver. She also taught her daughters these skills and transferred her loom to her daughters. Her husband is a builder of wooden houses. 

Seun is requesting her second Kiva loan in the amount of $1,100, which she will use to repair the house where she and her family live.

loans.use: To repair the house where family lives

loans.name: Thuthuka Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 52 years old and single with four children, two of whom attend school. She also cares for one relative in Stanger, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. She sells clothing and pinafores ("aprons"). In the photo above, she is raising her hand in the center of the group.

She has been in this business for two years and does not have employees. With this loan, she plans to purchase more clothing stock and hopes to hire an additional employee in the future. She also seeks to improve her life and her business. Fortunately, she does not experience many challenges in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Khushrumo

texts.ru: Сапарова Хушрумо проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Хушрумо занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже год. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скот и обеспечить семью молоком.
texts.en: Khushrumo S. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband does freelance construction work. Khushrumo does animal husbandry. She breeds large cattle for future resale. She has been doing this business for one year. She is taking out the loan to buy one milk cow to increase cattle headcount and provide the family with milk.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 39 años de edad, se dedica a un taller de soldaduras metálicas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos: Carlos de 16 años y Bryan de 12 años de edad, la casa es propia; Desde pequeño aprendió el trabajo, asistía a la escuela y por las tardes aprendía el oficio en un taller cercano,  después decidió trabajar a tiempo completo como empleado de un taller de funeraria donde se construían féretros de metal  para comercializar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales: lamina, ángulos, electrodos y otros que son necesarios para la elaboración de estructuras metálicas; dicha compra la realizara al por mayor, de esta manera conseguirá los materiales a un mejor precio, lo que le ayudara para mejorar la rentabilidad de su trabajo.
El propósito de Francisco es tener un taller amplio, rentable, que atienda eficientemente lo demandado por los clientes, en su familia desea mejorar la condición económica, que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente familiar sin carencias y restricciones económicas.
texts.en:
Francisco is 39 years old and works at a metal welding shop. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and two children: Carlos (16) and Bryan (12). He learned the trade when he was young. He would go to school and in the afternoons, he would learn at a nearby workshop. Later, he decided to work full-time at a funeral shop where he made metal coffins to sell.

He is now requesting a loan to buy materials like metal sheets, angles, electrodes and other items needed for making metal structures. He will make the purchase at wholesale in order to get the materials at a lower price, helping him to increase his business’ profitability.

Francisco’s goal is to have a large, profitable shop which effectively meets the demand of his customers. He wants to improve his family’s financial condition and wants his children to grow up in a familiar environment not lacking anything or having any financial constraints.

loans.use: to buy materials like sheeting, angles and electrodes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 50 years old and a member of Faulu Kenya.  He sells stationery and lab equipment to earn a living. He started running the business six years ago.  

William is very aggressive as he runs his business because he is looking forward to having a wholesale business.  He wants to buy microscopes and Bunsen burners, hence he has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000.

loans.use: To buy microscopes and Bunsen burners.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Mañana Group

texts.es: La Sra. Esther es separada  y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, Esther  es integrante de la alcancía comunal “ El futuro del Mañana” grupo conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a actividades de comercio, Esther  se dedica a la venta  de pollos y aves  desde hace 3 años este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio, ya que ella necesitaba mejores ingresos económicos para mantener a sus hijos y es así que  gracias  a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado brindarles una mejor calidad de vida , tiene  su local propio y sus  hijos hoy en día  tienen una buena educación. Esther nos cuenta que desea seguir creciendo como empresaria y comprarse otro terreno. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería  para implementar su negocio. Sabemos que Esther   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en:
Esther is separated, and has three school age children.  She is a member of the “El Futuro del Mañana” [The Future of Tomorrow] communal bank, made up of seven members dedicated to business activities.  

Esther is dedicated to chicken and bird sales.  This business arose three years ago because of her divorce, since she needed a better income to support her children.  This is how, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she succeeded in providing them a better quality of life.  

Today, she has her own locale and her children have a good education.  Esther tells us that she would like to continue growing as a businesswoman and buy her own land.  The loan that she was given was for the purchase of merchandise to begin her business.  With a lot of hard work and effort, we know that Esther will fulfill her goals, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Embuu

texts.en:
Embuu S. is a 63-year-old widow who lives alone in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvs province, Mongolia. All her children are grown up and live separately. 

She manages a clothing-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006. In addition she also sells fruits in order to supplement her earning. Her children help her during their spare time. Her business has already stabilized and developed. 

She is a polite and open-minded woman who says, "One can achieve in fulfilling his dream if he works hard." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her clothes-trading business.

loans.name: Yusup

texts.en:
Yusup is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children. He grew up with agriculture, and his parents did the same work and he still works planting seeds. He grows seasonal crops on his land, working with the crops until it is time to harvest them. In addition, for extra income he raises cattle. This is his third loan from IMON International and we are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business. Yusup will buy seeds and fertilizers for his land with this loan.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Poeng

texts.en:
Poeng, 46, is a rice farmer who resides in Kompong Chhnang Province. On average, she can earn about $1.75 each day from her farming business. 

She is a married mother who is blessed with three children who study in public school. 

Her husband helps support the family by selling palm leaves. He sells his items to people who need to weave palm leaves into furniture and roofing material. 

In order to make additional income, Poeng requested a loan for her husband to buy additional palm leaves to stock up for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional palm leaves to stock up for resale.

loans.name: Areliz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Areliz, tiene 30 años de edad, es originaria de León, es madre de 2 hijos, de 10 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ella es dueña de un salón de belleza  y vende ropa, lleva 4 años en el negocio.
Ella empezó con el negocio de salón de belleza con el apoyo de su hermana que vive en los Estados Unidos, ella le ayudo a pagar unos cursos para que aprendiera belleza, ella tenia 25 años después de terminar sus cursos fue que inicó a poner su propio salón de belleza y posteriormente  a vender ropa como otra fuente de ingreso para su familia, de esta manera es que ha sobrevivido ella y su familia.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como shampoo, cremas, cosméticos, tintes. Con esta inversión tener  surtido su salón con nuevos y mejores productos, que le permita atraer más clientes, mejorar sus ingresos. En sus planes futuros esta tener su propio local.  
Su meta próxima es construir su casa y poner su salón de belleza en su casa.
texts.en:
Areliz, 30, is from León.  She is the mother of two children who are 10 and 2 years of age respectively.  She owns a beauty salon and sells clothes.  She’s been in business four years.

She started the beauty salon with help from her sister who lives in the United States.  She helped her pay for some courses so she could learn the beauty trade.  She was 25 years old and when she finished her courses she started to set up her own beauty salon.  Later on, she started to sell clothes as another source of family income.  This is how she and her family have survived to date.

She asked for the loan to buy beauty products like: shampoo, creams, cosmetics and hair coloring.  She hopes this investment will help her have her salon stocked with new and better products that will attract more customers and improve her income.  In her future plans is owning her own locale.  Her next goal is to build her house and install her beauty salon there.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.en: Gladys Marlene is a 53-year-old single mother of one adult child.  Gladys has owned a small convenience store for the last four years.  She would like to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase a greater variety of products like cleaning supplies, soap, candy, soda, bread and basic grains for her business.  Gladys’ main is to continue to grow her business and she is very appreciative of the opportunity to become a borrower.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, soap, candy, sodas, bread and basic grains for her business.

loans.name: Erick Mauricio

texts.es: Erick Mauricio, tiene la edad de 24 años, está soltero y vive solo actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos y el pago de la mano de obra. El cuenta con un pequeño terreno sembrado de café y con la experiencia para seguir adelante fortaleciendo el proyecto. El quiere darle a su cafetal una ayuda para así obtener mas cosechas este año. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar y tener un futuro más seguro económicamente.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Erick Mauricio is 24 years old, is single and is currently living by himself.  With the loan, Erick Mauricio plans to purchase supplies and pay his laborers.  He has a small plot of land planted with coffee beans and the experience to move forward by strengthening his project.  He wants to give his coffee plants some help to obtain more harvests this year.  He wants to generate earnings for his own well being and to have a more secure financial future.  This is Erick Mauricio's first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has never before received loans from any state banks, but FUDECOSUR easily offered him the loan at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with coffee assistance.

loans.name: Norik

texts.ru:
Норику 52 года, он родился в селе Шикаох (Shikahogh), окончил сельскую среднюю школу. Норик женат, имеет сына и дочь: сыну 23 года, он учится в Ереванском медицинском университете на шестом курсе бесплатного отделения, дочке 19 лет и она учится в Капанском политехническом институте на втором курсе платного отделения геологического факультета. Норик вместе со своей женой работает в Шикаохской сельской школе. Норик работает в этой школе охранником. 
Также Норик и его жена занимается сельским хозяйством начиная с 1990 г.: они разводят крупный рогатый скот, выращивают овощи и фрукты. Также Норик имеет пастбище, для уборки сена на котором он нанимает механизатора, по причине неимения собственного трактора. На Капанском городском рынке Норик реализует свою сельскохозяйственную продукцию своим постоянным клиентам и таким образом содержит свою семью и платит за обучение дочери. 
Кредит на сумму 700.000 драм необходим Норику для организации уборки сена:  для аренды трактора и найма механизатора, покупки топлива и т.д.
texts.en:
Norik is 52 years old, he was born in the village of Shikahogh and has graduation from the village secondary school. Norik is married and has a son and daughter. His son is 23 years old and he studies in the Yerevan medical university, he is in his second junior year semester in the tuition-free department. His daughter is 19 years old and she is studying in the Kapan polytechnic institute, she is in the second semester of her freshmen year in the paid department of geology. Together with his wife Norik works in the Shikahogh village school. He works as a security guard in this school.

Also, Norik and his wife are in the agriculture business since 1990, they breed large horned cattle and grow fruits and vegetables. Norik also has a pasture for collecting hay for which he hires a machine operator because he does not own a tractor. Norik sells his agriculture production to his regular customers on the Kapan town market and by doing this he supports his family and pays for his daughter's education.

Norik needs the loan in the amount of 700,000 dram to organize collection of hay: to rent out a tractor and hire an operator, to buy fuel and etc.

loans.use: to organize the collection of hay

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 21 years old. She is now taking care of her one little angel. At an early age, Joan separated from her husband. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a retail store at home to make a living. Joan has now been running the business for two years. A total of PHP 3,000 is generated a month.
 
This year, 2011, Joan made the choice to join GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. Her first loan application at the cooperative is for PHP 5,000. The money is intended to purchase grocery items to sell. Joan has to sustain their livelihood much more now that she's the only one working for the family to keep going. Joan hopes to own a motorcycle soon to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Cresencia Isabel  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 70 años quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 8 años inicio con unos cuantos productos en la Avon ahora vende más y de distintas casa comerciales Zermat, Boguet, Arabella…etc. 
Ella con el crédito comprará productos en especial perfumes y cremas; ya que tiene pedidos en esto.
texts.en:
Mrs, Cresencia Isabel is a hard-working and enterprising woman of 70 years who has sold cosmetics for 8 years. She started off with some Avon products and now sells more, from various lines: Zermat, Boguet, Arabella...etc.
With this loan she will purchase products, especially perfumes and creams, since she already has orders for these.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Ros

texts.es: Ros, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 38 años de edad, ella es soltera alegre y trabajadora vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es brindarle lo mejor a su futura familia. Ros, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casta familiar. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra sus tierras con cultivos de café y cacao; viene realizando esta actividad hace 18 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró una cuadra más de terreno para seguir cultivando. En tiempo de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, por ello tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante sus sembríos. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando y por ende se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en: Ros, from the city of Quimbiri, is 38. She is a happy and hard-working single woman. She lives in her own home and she most desires to offer the best to her future family. Ros is a very hard worker. She takes great pains everyday to offer the best of herself to her extended family. She is a farmer and sows coffee and cocoa. She has been doing this with great care and industriousness for 18 years. Thanks to her crops, she was able to buy another plot of land for cultivation. At harvest time and weeding time, she has to hire day workers in order to do her job more quickly. She has uncultivated lands and needs a loan to do this work. She plans to sow more coffee plants. She hopes to put the same strength and vigour as always into her new crop. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes for the support of each of you in order to continue progressing. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. With the money from this requested loan, she will purchase more coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Ya sells palm products, earning an income of 3 USD per day. His wife grows rice on her plot of farmland, earning an income of 1.5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 15 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Ya is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more palm products and palm sugar to resell. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy palm products and palm sugar to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, and rice for resale. She was initially selling fresh foods only, and she later diversified to start a retail shop. Her challenge is price flactuation. Her dreams are to have a wholesale shop and to educate her children. She shared with us that her success is a result of the loans she has so far acquired.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and rice for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Janet; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de contadora, la socia tiene un estudio contable donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere implementar su consultorio contable. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una computadora para su consultorio contable. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “HATUN RUMIYOC” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. 

Her name is Janet. She is 32 years old, married and has one son. She alternates her other daily activities with being an accountant. She has an accounting business where she works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. With this job she gets her son ahead. She wants to outfit her accounting office and is asking for the loan to buy a computer for it. 

Janet is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a computer her accounting business.

loans.name: Real Friends Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Real Friends” group from Waterloo, a small-town in Western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 3,200,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Jeneba is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married with 3 children. Her husband is retired and 1 of her children is attending primary school and the other 2 are no longer attending schools. Jeneba has been doing business for almost 20 years now. She sells drinks, sugar, milk, butter, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, milk, butter, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Wendy Arely

texts.es:
Wendy, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 4 años en el negocio, lo administra en su casa, donde ha hecho un corralito para tenerlos encerrados; Wendy vive con dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, también vive con su esposo, ya que junto a él iniciaron con la crianza de los cerdos.
Wendy está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos, ya que se le presenta la oportunidad de realizar la compra, esta inversión le dará un aumento en el negocio, continuando en el trabajo para proveer para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Wendy breeds pigs. She has been in the business for 4 years. She keeps her pigs at home, where she has a pig pen to keep them enclosed.

Wendy lives with two children, 3 years and 1 year old. She also lives with her husband and together they began the breeding of pigs. 

Wendy is asking for a loan in order to buy two pigs. She already has the opportunity to make a purchase, and this loan will increase her business, keeping her in work in order to provide the family necessities.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло проживает в районе Яван. Ему 75 лет. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 30 лет. У Хабибулло пятеро детей. Он женат. Двое его дочери работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Он берет кредит для закупа бычка и теленка.
texts.en: Habibullo lives in the Yavan region. He's seventy-five years old and makes a living by breeding large cattle. He's been in this field of work for thirty years. He has five children and a wife. Two of his daughters work on dekhan farms. Habibullo is asking for a loan in order to purchase a bull and a calf.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and a calf.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old and married to her husband, John.  They have one child who is six months old.  Esther has sold second-hand clothes for the last three years and earns an income of KES 6,000 a month.

This is her first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  Esther will use the entire loan to buy more clothes for sale.  She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs.  Esther hopes to grow her business and open a boutique in future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 
Magdalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.
Magdalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Magdalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is 54 years of age and is married, with seven children.

Tasi is engaged in a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has four years of experience in this business. Tasi  needs a loan of WST 2,800 to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300, or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tasi 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry business where he make furniture to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more items for his carpentry business like timber and nails. His business goal is to have a big workshop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more items for his carpentry business like timber and nails

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria Virginia is married and has two sons. She has had her business for 12 years and her sons asisst her in this business. 12 years ago, she had to begin working because she had to help with the family expenses. She loves to cook and decided to open a small bakery that has been doing very well. As time has passed her business has grown and based on this she strongly believes it will continue growing. She hopes in time to be a successful female entrepreneur and leave her sons a business which could help them and continue growing. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 that she offers to pay back in six months. With this loan she will purchase raw materials for her bakery and will be prepared for the upcoming months which, in her experience, are the best of the year.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Virginia esta casada y tiene dos hijos, ya tiene con su negocio 12 años y la ayudan en el negocio sus hijos. Hace 12 años ella se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder tener el sustento de la familia y como le gusta mucho la repostería, decidió abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de pan y pasteles que a la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Con el paso del tiempo el negocio ha ido creciendo y fortaleciéndose y por ello Maria Virginia tiene muchas expectativas de seguir creciendo y llegar a ser en algún momento una mujer emprendedora exitosa y dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio y un negocio del cual puedan ellos continuar y salir adelante económicamente. Por ello esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 1,200 que ofrece pagarlos en 6 meses y lo usará para comprar materia prima para la panadería y estar lista para estos meses que según su experiencia son los mejores del año.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mukhtaram

texts.en: Mukhtaram V. is a divorced woman who has three children (2 daughters and 1 son). She worked at home as a dressmaker. She had very few clients, due to small choice of materials and accessories. She did not have enough capital to buy those and as a result her profit was too small to make a living. Therefore she had to leave her children with her mother and go to work in Russia. She worked there one month and came back because could not stay separately from her children. When she came back she joined the group of clients who received loans from MicroInvest. She spent the first loan for materials and accessories. Now she would like to rent a shop to sew dresses and sell them at the market on weekends.

loans.use: Sewing national dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "Oil milling is my job. I learnt it from my mother and am happy doing this work for the community. Because of my job, people in my community are happy," says Mrs. Mabel A.. She is 41 years old, married with five children, and hopes to get additional money for the business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for oil production

loans.name: Anibal Amilkar

texts.es:
Anibal is married and has two little children, one of them is two years old and the youngest is nearly one year old. Anibal inherited a restaurant, where roasted chicken was traditionally served, from his father. Along with his wife, they have incorporated additional dishes, which have fortunately gained a great acceptance among his clients. He presently counts with the help of five employees and his business has rapidly grown. The love for his family and his wish to provide them with the best has motivated him to put forth an excellent work and become better every day.

In order to improve his business' appearance and buy more chairs and tables, Anibal is requesting a $1200 loan, which he has committed to repay in five months. With your help, Anibal’s business will be able to keep growing and offer jobs to more people, and he is sincerely grateful for any help you can give him.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Anibal es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, una de 2 años y la más pequeña está por cumplir su primer año de edad. Anibal heredó de su padre un restaurante donde asaban pollos. Entre él y su esposa fueron incorporando la venta de otros platillos, que afortunadamente han tenido muy buena aceptación de sus clientes. Ahora cuenta con la ayuda de cinco empleados y ha hecho crecer este negocio rápidamente. El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de darles lo mejor lo ha motivado a realizar un excelente trabajo y a mejorar día a día.

Para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y comprar más mesas y sillas, Anibal está solicitando un crédito de $1200 dólares, que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses. Con tu ayuda, Anibal podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y ofrecer empleo a más personas, por lo que agradece sinceramente el apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Renovation.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a car electrician. His workshop is in Al Ain, in the Bekaa. He is a young entrepreneur of 23 years old. He is striving to be a self made man. Hussein is known by his clients as a good car electrician. They usually come from the surrounding neighborhoods. Hussein needs to buy material for his business. He is planning to grow steadily and progressively. This is the first time that Hussein requests a loan from Al Majmoua. He heard about the Institution by word of mouth.

loans.use: Purchase material for his business of car electrician

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband who is a rickshaw driver. At present, he rents someone else's rickshaw but wants to buy his own because, after paying the rent, he is left with a very little money, insufficient for us to make ends meet. To supplement my husband’s income, I work at a beauty parlor for a small pay of $50 a month. I have three children all of whom attend the school.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Teodora Marcelina

texts.es:
Teodora Marcelina Martinez is a single mother of four children who are in school, reason for which she needs to watch out for their development and education. She has a business selling plastic bags in the Municipal Market. She started this business when her husband left her, because the money he gave her was not enough and is only enough to cover food expenses. For this reason, seeking for a way to support her children, she decided to start this business.

Mrs. Martinez has been working with CEPRODEL for three years. She tells us that she feels very good with the loans she has received because they have come at an opportune time, quickly, and have allowed her to support her children, and in addition to improve her house and her business.

Currently this business is one of the strongest in the field of plastic bags sales.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora Marcelina M. es madre soltera de cuatro hijos los cuales están estudiando por lo que debe de velar por su desarrollo y educación. Tiene su negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas en el Mercado Municipal, ella comienza el negocio una vez que su marido la abandona, ya que el ingresos que el marido le pasa es muy poco y solo le alcanza para la comida, por tal razón, buscando la manera de ayudar a sus hijos es que ella decide emprender este negocio.

La señora M., trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para salir a delante con su hijos, estos a demás le han servido para el mejoramiento tanto para embellecer su casa, como para fortalecer su negocio.

Actualmente este negocio es uno de los más fuertes en lo que respecta a la venta de Bolsas plásticas.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de Mercadería)

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.en:
The fifteen women you see here have formed a support group and come together once a week to discuss their various businesses. They have taken the name of “Cristo Rey,” and work hard in their various businesses to support their families. Some of them bring their children to meetings while others come alone. They all work together, supporting one another in pursuit of increased business profits.

Some women sell clothes, others make clothes. They sell food and household goods and provide various services. They are asking for a loan to keep their businesses growing and to increase their profits .

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, eggs, oil, plastic goods, clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov S. is a widow with five children who works as a rice seller in front of Bontey Srey temple and makes on average about $2 of profit a day. Three of her children are married and live away from home while the other two work in a restaurant as a waiter and as a motor-taxi driver. To produce more revenue, she needs a loan from Kiva in the amount of $700  to create another business, like purchasing pigs to breed.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Osayomore

texts.en: Osayomore O. is 48 years old, and is married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City.  She goes to the northern part of Nigeria to buy yams, and then sells them in Benin City. She started this business in 1987 and learned how to do it for some years from a friend. She would like a loan in the amount of $1050 to enable her to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira M. was born in 1975 and she lives with her husband in a small suburb of the town of Živinice called Đurđevik. Her husband works in a local community. His monthly salary is 500 KM (about US$ 410). They have two children.

With part of this loan in the amount of 1000 KM (US$ 825) Amira will purchase thread for crochet, and she will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for fattening. Amira makes handicrafts which she sells to generate additional income and with that work she fills her free time. Her wish is to improve their family income through a poultry business.

loans.use: To buy thread and chickens

loans.name: Eoeum

texts.en: Eoeum S. is 45 years old. She sells traditional Khmer cakes earning $4 US per day from her home in Siem Reap province. These cakes include ingredients such as rice, banana, and coconut. Her husband works at a nearby rice farm. They have three children. One young child stays at home, but the older two must work. They are waiters at a restaurant, each of them earning $2 US per day. Eoeum wants to take out a large loan to repair her house in anticipation of the upcoming rainy season. Monsoons often flood and destroy smaller Khmer homes and she knows she cannot afford to lose her place of business as well as her family's shelter and home.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 40, is married and has one child who is in school. For the past twelve years, she has had a business selling clothing, slippers and dressing bags.

Unfortunately, Juliana has low working capital. As a result, she is not able to purchase high quality products. She believes that a loan will help her meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. She would use her loan to buy more clothing, slippers and dressing bags. She would also expand her stock to include traveling bags.

Juliana belongs to a community group called Lydia ‘mma’ (meaning Children of Lydia) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each others’ loans by providing social collateral for loan access and peer pressure to repay the loan. This photo of Juliana was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and expand her stock to include traveling bags

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Ms. Farida is 20 years old and single. She lives with her family including her mother and two small brothers who are school boys. She lost her father during the war in Afghanistan, so she holds all the responsibilities for the family and has presently lots of economic problems.

Farida has a bakery in her house. All her clients are female. She needs to open a bigger one through which she could do her business better, meeting the expenses of her poor family.

When Farida found about AFSG, she requested an individual loan to improve her business. By expanding her business, she should be able to better support her family.

Farida is very happy with the process of loans in Afghanistan, especially the programs for women who are responsible for their families. Farida wants to thank all lenders around the world and AFSG in advance.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 54 year old man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He is agro chemical seller and sells various kinds of chemicals like herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands. With the loan, Nicholas wants to purchase more supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines serves the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his kids’ education. He would be very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Thi Phuong's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Phương, sinh năm 1071(Ms 23070050), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi bò, lợn. Hàng ngày chị vẫn đi chợ buôn bán rau còn chồng chị đi phụ xây, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Kinh té của gia đình dụa vào thu nhập bình quân  khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Vợ chồng chị mong muốn dược vay vốn nhiều lần để phát triển kinh tế và anh chị luôn cố gắng làm việc để có tiền hoàn trả vốn và tiết kiệm phòng khi ốm đau. Cùng vay vốn ví chị còn có: 
Lê Thị Mai,sinh năm 2950 (Ms 23070049), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư nuôi lợn. gia đình cô có nhiều nghề nên thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 150.000 vnđ.ngày.
Lê Thị Thủy, sinh năm 1971(Ms 23070052), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng.
Nguyễn Thị Hà,sinh năm 1985(Ms 23070041), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Chồng chị làm thợ xây thu nhập khoảng 100.000 vnđ/ ngày.
Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt, sinh năm 1972(Ms 23070080), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Thu nhập theo ngày của chị khoảng 150.000 / ngày.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Phuong (ID Number 23070050), born 1071, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in rearing cows and pigs. Everyday, she sells vegetabL. in the market whiL. her husband works at construction sites. Her two children are still young and attending school. Her whoL. family relies on the average monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 121USD). Her husband and she would like to borrow a few times to improve their family's financial situation. They are working hard to be abL. to repay the loan and save an amount of money for rainy days. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. L. Thi Mai (ID Number 23070049), born in 1950, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Her family has several vocations so the daily income is about 150,000VND (about 9USD).
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thuy (ID Number 23070052), born in 1971, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in her general store.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Ha (ID Number 23070041), born in 1985, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in raising chickens. Her husband is a construction worker with the daily income of 100,000VND (about 6USD).
  • Mrs N. Thi Nguyet (ID Number 23070080), born in 1972, borrows 1,972,000VND to do business. Her daily income is about 150,000VND (about 9USD).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
La señora María Julia tiene 52 años de edad, es la fiscal del Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata II  y vive en la MZ A 17 lote 52 Manuel Arévalo III etapa, distrito de La Esperanza.
Durante su niñez vivió en Paiján donde estudió la primaria completa, pero su madre falleció y para el padre no le pareció importante que su hija estudie. Ella manifiesta que le gustó mucho estudiar y de poderlo hacer le hubiese gustado estudiar enfermería. Se casó con el señor José león y tienen tres hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
Al principio vendía en Causal, posteriormente cambió de ocupación y se dedicó a la costura y a criar animales menores, hasta que al venir a vivir a Arévalo compró su triciclo y se convirtió en vendedora ambulante de fruta y verdura. Vende fuera del Mercado Acomar de Manuel Arévalo.
Con el monto del primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, incrementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 900 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un saco de arroz, pollo y fruta.
María Julia sueña con tener una casa céntrica y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria Julia is 52 years old and she is the comptroller of the “Hilos de Plata II” (Silver Threads II) comunal bank. She lives in Block A, Lot 52 of the Manuel Arévalo development, Phase III, in the district of La Esperanza. During her childhood, she lived in Paiján, where she finished grade school. But her mother died and it didn’t seem important to her father that his daughter study. She says that she very much liked school and that if she could have, she would have studied nursing. She married José León and they have three dependant children. At first she was a vendor in Causal. She later changed occupations and worked in sewing and raised small farm animals. When she moved to Arévalo, she bought her tricycle and became a street vendor of fruits and vegetables. She sells outside the Acomar Market in Manuel Arévalo. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, she increased her business. With this loan of 900 soles, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy a sack of rice, chicken, and fruit. Maria Julia dreams of having a well-located house in which she could have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a sack of rice, chicken, and fruit.

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en: Mrs. Lieng S. is a villager in Peak Bang Aung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Mut Kuch, is a construction worker. With their revenue, they cannot improve their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Lieng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to start a new business. She hopes to increase their income and improve her living conditions after she sells her cows. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are five and two years old. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Née vers 1978 à  Damè  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  A. Jeanne est mariée et mère de 3enfants non scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du maïs et de la farine.
