   Ella se dedica a la panadería en donde lleva dos años y  comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha estado teniendo un buen resultado y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: azúcar, huevo, harina, aceite, entre otros, para que con ellos se apoye y elabore su actividad más tiempos.

    Ella se inspiro en esta actividad  porque desde muy joven ella apoyaba a sub mama con la venta y a elaborarlo y cuando se caso lo práctico unos  años pero cuando nacieron sus primero hijos  dejo de practicarlo y hace dos s  años comenzó de nuevo.

     Lo que mas desea en esta actividad es que con la bendición de dios y el préstamo pueda salir adelante  y trabajar hasta que las sigan apoyando con el crédito.
texts.en:
Fidelina is married to Celerino and lives in the town Llano Grande in the municipality of Coapilla, in Chiapas. 

She devotes herself to a bakery she has had for two years, and comments that it is going well since she has been making good profits. She requested the loan in order to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as sugar, eggs, flour, oil, among other items, so she may be supported and carry out her business activities longer. 

She was inspired to start this business because from a very early age she helped her mom with selling and making it. When she got married she did it for several years, but when her first child was born she stopped, and two years ago she began again. 

What she wishes for most in this business is that with God's blessing and the loan she may get ahead and work so they may continue supporting them with the loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making breads and pastries.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La comunidad de Papel Pata se encuentra a unos treinta minutos de la ciudad principal de La Convención (Quillabamba). 

En la comunidad de Papel Pata conocimos a la señora Juana y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Santa Teresa y tiene 44 años de edad, ella esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Juana vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Juana se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra y venta de frutas, ella lleva sus productos dos veces a la ciudad de Quillabamba para vender a las personas que se encargan de llevar a la ciudad del Cusco. Desde joven aprendió el oficio pues sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de la agricultura. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a la venta de fruta y le va muy bien. Juana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fruta como por ejemplo naranjas, lima, limón y otros más. 
 
El banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Papel Pata de la distrito de Echarate provincia de La Convención  del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
The community of Papel Pata is located some thirty minutes from the main city of La Convencion (Quillabamba).

In the community of Papel pata we meet Mrs. Juana, who tells us that she was born in the city of Santa Teresa and is 44. She is married and has three children from this union. Currently, Juana lives in the Papel Pata community, some 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba. This is where she has her business.

Juana works in agriculture, specifically sowing and selling fruit. She brings her products to the city of Quillabamba to sell to people who then bring the produce to Cusco city. She learned this work at a young age; her parents taught her how to work in agriculture. She has sold fruit for 15 years, and it is going very well for her. Now, Juana needs this loan to purchase fruit such as oranges, limes and lemons.

The "Caminando Juntos" Communal Bank belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa (Cusco, Peru) and the members meet every thirty days in the community of Papel Pata in the Echarate district, La Convencion province, department of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase fruit such as oranges, limes, and lemons.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a farmer in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is single and 28 years old. He has been in farming for eight years. His farm produces potatoes, tea and milk, which he sells at the local market.

Vincent has requested his first time loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a zero-grazing unit and plant nappier grass for his dairy cows. He says these will boost his production and reduce his expenditures immensely. He wants to buy more land for effective farming in the future.

Vincent says small land ownership is the challenge for many farmers.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en: Awatef is a 42 years old, single and has earned a living for the last 15 years by selling clothes. At the beginning, she had to struggle because it was illegal for women to work. She has fought to prove that women can work, be successful and do something other than raise children and be housewives. She has always insisted on making her own living and not depending on anyone to take care of her. She has received and repaid three previous loans from our organization and is applying for her fourth loan to buy new clothing which her customers use to celebrate the end of Ramadan. Her goal is to continue to be successful, open a new store and find new customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise customers wear to celebrate Eid, the end of Ramadan.

loans.name: Estación De Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estación de Cumbe está formado por 6 mujeres y 2 hombres, viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Tarqui, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de ganado gracias a sus llanuras, también laboran en la agricultura y mucha de su gente sale diariamente a la ciudad para laborar en diferentes actividades. Nuestras socias y socios son personas trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a  día luchan para salir adelante junto con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Laura, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Tarqui, tiene 53 años, es casada y ha concebido 6 hijos de 34, 32, 30, 28  y 18 años, sus hijos de 18  años son gemelos, dos de sus hijos son casados e independientes y sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es el resultado del sacrificio conyugal.
 
La Señora. María Laura se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, a la ganadería y a la cría cuyes y borregos, en su comunidad vende sus animales y la leche que le producen sus vacas. 

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para su ganado y pollos.

Su meta es tener un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
The Estación de Cumbe Communal Bank is composed of 6 women and 2 men who live in the outskirts of the parish of Taqui, characterized by its cold climate. Its inhabitants engage in breeding cattle on the surrounding plains as well as in agriculture, and many of them daily commute to town to work in different activities. Our members are hardworking and tenacious people striving day by day to progress together with their families.

One of the members of this group is María Laura, who lives in the outskirts of the parish of Tarqui. She is 53 years old, she is married and has 6 children aged 34, 32, 30, 28 and a set of twins aged 18. Two of her children are marred and economically independent, the other four have a job and help her economically. Her husband is a farmer. They live in their own home, built thanks to their hard work and sacrifice.

María Laura takes care of the housework and she engages in breeding livestock, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and lambs, selling her animals and the milk of her cows in her community.

This is the first loan she is requesting through the communal bank, and she will use it to buy animal feed for her animals and chickens.

Her goal is to run a chicken breeding and selling activity.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for animals and chickens.

loans.name: Esteffany Jhoany

texts.es: La señorita Esteffany es una joven emprendedora y bien trabajadora, ella vende zapatos por catàlogo, lleva trabajando asi por mas de 2 años, es soltera y tiene grandes aspiraciones por progresar, solicita el prèstamo Kiva para comprar mas zapatos ya que se acerca la temporada de Primavera y verano y necesita abastecerse para esta temporada y poder atender a sus clientes, su gran sueño es tener su casa propia y poder independizarse de sus padres, hacer crecer su negocio y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Esteffany is an enterprising and very hard-working young person.  She sells shoes by catalog and has been working at this for over 2 years.  She is single and has great aspirations to make progress.  She is requesting this Kiva loan in order to purchase more shoes, since the spring and summer seasons are approaching and she needs to be supplied for the season and be able to attend to her customers.  Her great dream is to have her own house and be able to become more independent from her parents, making her business grow and thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to implement her business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang, 61, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Lang is a housewife while her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Two of her children are employed at the factory and at a construction site to earn money for the family. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. Lang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Atartuya

texts.en: Atartuya is 37-years old, single, and lives with her mother. She is a teacher at university and has been doing this job for 4 years. She is a very caring person that she still takes care of her mother. She and her mother live in a small house which needs repair. The furnace is also so old that it can’t warm the house fully. Since the winter is coming, she wants to buy new furnace which uses smokeless-fuel. She thinks that it is beneficial to her expenses and natural-orientation for the environment. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a new furnace and to purchase some building materials to make a repair to her house.

loans.use: to buy a new furnace and purchase some building materials to make a repair to her house.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Jose; el tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de multiservicios donde se realizan fotocopias, anillados y otros servicios, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de multiservicios. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el comprar materiales  como papel y repuestos para la fotocopiadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

His name is Juan Jose. He is 31 years old and he is single. He alternates his daily activities with his print store where he makes photocopies, binds books and other services. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. He wants to expand his print store. He requests a loan to purchase materials such as paper and parts for the photocopier.

He is happy for this loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase products such as paper and parts for the photocopier.

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en: Mohsen is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has 15 years of experience working as a cultivator. His farm produces a wide variety of vegetables which are all sold to local markets. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase seeds in order to increase his business productivity. He will also use the loan to improve his land’s condition to make his farming work easier to complete.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.name: Pablo Marvin

texts.es: Pablo Marvin tiene su negocio que es un comedor, desde hace más de 11 años. Ofrece comidas como gallo pinto, arroz con bistec, pollo en salsa blanca, carne desmenuzada entre otros platillos. A pesar de que no fue fácil mantener el negocio con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceites, verduras, platos desechables, cubiertos, bolsas, tortillas, chile entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Pablo Marvin has managed a diner for more than 11 years. He offers dishes such as beans and rice, steak with rice, chicken in white sauce, shredded beef, and other foods. Even though maintaining this business is not easy, Pablo manages to get ahead through effort and dedication.

This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, cutlery, bags, tortillas, chili peppers, and other necessary items for making his dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, cutlery, bags, tortillas, chili peppers, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  She runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  She has employed one person in the business.  Besides this, she does farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances. This is because she has been trained on financial management through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  
Jane hopes to expand her business premises so as to accommodate more customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize, beans and milk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize, beans and milk.

loans.name: Friends Shg Group

texts.en:
Samuel takes care of two children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Samuel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samuel was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acres of land. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. With income from maize sales, Samuel will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

Samuel is the facilitator of the Friends SHG group. Samuel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Friends SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nasalila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nasalila Group in Western Kenya! Eunice is the facilitator of the Nasalila group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Eunice  takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Eunice will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Nasalila group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mu

texts.en:
Mu is 38 years of age and is married with 6 children. Mu owns and operates a business venture of raising pigs and chicken for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Mu needs a loan of WST $1500 to upgrade her business status. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Mu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Mu's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest and upgrade her animal sales business

loans.name: Samuel Karisa

texts.en:
Samuel Karisa is a 45 year old landlord in Kilifi. He is married and a father of two children. 

He has been doing this business for the last 20 years and he is doing great. He was introduced to KADET  and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase iron sheets to build more rental houses. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 
He hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, 36, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a poultry-keeping business, selling from home and at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing chicken feed. She dreams of expanding and hiring more employees in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more chicks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for resale.

loans.name: Maria Antona

texts.en:
My name is Maria Antona and I sell underwear for men, women and children. This business helps me support my family. I am a single mother of three children. Now, I need to invest money in a purchase of a varity of clothing in order to increase my earnings.

Loan Use: Purchase of underwear inventory

Me llamo Maria Antona y me dedico a vender ropa interior para caballero, dama y niño. Este negocio me ha ayudado a mantener a mi familia ya que soy madre soltero y tengo bajo mi responsabilidad a tres hijos. Ahorita necesito invertir dinero en compra de ropa variada para poder incrementar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa interior.

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en:
Shirkhan is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had his business for 20 years ago and it allows him to support his family. His efforts have led him to achieve what he has today.
Each day he works harder to grow.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 7 pregnant sheep.
The second time he borrowed $700 and bought 12 pregnant sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 20 pedigree ewes.
56-year-old Shirkhan is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Khaladj village, Salyan region. He is married and has 7 children.

loans.use: To buy 20 pedigree ewes

loans.name: Moses Njibwakale

texts.en: Moses started his business in 1990 with capital from the sale of his farm produce. His business includes buying cattle from the nearest markets and selling them at a higher price to farmers or at Slaughter houses. Through his business, he has been able to educate his twelve children up to secondary school levels. With a second loan from PEMCI, he intents to increase on his stock and improve on his market base through moving in the different markets.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Lemuel

texts.en: Jeffery Lemuel has built a very successful business selling and repairing air conditioners and refrigerators. Eager to continue expanding his company, this thirty-two-year-old entrepreneur has come to us for a loan to make his dream possible.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja K. is forty years old and is married to a teacher whose income comes irregularly.  As a mother of five children, she needs to supplement her husband’s salary to meet the family expenses.  She runs a store selling soft drinks and mineral water.  She said she has a high demand during the summer months and is planning to increase her stock. A loan of $175 will enable her to increase her profit and meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: Increase supply of soft drinks during peak times.

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en: Thaimu is 28 years old and married with a child.  He has never had a formal education due to his parent’s poverty situation.  He started his business 10 years ago on a very small scale and it has not grown due to the lack of capital.  Thaimu’s previous loan increased his stock and income.  According to Thaimu, with his income, he is now able to take care of his family and his elderly parents.  He is requesting for more loans to expand his business.  He sells cosmetics in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Expand his selection of cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Nyai

texts.en: Nyai is 40 years old and a mother oF.a 9 year old son. She has been running her business oF.selling toys. She also produces some dolls and sells them. She usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, Iming, is a laborer who earns $2 salary per day. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business to cover their daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period oF.12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Whadeean

texts.en:
Whadeean B. lives in Lahore and has six children. Not all of  her children have been at school for extended periods of time: Whadeean and her husband could not give much education to their daughters, since Whadeean's father-in-law was opposed to sending girls to school. However, once the family moved to Lahore, Whadeean made sure her daughters learnt some skills. In addition, also one of her sons managed to attend some school. 

Whadeean is a textile designer and makes traditional embroidered shalwar kameez, which she has been doing for many years. She buys cloth from the market and hires workers to embroider them. Whadeean sells about 20 outfits per month and makes US$15 to US$25 in profit per outfit. She currently needs a loan of US$250 to be able to purchase cloth in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for a textiles business

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi, 41, is the mother of 4 children. She makes flavoured ice by putting them into small plastic bags then freezing them before selling them. She earns an irregular income from this business, but sometimes she could earn $4 a day.  Her husband, E., sells vegetables and earns $10 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of $100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Keth

texts.en: Mrs. Keth S. is 37 years old and has four children. She works with her husband and they make small mills (a mill weighs approximately 10 - 15 kilograms and is made from hard stone). On average, they earn approximately $6 of profit per day. They are requesting a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to easily transport their products so that they can sell such products at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transport their products to the market for sale.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a daughter named Svetlana. She is an enterprising business owner who works in the sphere of clothing sales. Ludmila runs a small business selling men’s shirts in one of the most popular markets in Zaporozhye. Ludmila offers merchandise that is unique – there are very few kiosks with the same inventory in her market. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Her turnover capital is about $2500. Some of the strong characteristics of her business are its stability and the quality of merchandise offered.

Ludmila wants a loan of $1000 to purchase a wide range of clothing items. which will help her improve the quality of her work and get more customers. Ludmila is willing to take business risks, but she knows how to weigh all her decisions before committing to anything. Moreover, she is very devoted to the success of her business and has proven that she will be able to repay this loan without a problem.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is in the business of raising lambs and reselling them on the market. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. At first she breeds and raises the animals and then resells them to the butchers. Zebonisso wants to purchase several additional grown animals while the prices have not gone up. For this purpose she wishes to obtain a loan. This will help her increase turnover. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Саидова Зебониссо живет в городе Яван. Домохозяйка. Но занимается откормкой барашков для продажи мясникам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 10 лет. Сначала разводит животных , откармливает , а затем продает мясникам. Пока цены на животных не выросли Зебониссо хочет купить дополнительно взрослых овец. Для этого она должна сначала получить кредит. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и и доход клиента. Погасить кредит Зебониссо сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase several lambs

loans.name: Muwerere, Kyosiga Group

texts.en:
M. Edward has a retail shop that has been running since 1991. He is 31 years and is married with 3 children. He cares for his relatives, including his wife's parents and his in the village.  He would like a loan to help him buy more goods like sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour for his shop.  Since he buys in small quantities, he usually buys the goods from Nazigo and Kayunga. 
His dream is to transform his shop into a wholesale business in a few years to come and, with this change, he will be able to buy in large quantities from Jinja, where the prices are much lower than in Kayunga and Nazigo, though transport is slightly high. In the shop, he is helped by his wife and together they are determined to make their dream come true.
M. Edward has been a good member of Kyosiga women’s group for one and a half years and he will share the loan with the 10 other members of the group.

loans.use: Muwerere Edward plans to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour so as to increase his shop inventory.

loans.name: Comité San Pedro Group

texts.es:
The San Pedro Group was formed on May 21, 2008. Said group was organized thanks to the current president, Ramona O., who works selling fruits and vegetables. She began investigating how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras program worked, approaching the advisor during a weekly meeting she was having in the neighborhood. Mrs. Ramona O. started telling her neighbors about it and organized a meeting of 16 women who today make up the San Pedro Group.

The members of this group use their loans for different activities including selling fruits and vegetables, clothing, candies, refreshing remedies, food and beverages, linen goods, aluminum items, sheets, handcrafted clothing and needlework.

The also actively participate in weekly meetings and do other activities to make money like food fairs and raffles. The group works together and demonstrates camaraderie and solidarity.

Today the women would like another loan that will allow them to continue to increase their income from sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado San Pedro, se formó el 21 de mayo del 2008. Dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la actual presidenta, Ramona O., quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, comenzó a averiguar acerca de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, acercándose a la Asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en el barrio. La señora Ramona O. comenzó a comentarles a sus vecinas y logró juntar a 16 mujeres las cuales integran hoy día el Comité San Pedro.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas y verduras, venta de ropas, golosinas, remedios refrescantes, venta de comidas y bebidas, venta de lencerías, venta de artículos de aluminio, venta de sábanas y ropas artesanales, trabajos en costura, etc.

Las mismas participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades extras para recaudar fondos como ferias de comidas y rifas. El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad.

Hoy ellas están deseosas de retirar un nuevo crédito que les permita seguir incrementado sus ingresos de venta.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, aluminum items, ingredients to prepare food, pots, charcoal, hosiery, clothing, candies, linen goods, sheets, handcrafted clothing and fabric.

loans.name: Amina's Rehema Group

texts.en:
Amina is 28-years-old, married with two children, ages 11 and 4. She began selling food in 2000. She works from 6AM to 9PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Amina has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and utensils for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with groceries, cooking oil sales, alcohol and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús (Heart Of Jesus) Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardín, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 486.000 cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a la que la presidenta actual la señora Salvadora M. pudo contactar con el oficial de comités de la Fundación Paraguya, Freddy Bordón quienes le informo de los requisitos para formar un comités y rápidamente lograron reunir a las 15 señoras interesadas en formar parte del comités.

La señora Salvadora, comenta que el grupo de mujeres están llevando acabo un proyecto que esta teniendo buenos resultados y es la siguiente, llevar a exponer sus productos al costado de la ruta 2 a la altura del Km 52, especialmente los fines de semanas que es cuando la ciudad recibe a los fieles de la Virgen de Caacupé, los primeros resultados fueron muy auspiciosos, ya que registraron buen movimiento de ventas.

Con los prestamos que recibieron de la Fundación Paraguaya pudieron comprar, gran cantidad de semillas, plantas, abonos, macetas, etc. pues de las 15 integrantes 9 de ellas poseen viveros de plantas; el resto de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de bebidas, venta varias de forma ambulante y otras poseen despensas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 15 hard-working women from the Cabañas de Caacupé area. Most of the women grow and sell garden plants. They are long-time residents of the neighborhood and all help one another in order to sell their products.

The group is currently in its 8th loan cycle with Fundación Paraguay's Mujeres Emprendedoras group loan program. Each group member will receive an average of 486,000 guaranís apiece (US $121.80).

The group was founded thanks to the efforts of the current president, Salvadora M., who contacted Fundación Paraguaya's head of group loans, Freddy Bordón, who told her what the requirements were for forming groups. Soon, they were able to get 15 women interested in forming a group together to meet.

Mrs. Salvadora says that the group of women are carrying out a project that is having very positive results: they are selling their products at Km 52 of Route 2. Sales are especially good on weekends, when religious pilgrims visit the city to honor the Virgin of Caacupé. The group's early results have been very promising, since they have made a good number of sales.

With the loans they received from Fudación Paraguaya, the group members mostly bought great quantities of seeds, plants, fertilizers and pots (9 of the 15 women own plant nurseries; the others sell drinks, work as street vendors or own neighborhood stores).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, seeds, garden plants, pots

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr: Caroline D., 46 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des porcs et des aliments pour les engraisser et les revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Caroline D., 46, is married with 7 children for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank Catholic Women of Vélingara for three years and a half. She wants a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them for re-sale. Her income allows her to help pay family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening pigs for re-sale

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Doña Ileana H. tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tienen una hija de 14 años de edad. Doña Ileana es maestra, imparte clases en un colegio público de Managua, tiene 26 años de dedicarse a la docencia. Ella piensa que su misión es contribuir a la enseñanza y que los niños adquieran nuevas habilidades que puedan ser utilizadas en su futuro.

Doña Ileana está solicitando el crédito para comprar perlines y zinc y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que actualmente está en muy mal estado.
texts.en:
Ileana H. is 50 years old and lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood in Managua. She's married to a security guard, and together they have a 14-year-old daughter. Ileana is a teacher at a public school in her city and has been making a living in the field for 26 years. She thinks that her mission is to contribute to children's education so they can acquire skills to help them in the future. Ileana is requesting the loan to purchase beams and zinc to put a new roof over her home, since the current one is in a very bad state.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a new roof on her home

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C., 49, sells groceries out of her home to neighbors in her village. Her husband, Mr Veasna Tum, 76, is a construction supervisor who always leaves home early in the morning to work to support the family. Together they have five children; three are employed and two are married.

Rom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike A. sells rechargeable phones and phone accessories. He purchases his goods from Lagos (Nigeria's largest city) to sell in Benin City. He started this business in 2006. 

He is 38 years old and married with four children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell. He hopes to expand his business. 

He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Bahmanli village. He is 50 years old and married with three children. Zakir has ten years of experience in cattle breeding business, and is requesting a loan so he can buy three calves to improve his business and his income.

loans.use: To purchase calves for breeding business

loans.name: Carmen Gabriela

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Carmen es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Carmen vende ropa de bebe en las ferias de la región, actividad que realiza junto a su mama, la ropa los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Carmen además esta preparándose para ingresar a la universidad desea estudiar Derecho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes para la campaña escolar.
Los sueños de Carmen son ayudar a sus padres, estudiar cocina y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank Lila. Carmen is single, is 20 years old, and lives with her parents. Carmen sells baby clothing at regional markets, an activity that she carries out with her mother. She acquires the clothing in the city of Lima. Carmen is also getting ready to being University and wishes to study Law. Carmen needs a loan of 800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of uniforms for the school year. Carmen’s dreams are to help her parents, study cooking, and to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase uniforms for the school year.

loans.name: Tyani

texts.en: Tyani M. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is 40 years old and a divorced mother with three children. Currently all but one of her children are in school. Grace has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc. in the local market of Kawabata for four years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, etc. to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. Grace also wants to use part of profit to acquire additional freezers to stock her products. She would be grateful for your support. It is her heart's desire to provide support for her children through the proceeds from her business. Grace belongs to a village bank called ‘Anigye’ which means ‘Happiness’. She hopes to receive GHS 900 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Married with three children in the community school, Catherine A. is a 39-year-old trader. She lives and does business in Eguase, which is a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. 

She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business six years ago. 

She has a strong customer base that she supplies with the food stuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and this has helped her to do away with middlemen. Through this, Catherine has been very helpful to her family. Out of the maize she also prepares fante kenkey and sells it by the roadside. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains with fish and any gravy or soup. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. 

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food/fuel crisis in the country. She believes she can buy more bags of maize grains with the loan. Catherine belongs to a group called called "Won som" which means "let all help." This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Keleta

texts.en: Keleta K., 38, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the Elei business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $132).  SPBD loans are Keleta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining the business. She is new and she needs some funding to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Victoria vende repuestos y lubricantes en su casa, en donde también se encuentra el taller mecánico de su esposo en donde brinda servicios de reparación de carros.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, jebes y pernos.
Victoria sueña con construir su casa y tener una tienda grande repuestos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Legión. Victoria lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has 1 child. Victoria sells spare parts and motor lubricants in her home where husband’s mechanic garage is also located and where he provides car repair services. Victoria needs a loan of 2100 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of motor oil, rubber gaskets, and bolts. Victoria dreams of building her own house, and having a large auto parts shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase motor oil, rubber gaskets, and bolts.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 27 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mahdi has selling fruits and vegetables for two years. Mahdi requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan. 
Mahdi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and has a good quality of merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mahdi decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mahdi will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: Simon vive en la colonia Yolaina , finca la Esperanza de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Compra de zinc), trabaja como obrero de campo desde hace 4 años, tiene 4 hijos, la mayor de 18 años estudia su 5to año, otra de 16 años estudia su 4to año,  la niña de 11 años estudia su 5to grado y el niño menor de 8 añitos estudia su 3er grado, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar; Don Simon es  responsable, honesto, trabajador, humilde, su sueño es  tener siempre buena salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para que sus hijos gozen de ella  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son muy humildes.
texts.en:
Simon lives in the settlement of Yolaina, on a farm called The Hope of New Guinea. He requests a second loan to be invested in home improvements (specifically for the purchase of zinc).

Simon has been a farm worker for four years. He has four children: an 18 year old daughter in her fifth year of secondary school, a 16 year old daughter in her fourth year of secondary school, an 11 year old daughter in fifth grade, and an 8 year old son in third grade. His wife takes care of the household chores. Don Simon is responsible, honest, hardworking, and humble. His dream is to always be in good health, have a nice home in the future with better living conditions for children to enjoy, and have a stable job so that he can support his humble family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a mother of three young children whose ages range from 2 to 7 years. Her dream is to grow her 10-year-old dress-making business to a larger scale by buying a large variety of materials, threads, buttons, and zippers. She currently has 2 machines and has hired one employee to help her with large orders. Joan specializes in ladies’ and children’s traditional clothing, aprons, and bags, and also takes custom orders from clients in her small shop in the Jubilee market of Kisumu.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, please use the following link: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Buying materials, threads, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Mrs. Liezel Camerinl is 37 years old. She is married to Mr. Aaron C. and lives in Central Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. The couple have been blessed with one child who is now 16 years old.

Liezel used to be a plain housewife who depended on her husband's income to cover their  household expenses, but she noticed that sometimes her husband's income was not enough for their needs. This made her think of ways to help her husband support their family. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, she decided to sell fish and "ginamos," a local delicacy made from salted and fermented krill, to the surrounding communities and around the town. It now earns her PHP 13,000 per month. Her earnings have made a big impact on improving her family's quality of life and she has even started saving for her child's college education.

Mrs. C. is now borrowing PHP 17,000 to increase her working capital and enable her to expand her business. This is Liezel C.'s 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Managing a bakery gives Erlinda B. a satisfying day. However, she is still hoping for further development to make her bakery more competitive. She would like to borrow PHP 35,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital. her business has been her partner in sending her children to school and also a big help in supporting the needs of their family. She was also able to employ some of her relatives in her bakery. 

Erlinda is 53 years old and very determined to become successful by maintaining her bakery. She loves the business and enjoys entertaining her customers. Erlinda is thankful because she was blessed with two children, Erickson and Ana Kristina, who will someday manage the business and are hoping for its success. Erlinda believes that patience is the key to success. When strategies in life are designed without patience, she says, nothing will happen.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a  mother of  3 children. Her children are 18, 16 and  5  years old.

Joyce has owned a food business selling tomatoes potatoes etc for 2 years, she works 10 hours a day and she  earns  a monthly profit  approximately 360,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This s Joyce`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000  Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, tomatoes, anion

loans.name: Francisco Rejis

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco C. vive en el Barrio de Marambure de Luque con sus tres hijos ya  todos mayores. Tiene una carpinteria en su domicilio hace  mas de diez años, en dicho taller fabrica muebles de todo tipo contribuyendo asi al ingreso familiar a traves de este rubro. El crédito de la Fundación Pya. Lo destinó a la compra de un motor para su cepilladora de madera.

loans.use: Para la compra de un motor para una cepilladora de madera

loans.name: Vaon

texts.en: Vaon V., 40, is married to Nhan Voeun, (pictured) age 51. Vaon V. is a local chef; she is also hired by people to cook food for their wedding parties. She usually earns an average US$3 a day to be managed all her family’s daily living needs, as another source of family income come from her husband, who sells rice husks that he buys from hulling machine. This couple is the good parents of five children; two of whom live separately and other three are dependent on their income. Vaon V. said that she also faces the transportation problem because she doesn’t have a vehicle for driving needs and she hopes to have a motorbike but she is not adequate money to buy one. Therefore, she is looking for contributors on Kiva through HKL to be used to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 42 years old. Doris is single. To make a living, Doris owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Doris has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Doris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Doris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Doris is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Doris from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina, a tricycle operator and a load retailer within the village of Rizal Santiago City, is married to Ruben and they are blessed with three children: Rose Marie - 13 years old; Ruben Jr.- 12 years old, and Roanne - seven years old.

Ludivina is thankful because her husband is very industrious, each of them having their own responsibilities at home. She would like to improve their standard of living through additional capital, so she is requesting a loan of Php9,000 from Kiva lenders. This loan amount will serve as a big help in achieving her goal.

loans.use: Additional capital for motorcycle transport

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a married woman and mother of 4 young children. She is 33 years old. She has been working as a home based tailor since 2002 and she provides tailoring services to the neighboring villages. Today, Khouloud is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy more textiles in order to develop her work.

loans.use: buy more textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies and an oven

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli C. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Araceli is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Araceli raises pigs to sell. Araceli has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $69 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Araceli joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Araceli is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support some of the members of her extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Marcelino V., a technician, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for more than a year now.

Myrna has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy assorted products for her store. Her business earns a profit of PHP 4,500 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her to expand her business by buying more stock of assorted snacks and beverages for her variety store.

She dreams that someday she will have her own grocery store and be able to help her children to finish college.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted snacks and beverages for her variety store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Ruth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a mini-grocery store. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $66 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional grocery items for her business. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more groceries to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge R. L. es casado con tres hijos en edad escolar, se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos de carga pesada, tiene amplia experiencia en dicha actividad, sus créditos que ha solicitado es para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge R. L. is married and has three, school-age children. He is a heavy vehicle mechanic; he has quite a bit of experience in this line of work. The loan he has requested will be used for building materials and supplies to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.
